Warning: Bears are wild animals that are dangerous and unpredictable. Do not approach bears or allow them to approach you!
Willfully approaching within 50 yards (150 feet), or any distance that disturbs or displaces a bear, is illegal in the park.Violation of this federal regulation can result in fines and arrest. Use binoculars, telephoto lens, or a spotting scope to view the animals.
Check the "Bear Closures" and "Bear Warnings" section of the Temporary Closures page before planning a hike in the park.

Attacks on humans are rare. If you are physically attacked by a black bear, fight back aggressively with any available object--the bear may consider you as prey! Do not "play dead." Help protect others by reporting all bear incidents to a park ranger immediately. Keep your distance from bears.

What Do I Do If I See A Bear?
Bears in the park or at your cabin are wild and their behavior can be unpredictable. Although extremely rare, attacks on humans have occurred, inflicting serious injuries and death. Treat bear encounters with extreme caution! Learn what to do if you see a bear by watching this short video.
If you see a bear:

Remain watchful.

Do not approach it

Do not allow the bear to approach you.

If your presence causes the bear to change its behavior (stops feeding, changes its travel direction, watches you, etc.) you are too close.

Being too close may promote aggressive behavior from the bear such as running toward you, making loud noises, or swatting the ground. The bear is demanding more space. Don't run, but slowly back away, watching the bear. Increase the distance between you and the bear. The bear will probably do the same.

If a bear persistently follows or approaches you, without vocalizing, or paw swatting:

Change your direction.

If the bear continues to follow you, stand your ground.

If the bear gets closer, talk loudly or shout at it.

Act aggressively to intimidate the bear.

Act together as a group if you have companions. Make yourselves look as large as possible (for example, move to higher ground).

Throw non-food objects such as rocks at the bear.

Use a deterrent such as a stout stick.

Don't run and don't turn away from the bear.

Don't leave food for the bear; this encourages further problems.

If the bear's behavior indicates that it is after your food and you are physically attacked:

Separate yourself from the food.

Slowly back away.

If the bear shows no interest in your food and you are physically attacked, the bear may consider you as prey:

Fight back aggressively with any available object!

Do not play dead!

Help protect others, report all bear incidents to a park ranger immediately. Above all, keep your distance from bears! 

Stay safe in black bear country! Please watch this short video.

 Black bears are dangerous and unpredictable wild animals. Do not approach bears or allow them to approach you.
Gary Carter Photo
Bears in the Smokies
Great Smoky Mountains National Park is one of the largest protected areas in the eastern United States where black bears can live in wild, natural surroundings.
Bears inhabit all elevations of the park. Though populations are variable, biologists estimate that roughly 1,500 bears live in the park. This equals a population density of approximately two bears per square mile. At one time, the black bear's range included most of North America except the extreme west coast. However loss of habitat has resulted in a significant reduction in this range.

Black bears in the Smokies are black in color, but in other parts of the country they may be brown or cinnamon. They may be six feet in length and up to three feet high at the shoulder. During the summer months, a typical adult male bear weighs approximately 250 pounds while adult females are generally smaller and weigh slightly over 100 pounds. However, bears may double their weight by the fall. Bears over 600 pounds have been documented in the park. Bears can live 12-15 years or more, however bears which have had access to human foods and garbage have a life expectancy of only half that time.

Bears, like humans, are omnivores. Plant materials such as berries and nuts make up approximately 85% of their diet. Insects and animal carrion provide valuable sources of protein for bears. 

Bears have color vision and a keen sense of smell. In addition, they are good tree climbers, can swim very well, and can run 30 miles per hour.

Bear Behavior
Bears are most active during early morning and late evening hours in spring and summer. Mating usually takes place in July. Both female and male bears may have more than one mate during the summer.

Bears choose a denning site with the coming of cold weather. Dens are usually hollow stumps, tree cavities, or wherever there is shelter. Bears in the Smokies are unusual in that they often den high above the ground in standing hollow trees. Bears do not truly hibernate, but enter long periods of sleep. They may leave the den for short periods if disturbed or during brief warming trends.

One to four cubs are born during the mother's winter sleep, usually in late January or early February. Bears weigh eight ounces at birth. Females with newly born cubs usually emerge from their winter dens in late March or early April. Commonly born in pairs, the cubs will remain with the mother for about eighteen months or until she mates again.
 
The park has replaced garbage cans with bear proof dumpsters to prevent bears from gaining access to garbage.

Garbage Kills Bears!
The bear's keen sense of smell leads it to insects, nuts and berries, but the animal is also enticed by the tantalizing smells of human food and garbage such as hot dogs, apple cores, chips, and watermelon rinds left on the ground in picnic areas, campgrounds, and along trails. Feeding bears or allowing them access to human food and garbage causes a number of problems:

It changes the bear's behavior and causes them to lose their instinctive fear of humans. Over time, these bears may begin approaching people in search of food and may become more unpredictable and dangerous.

Bears that obtain human food and garbage damage property and injure people. These bears pose a risk to public safety. They can also teach other bears this dangerous behavior. Often, they must be euthanized.

Studies have shown that bears that lose their fear of people by obtaining human food and garbage never live as long as bears that feed on natural foods and are shy and afraid of people. Many are hit by cars and become easy targets for poachers.

For these reasons, park rangers issue citations for littering, feeding bears, and for improper food storage. These citations can result in fines of up to $5,000 and jail sentences lasting up to six months. Visitors are urged to view all wildlife at a safe distance and to never throw food or garbage on the ground or leave it unattended. Garbage Kills Bears!
 
Help keep the bears wild. Do not feed bears. Remember, a fed bear is a dead bear!

Bear management is really people management. How visitors behave while in the park has an impact on the safety of bears. If you are careless with your food or litter, YOU may be responsible for a bear's death!
The park has done many things to make it easier for you to protect bears. Bear proof dumpsters or trash cans can be found in all campgrounds and picnic areas. Please use them to dispose of garbage.
During summer months, some of the busiest picnic areas close at 8:00 PM so these areas can be thoroughly cleaned before dark and any food scraps or trash left by careless visitors can be removed. Park rangers patrol picnic areas and campgrounds to enforce evening closures, littering and food storage regulations. They also strictly enforce regulations that prohibit approaching, harassing, disturbing or feeding bears.
An army of park volunteers patrol the park's most popular trails, picnic areas, and campgrounds to educate visitors about protecting bears. They confiscate unattended food or coolers and clean up food scraps left behind by careless visitors. These volunteers also assist in managing people during roadside bear jams.
In the backcountry, food storage cables have been installed to make it easier for backpackers to hang their food and garbage so that bears cannot get to it. At some campsites, telephone poles were flown into remote backcountry areas because the trees around the campsites were too small to set up an effective cable system!
The park's Resource Education staff provides information about bears at visitor centers, in the park's newspaper, and at evening programs. Educational signs about bears can be found on picnic tables throughout the park and bear safety videos are posted on this website.
Wildlife managers actively monitor for bear activity and use innovative and proactive techniques to keep bears shy, secretive, and afraid of people. This approach allows bears to remain in their home range, and discourages them from visiting developed areas or approaching people.
Results of these efforts are very encouraging. In some areas the number of bears that have to be trapped and moved away has decreased by ten fold!
What Can You Do To Protect Bears?

Dispose of all garbage or food scraps in bear proof garbage containers or take it with you.

Do not feed wildlife. Feeding a bear guarantees its demise!

Do not approach within 50 yards or any distance that disturbs a bear.

Do not allow bears to approach you (See "What Do I Do If I See A Bear?" above).

Use the food storage cables to store your food and garbage when camping in the backcountry.

If you see another visitor breaking these rules, or encounter a bear in a picnic area or campground, on a trail, or in any other developed area, please call (865) 436-1230 or stop at a Visitor Center to report it.

Other Threats to Bears

Non-Native Species: The European wild hog is one of the most direct threats to the black bear. These pervasive intruders feed on the acorns and other foods that are mainstays of bear diets. Another non-native species, the gypsy moth, is expanding its range toward the park. This insect defoliates oak trees, weakening them and leaving them susceptible to other insects and diseases which may kill the trees. Not only could bear's food source of acorns be affected, but some of the prime denning spots in old growth trees may be lost.

Poaching: Unfortunately, the lure of high profits on international markets encourages the poaching of black bears. Several cultures believe that bear gall bladders, paws, and claws have medicinal powers or consider them gourmet delicacies.

Urban Encroachment: Community and private developments near park boundaries are causing a loss in habitat for the bears. Poaching activities can be somewhat curtailed, and bear populations can eventually rebound from the losses. But once the critical habitats are destroyed, major declines in bear populations are inevitable. In addition, bears that venture outside park boundaries into neighboring communities may encounter human food and become unpredictable, dangerous, and a threat to human safety.

 Additional Information
 Wildlife Watching in the Park 
Every year park animals must be destroyed because of mistakes humans make. Learn how to protect park wildlife.

Learn More About Black Bear Research in the Park
Scientists at the University of Tennessee discuss work they conducted through 2009.


HOT TUB COVER cost several hundreds of dollars do NOT stand on it sit on it sleep on it and do NOT let your kids play on it it will break it in and you will be charged for the cost I paid $430 for this cover.
Hot tub I cannot guarantee that the hot tub will be working for every guest. They do break down by agreeing to this you cannot leave me a bad review over a hot tub. I have no control over when they break down. It's only happened twice in two years it is rare but it can't happen.

Hot Tub Rules and Policies

For your safety and protection, please read these rules and precautions prior to using the hot tub.

When using the hot tub, basic safety precautions should always be observed including the following:
As a result of cleaning and servicing, hot tubs are sometimes not up to full temperature at the time of check in and may need several hours to heat. Please do not adjust the temperature of the water in the hot tub. The Maximum safe operating water temperature for a hot tub is 104 degrees Fahrenheit.  You may adjust the jets and lights as desired.
Do not use, or allow the hot tub to be used, alone. Do not permit children under the age of eighteen (18) to use the hot tub unless they are closely supervised at all times. Unsupervised use by children is strictly prohibited. In no case should children under the age of eight (8) be permitted in the hot tub. Never leave children unattended in the vicinity of the hot tub.
Pregnant women and individuals under medical care (for such problems as heart disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, skin sensitivities, cardiac or circulatory problems) should consult their physician prior to using the hot tub. Never use the hot tub when taking anticoagulants, antihistamines, vasoconstrictors, vasodilators, stimulants, narcotics or tranquilizers. In all cases, if you are not thoroughly familiar with the medication(s) that you are taking, please consult with your physician prior to using the hot tub.
Guest(s) with skin, ear, genital or other body infections, skin sores, or open wounds are not allowed to use the hot tub due to the possibility of spreading infection.
It is recommended that guest(s) shower before and after using the hot tub. Showering before use removes any lotions, deodorants, creams and/or common skin bacteria which reduce the effectiveness of the sanitizing chemicals used to disinfect the hot tub water. The hot tub is professionally cleaned and maintained; please do not add any chemicals.
Long hair should be restrained in a bathing cap or other restraining device. Never allow long hair to float in the hot tub. Suction through the drains and skimmers can be powerful. It is recommended that no jewelry is worn in the hot tub due to the chemicals used. The chemicals in hot tubs can also affect color-treated hair and damage swimsuits.
Always use caution when entering and exiting the hot tub. Surrounding patio/deck may be slippery and dangerous when wet.
Soaking for too long at high water temperatures can elevate body temperature and the temperature of internal organs beyond safe limits. Observe reasonable time limits to avoid nausea, dizziness and fainting. Should you experience any of these symptoms, carefully exit the hot tub immediately.
Alcoholic beverages should not be consumed before or during hot tub use. The temperature of the water may intensify the effects of alcohol and cause drowsiness, dizziness and/or unconsciousness.
Never use glass near or in the hot tub as broken glass can be a risk to a guest(s) which are barefoot and is very difficult to see within the hot tub.
Never walk, climb, play or jump on the cover of the hot tub. Never swim or play under the cover when it is installed on the hot tub. Also, do not rely on the cover as a way of keeping children out of the hot tub. Children must be supervised when they are in or around the hot tub. No diving or jumping into the hot tub.
Do not add anything to the water including foaming bubbles, chemicals, soaps, bath oils, etc. If these items are used in the hot tubs, an additional cleaning fee will be assessed.
Absolutely no candles (floating or any type) are allowed on or in the hot tub.
Absolutely no shoes are to be worn in the hot tub.
Absolutely no electrical appliances should be used in or near the hot tub.
When the hot tub is not in use, the cover must be reinstalled in the proper position and secured, especially if there are any children in the vicinity. Hot tub covers are easily damaged. Guest(s) agree(s) to inspect the hot tub cover for any damage upon arrival and report any problems to the owners immediately.
Please do not turn off or unplug the hot tub. This can interfere with maintaining the cleanliness and temperature of the unit.
Guest(s) agrees to leave the hot tub in the same condition it was received. If cleaning and/or repairs are required due to negligence or abuse, guest(s) will be required to pay for the cleaning and/or repairs.
Guest(s) understands there will be no reduction in rental fees if the hot tub is unused or unavailable during the term of Lessee's rental period.
The owners of Michael Ryion accept no responsibility for the use of this hot tub by any guest(s).


Traveler insurance

Whether you need to travel interstate, overseas or to another city for business or for personal reasons, any trip away from your home involves planning, expense and some risk.

Travel insurance can cover you for financial losses caused by a wide range of events that can affect your trip, whether they occur before, during or even after your trip. These might include travel modification, cancellation or interruption, medical expenses, baggage damage or theft, and more.

Travel insurance should be a priority in all travel arrangements, whether you travel regularly, occasionally or you are setting off on a once-in-a-lifetime trip.

For international journeys, the Australian Government advises that travel insurance is as important as a passport, regardless of your destination.

You should purchase a travel insurance policy as soon as you have paid for you trip. That way you may be covered for unused travel and accommodation in the event that you must cancel your trip due to a covered event, such as illness or a natural disaster.

Most travel insurers offer policies that cover families and couples, and some also offer multi-trip and annual policies for frequent travellers.

description: Welcome to LASTING VIEW Lodge! Our beautiful Chalet style lodge which is located in "Chalet Village North" near Ober Gatlinburg features some of the best 180 degree panoramic views the Smokies has to offer! Our updated lodge boasts  RARE spacious flat parking, three Clubhouses with Pool access, and 5 star views from EVERY room in the house! The short drive to all the Downtown action is only 3 miles from your front door. Your next mountain experience awaits you at the LASTING VIEW Lodge!The spacePanoramic Mountain Views | Mt LeConte Views | Keyless Entry | Grill | Wifi | Cable | Hot Tub | Barrel ARCADE Games | Clubhouse/Summer Pool Access | Rare Flat Parking with only one step | Only 3 Miles/10 Minutes to Downtown Gatlinburg!When you drive up to Lasting View Lodge you will be met with convenient flat parking and one step to enter the lodge. Upon entering you will be greeted with a  large cathedral ceiling,  stained tongue and groove, and large windows with amazing views of the Smoky Mountain National Park! The open concept of the living, kitchen, and dining make our lodge perfect for entertaining and enjoying one another’s company while you watch the  big game on the 55” large flat screen or just take in the views which never gets old. The living room offers a large sectional with three built in recliners and a natural gas burning fireplace which is surrounded by natural stone. The large island, coffee station, and fully stocked kitchen is only steps away which features all granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. The dining area is also just steps away or why not dine outside with your sweetheart at the two person table overlooking the smokies on the back deck! The master bedroom offers a king size bed, 55” TV with sound bar, en-suite bathroom with custom tiled shower, and of course DIRECT views of the Smokies as you relax after your adventurous day! The spare bedroom features a flat screen TV,  BRAND NEW Barrel Arcade Game, gorgeous King log bed, half bath, and unbelievable views of the Smokies! Let's not forget the back deck which stretches the entire length of the lodge and offers rocking chairs, seasonal fire pit, Jacuzzi Hot Tub, 5 burner gas grill, 2 person pub style table…. and of course 180 degrees of mountain views! On top of all that you will also get access to the 3 Clubhouses within the Chalet Village Neighborhood where pools, game rooms, and Tennis Courts are offered. Let your adventures and relaxation begin at the one and only Lasting View Lodge, Gatlinburg TN. The Mountains are Calling! Chalet Village North does have new cabin construction taking place due to the fires that took place in Gatlinburg a few years back.
transit: You will be in the highly sought after CHALET VILLAGE Neighborhood! All paved roads leading up to the cabin and easy parking for 2 vehicles. No campers or trailers allowed. AWD is only recommended during winter months due to potential snowfall and mountain terrain.

description: With its prime location, gorgeous setting and abundant luxuries, Autumn Ridge promises to be the perfect home base for your dream vacation. Start with the Great Smoky Mountains National Park and all the year-round adventures the park has to offer, or in less than ten minutes you can be skiing, ice skating or snowboarding at Ober Gatlinburg Amusement Park and Ski area! During the warmer months, hikers, bikers and horseback riders can take advantage of the plethora of trails or tour some of the abundant clear mountain streams and rivers for trout fishing, tubing, kayaking and canoeing. Whether you're looking for adventure or relaxation, there is truly something for everyone!  Autumn Ridge itself adds luxury to log cabin living with three covered decks, soaring ceilings and a magnificent, stacked stone fireplace. After a day's adventuring, curl up on the sumptuous leather living room furniture to enjoy a movie on the large cable TV, or make your friends jealous by posting amazing photos on your Instagram page courtesy of the free Wi-Fi. The huge, eat-in kitchen features a long farmhouse table, stainless-steel appliances and everything you need to whip up anything from a simple snack to a lavish brunch. Or if barbecuing is more your thing, fire up the gas grill and enjoy the sensational mountain views from the deck while you breathe in the fresh, woodsy air. The kids will love the loft area, where they can spread out and enjoy the gaming and pool tables. And your whole group will love relaxing in the hot tub after a day of hiking or skiing!  With room to sleep six, Autumn Ridge's spacious bedrooms are both furnished with king-size beds, flat-screen TVs and ceiling fans. The primary bedroom features an in-room gas fireplace. Plus, two full bathrooms mean no waiting in line for the shower in the mornings! There's a half-bath for extra convenience, and a laundry room with washer and dryer.   After a day of adventuring, you'll be glad to return to the comfort, peace and convenience of Autumn Ridge. description: Enhance your romantic getaway to the Smoky Mountain area while staying at 'Two Hearts,' a custom-built vacation rental studio cabin in Gatlinburg. Perfect for 2, this cabin is a cozy mountain retreat featuring a 2-person hot tub and scenic views from the covered porch. Take a ride on the Sky Lift or tour the aquarium in downtown less than 10 minutes away. Entertainment in Pigeon Forge is just 25 minutes away, so put on your adventurer hat and visit Dollywood, Wonderworks, or the Titanic Museum!The spaceStudio: King Bed "Two Hearts" is a well-appointed studio cabin and your new favorite home-away-from-home in the heart of the Smoky Mountains. Pack your bags and come enjoy a memorable getaway with your travel partner! Warm wood paneling  lines the interior of this single-story cabin and enhances a charming alpine atmosphere. For a quiet evening in, grab a seat on the couch to watch a new movie on the 55-inch flat-screen cable Smart TV. If you're a bookworm, you'll want to turn on the stacked stone gas fireplace so you can cozy up with a new novel. Let your mind and body relax with a long soak in the 2-person hot tub on the covered porch or in the heart-shaped jacuzzi tub.When you're feeling hungry, grab your sous chef and prepare a home-cooked meal with ease in the fully equipped kitchen. Need inspiration? Connect to the complimentary wireless internet to search for a new recipe. If you plan to hike in Smoky Mountain National Park, the king-sized bed is sure to provide you with a sound sleep no matter how long the stay.Other things to noteKey Residence Features:- Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, 2-person private hot tub, porch with mountain views, 55-inch flat-screen cable Smart TV, free WiFi, 2-car driveway parking, access to the community pool, picnic area, basketball court, and more - Peaceful Gatlinburg location just 10 minutes from downtown attractions, 15 minutes from the Sugarlands Visitor Center, 25 minutes from Pigeon Forge and more - Nearest Commercial Airport: McGhee Tyson Airport, 2055 Alcoa Hwy, Alcoa, TN 37701 (48 miles from property)

description: The name says it all! This beautiful cabin is built just for 2, with a deck and hot tub overlooking the magnificent Smokies, a heart-shaped jacuzzi, a gas fireplace, and all the comforts of home!   Cuddle Bear offers warm-toned natural wood throughout, creating a cozy and welcoming vibe that begins with the king-sized bed and includes a full laundry room, well-equipped kitchen, and even a flat-screen TV with satellite. If you've ever wished for a perfect mountaintop hideaway, rustic yet equipped with all the modern conveniences, you've already seen Cuddle Bear in your dreams!   Set at the top of a valley with panoramic views of the Great Smoky Mountains, Cuddle Bear is snug, spotless, and perfectly appointed. Park right up front and enter the kitchen and dining area, where full-sized appliances and nice time-savers such as a microwave, blender, toaster, and coffeemaker await you. Open the cupboards to find the full complement of cookware, dishes, utensils, and chef's tools. Stash your nibbles and noshes in the fridge, and you're all set for the vacation of a lifetime!   The dining table for two, set beside a large window where birds will serenade you among the greenery, is just right for candlelight dinners. Of course, it also makes a great place for games of gin rummy, jigsaw puzzles, laptops and tablets. You may find yourself lingering here in the morning, savoring that first cup of coffee before venturing out into the beautiful countryside.   Beyond the kitchen and dining area are the combination living room, bedroom, and all-purpose relaxation center! Your eye will naturally be drawn to the heart-shaped Jacuzzi occupying pride of place among several windows. This jetted tub is made for two, and no better remedy exists for aching muscles at the end of a fun day in the mountains or in downtown Gatlinburg. Light a few candles, put on some music, and sink into bubbly bliss with world-class views of the mountains.   The loveseat is another place you will want to sink into gratefully after a busy day. Facing the flat-screen TV, it has been responsible for many a long, impromptu nap! Get a blaze going in the majestic stone fireplace, lower the lights, and you will feel your eyelids dropping! The views from the loveseat are incomparable as well -- it's as if nature were coming to you instead of the other way around!   And when it's time for bed, the king-sized bed at Cuddle Bear promises you both a great night's sleep. All linens and towels are provided here at the cabin, and you will savor the feel of these quality sheets and pillowcases. Snuggle in for a little much-needed hibernation in your warm mountain den!   Of course, your favorite part of Cuddle Bear might not be indoors at all. The deck is the jewel in the crown, with its sweeping mountain views, hypnotic porch swing, and luxurious hot tub. No matter what season you choose for your Gatlinburg visit, the landscape is awe-inspiring: wildflowers in spring, lush greenery in summer, brilliant leaves in autumn, and snowcaps in winter. It's a view you will never get tired of, and one that will stay with you your whole life.   And when you stay at Cuddle Bear, you're just a short drive from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, the source of all types of outdoor enjoyment -- on foot, by bike, or by car. Downtown Gatlinburg is also at your beck and call, with its myriad of attractions (including the latest: Anakeesta). Whether you fancy ziplines, birdwatching, bargain hunting, creekside picnics, or a little bit of everything, you will find your bliss at Cuddle Bear. Come discover Gatlinburg in a mountaintop hideaway for two! Book Cuddle Bear today. Please Note: Cuddle Bear does not have internet. Other things to noteThe name says it all! This beautiful cabin is built just for 2, with a deck and hot tub overlooking the magnificent Smokies, a heart-shaped jacuzzi, a gas fireplace, and all the comforts of home!   Cuddle Bear offers warm-toned natural wood throughout, creating a cozy and welcoming vibe that begins with the king-sized bed and includes a full laundry room, well-equipped kitchen, and even a flat-screen TV with satellite. If you've ever wished for a perfect mountaintop hideaway, rustic yet equipped with all the modern conveniences, you've already seen Cuddle Bear in your dreams!   Set at the top of a valley with panoramic views of the Great Smoky Mountains, Cuddle Bear is snug, spotless, and perfectly appointed. Park right up front and enter the kitchen and dining area, where full-sized appliances and nice time-savers such as a microwave, blender, toaster, and coffeemaker await you. Open the cupboards to find the full complement of cookware, dishes, utensils, and chef's tools. Stash your nibbles and noshes in the fridge, and you're all set for the vacation of a lifetime!   The dining table for two, set beside a large window where birds will serenade you among the greenery, is just right for candlelight dinners. Of course, it also makes a great place for games of gin rummy, jigsaw puzzles, laptops and tablets. You may find yourself lingering here in the morning, savoring that first cup of coffee before venturing out into the beautiful countryside.   Beyond the kitchen and dining area are the combination living room, bedroom, and all-purpose relaxation center! Your eye will naturally be drawn to the heart-shaped Jacuzzi occupying pride of place among several windows. This jetted tub is made for two, and no better remedy exists for aching muscles at the end of a fun day in the mountains or in downtown Gatlinburg. Light a few candles, put on some music, and sink into bubbly bliss with world-class views of the mountains.   The loveseat is another place you will want to sink into gratefully after a busy day. Facing the flat-screen TV, it has been responsible for many a long, impromptu nap! Get a blaze going in the majestic stone fireplace, lower the lights, and you will feel your eyelids dropping! The views from the loveseat are incomparable as well -- it's as if nature were coming to you instead of the other way around!   And when it's time for bed, the king-sized bed at Cuddle Bear promises you both a great night's sleep. All linens and towels are provided here at the cabin, and you will savor the feel of these quality sheets and pillowcases. Snuggle in for a little much-needed hibernation in your warm mountain den!   Of course, your favorite part of Cuddle Bear might not be indoors at all. The deck is the jewel in the crown, with its sweeping mountain views, hypnotic porch swing, and luxurious hot tub. No matter what season you choose for your Gatlinburg visit, the landscape is awe-inspiring: wildflowers in spring, lush greenery in summer, brilliant leaves in autumn, and snowcaps in winter. It's a view you will never get tired of, and one that will stay with you your whole life.   And when you stay at Cuddle Bear, you're just a short drive from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, the source of all types of outdoor enjoyment -- on foot, by bike, or by car. Downtown Gatlinburg is also at your beck and call, with its myriad of attractions (including the latest: Anakeesta). Whether you fancy ziplines, birdwatching, bargain hunting, creekside picnics, or a little bit of everything, you will find your bliss at Cuddle Bear. Come discover Gatlinburg in a mountaintop hideaway for two! Book Cuddle Bear today. Please Note: Cuddle Bear does not have internet.

name: MOUNTAINTOP ROMANCE Cutest Log Cabin on the Mtn
amenities: TV,Air conditioning,Indoor fireplace,Smoke alarm,Fire extinguisher,First aid kit,Wifi,Kitchen - Space where guests can cook their own meals,BBQ grill,Free parking on premises,Hot tub
description: Transport yourself to your own private hideaway on the top of the mountain. Romantically nestled in the woods, this authentic log cabin is located half way between Gatlinburg (6mi) & Pigeon Forge (5mi) this studio cabin has a full kitchen, wood burning fireplace, jacuzzi tub, private outdoor jacuzzi, luxurious king bed and roku TV. Escape to your own slice of rustic paradise, surrounded by the stunning tranquility of the Great Smoky MountainsThe space“Mountaintop Romance” is designed as a romantic and cozy getaway for couples young and old. Relax, unwind and make lasting memories with the one you love!  You can enjoy apparent seclusion all while being with 15 mins of the main attractions in both Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge. The cabin is located at the top of persimmon mountain at the end of a private road with only 4 other small cabins. Smell the flowers, listen to the birds chirp and enjoy a strong chance to witness the magic of a momma bear and her cubs wondering the area. We are also easy to get to on back roads which can be very handy as a way to avoid the bumper to bumper traffic on the parkway.The cabin is located on top of a private road. We are in a very limited signal area and rely on Viperbroadband for WiFI and Roku TV streaming. WIFI can be spotty and is slower than off the mountain. If you do plan to work or are in need of phone service at all times while in the cabin it would be wise to book elsewhere. Mountaintop Romance is for those wanting to unplug and enjoy the mountains.  Cellular service can be iffy so it is recommended you connect to WiFi calling once you reach the cabin. We are a true mountain log cabin and the majority of cabins in the area do not provide internet but we are providing the best available for us at this time. **NOTE: the last 1/4 mile to the cabin is on a gravel road, there is a curve which does require a three point turn half way up (please see pictures in listing for images of the road and sharp left turn). The vast majority of our guests have no issues at all with the driveway and to us it is part of the mountain experience, however if you are uncomfortable with driving on an inclined gravel road this is not the cabin for you. If you are looking for a true couples' mountain getaway we cannot wait to host you!Guest accessKeypad code given to guests for easy and convenient self check in

description: Nestled in the Smoky Mountains just outside of Gatlinburg, the newly built Le Beau Chateau is the perfect honeymoon, romantic getaway or small family vacation location. Guests will enjoy the open layout main floor that includes a kitchen, dining area and sofa to curl up and enjoy the warmth of the fireplace. In the lower level you will find a welcoming king sized bed in the master suite and the master ensuite. Both floors of the cabin are equipped with three sets of sliding french doors that open up to beautiful views from the decks. Enjoy the spa on the lower patio overlooking the gorgeous landscape. Le Beau Chateau is only 10 minutes away from both downtown Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge.
additional_house_rules: All guests are required to sign our Rental Agreement.
transit: From Pigeon Forge (southbound) take the US-321 S/US-441 N/Parkway to Flat Branch Rd. The Flat Branch Rd exit is on the right hand side of the highway right after you go under the bridge. Stay left on the single lane Flat Branch Rd, going past Flat Branch Cottages. Take a sharp left onto Hemlock Drive. From this point you are on single lane roads. When two vehicles are approaching each other, one vehicle needs to pull off to the side. Follow Hemlock Drive for approximately 1 mile until you reach Chestnut Lane. You made it!! Le Beau Chateau is the first cabin on the corner on the left.From Gatlinburg (northbound) take the US-321 S/US-441 N/Parkway to Huskey Grove Rd. The exit is on the left hand side of the highway. Just after you turn through the U shaped exit you'll take the first right to go across the bridge. After the bridge, take your next right on Flat Branch Road, going past Flat Branch Cottages. From this point you are on single lane roads. When two vehicles are approaching each other, one vehicle needs to pull off to the side. Take your next left onto Hemlock Drive. Follow Hemlock Drive for approximately 1 mile until you reach Chestnut Lane. You made it!! Le Beau Chateau is the first cabin on the corner on the left.

description: Welcome to "Above the Clouds" - where views literally seems to span above the clouds and into the mountaintops! Our modern 2 BD/2 BATH  cabin (sleeps 5) is the perfect headquarters for your Smoky Mountain Vacation!  Enjoy your evenings relaxing by the outdoor firepit, soaking in the private hot tub or sauna, or taking in the gorgeous mountain views.  And, our cabin is perfect for entertaining your family & friends too- with an air hockey/pool table and foosball, there's something for everyone!The spaceOur beautiful cabin is just a short drive into Pigeon Forge, where you are  minutes from all of the best activities, entertainment, hiking trails, and restaurants that the Smoky Mountain area has to offer. With our spacious home and modern amenities, relaxation begins the minute you drive up to "Above the Clouds."  This cabin is ideal for a romantic get-a-way or a special family vacation - so pack your bags -- the mountains are calling!! ★ LIVING ROOM & INDOOR SPACE★This two-level home offers entertainment spaces on separate floors, which is just perfect for gathering with your friends and family, but still allows you to spread out and relax!  Enjoy plush couches, fireplaces in both the living room and master bedroom, soaking jacuzzi tub with views, sauna, large flat screen TVs, free Wi-Fi, and more!★BEDROOMS and BATHROOMS★Bedroom #1 (Main Level):  King guest suite with king bed, fireplace, flat screen TV, access to outdoor deck and seating area, and attached full bathroom with a large walk in shower Bedroom #2 (Upstairs Loft): Twin-over-Queen bunk bed; Flat screen TV; Private bathroom with shower★ KITCHEN & DINING★Fully equipped modern kitchen with new appliances, dishwasher, full size refrigerator, coffee maker, blender, Crockpot, toaster, grilling utensils and wooden family dining table  ★ OUTDOOR LIVING★Relaxation calls! Enjoy amazing scenic views from the covered deck, which hosts a bubbling hot tub, couch and seating area. Off the deck, you will also find propane BBQ grill and large picnic table, perfect for outdoor meals. There's also a large fire pit, perfect for cooking up some smores and snuggling by the fire. ★ ENTERTAINMENT & AMENITIES ★In addition to all the outdoor amenities, inside the cabin you will find multiple flat screen TV’s, free WIFI, a combination pool table/air hockey table and a foosball table! In addition, you can relax in the jacuzzi tub, the sauna, or both! ★ GENERAL★Complimentary toiletries, linens/towels, free WiFi, air conditioning, central heat, washer and dryer★PARKING★Parking is available that will accommodate 2 vehicles.★COUPONS AND DISCOUNTS★Shortly before you arrive I'll send you a coupon book with dozens and dozens of discounts for all of the top attractions in the area.  This includes the best dinner shows, pancake restaurants, adventure parks, museums and even an exotic animal park.  If you want inspiration for your vacation activities, this will definitely give you enough for your visit!★COOL THINGS TO DO IN THE AREA★Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg and Sevierville are the three main cities that comprise the area.  Everything is spread out a bit and there are amazing things to keep you busy...- World class hiking trails of all types and skill levels- Dollywood theme park (of course!)- Putt putt, go karts and pancake restaurants on every corner- Amazing dinner shows to entertain kids of all ages- Museums of all types:  classic cars, Alcatraz, Titanic and several childrens' museums- Restaurants of all types... Always come hungry because serving sizes are HUGE!Other things to noteThe last little stretch to the house is a gravel road on a hill.  A 4wd isn't required but is always welcomed, especially in icy weather.
additional_house_rules:

Any pets or extra people brought to the cabin are a rules violation and will result in an extra charge of $500 and immediate removal with no refund.

WAIVER OF LIABILITY: You understand use of the sauna an/or hot tub is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved in using either or both. You accept full responsibility for any bodily injury arising from use of the hot tub and sauna and hold owner harmless. You understand there are potential dangers that the hot tub or sauna may present to children who are not carefully supervised, as well as the danger to any person using the hot tub or sauna, or if a person has health risks, or if a person uses the hot tub or sauna while intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or uses the hot tub if pregnant. No person under 18 years of age is allowed to use the sauna.
interaction: We provide support generally via the app/this web site and phone support is there for emergencies. Expect a prompt response.
transit: The mountain roads to all the cabins are windy and you'll want to take it slow.  If there is hard ice on the roads (very rare as the sun burns it off) you'd want 4wd.  But I'd give that advice for any mountain cabin and not just this one. Let me know if you have any further questions and I'll be happy to help.

description: Welcome to Metal Manor! Our gorgeous, newly constructed 3 story cabin is located in desirable Chalet Village, just 3 miles from downtown Gatlinburg and 20 minutes to Dollywood. You will enjoy comfort and privacy in one of the 3 king bedrooms with en suite bathrooms, each on it's own level. There is also a 1/2 bath on each level for guest's use while playing a game of pool in the game room or challenging your friends to a little Texas Hold'em on the poker table in the upstairs loft.The spaceMain Floor: • Open concept kitchen and living room with Smart TV and electric fireplace • Comfortable queen sleeper sofa• Large kitchen is equipped with everything you need to prepare a gourmet meal for your party• Dining table for 5 along with bar seating for 4. • 1/2 bathroom• King bedroom with en suite bathroom and smart TV• Access to main level deck with outdoor seatingLower Level: • Game room with 3000 game barrel multicade, pool table, 65" smart TV, custom bar top with seating for 3 • 1/2 bathroom• King bedroom with en suite bathroom and smart TV• Full size Washer and Dryer • Access to lower deck with 4 person hot tub and outdoor seatingUpper Level:• Poker table with seating for 4. The table top can be flipped to a flat surface for board games or dominoes• Loveseat and chair sitting area with 65" smart TV• 1/2 bathroom• King bedroom with en suite bathroom and smart TVAirport: McGhee Tyson Airport in Knoxville is a 1 hour drive to our cabin and is the recommended airport to fly into if you’re coming to the Smokies. Access: The front door is equipped with an electronic keypad. You will get a unique door code a couple days before check-in, no need to meet anyone for keys.Roads: The road is paved all the way from the main road to the cabin. Although snow here is rare, in the winter, 4WD or AWD may be necessary. Cell service is spotty in the mountains, we highly recommend you download the maps of the area for offline use prior to travel, just in case service is lost. Parking: Park immediately in front of the cabin. Parking is available for 3 cars. Age: All guests must be 25+ with the exception of children with their parents. Occupancy: 8 Person Maximum, including children and infants.Security Camera: There is a security camera on the front of the cabin in place for your protection. If you touch or tamper with the camera or disconnect the Wifi, you will be asked to leave the property immediately. This is for your protection. Smoking: This is a NON-SMOKING/VAPING cabin. Weather: No refunds for weather/natural disasters/power outages/other things that are beyond our control. Please purchase travel insurance for coverage. Hot Tub: Our tub will accommodate 4 people. The hot tub is for guests 18 and over only. Alcohol and glassware are NOT allowed near the hot tub. You are not allowed to use the hot tub if you have consumed alcohol or if you are pregnant. Do not dive headfirst into the hot tub. Use the hot tub AT YOUR OWN RISK! Please refer to the hot tub rules posted in the patio for further details. Our housekeeper drains, cleans and refills the hot tub before your stay; therefore, it may not be warm when you arrive.Outdoor Grill: A large park style charcoal grill is provided for your use. Bring your own charcoal. Please clean out the grill after use into the bucket provided.Trash: Please dump liquids into the sink and not into trash bags. Place all trash into trash bags and secure them in the bearproof trash containers next to the driveway. We do not have regularly scheduled trash pick-ups. If needed, there is a trash drop-off convenience center at Ski Mountain Road & Heiden Rd.Critters: We subscribe to monthly pest control, however this cabin is in the wilderness, and with that comes bugs and other wild animals, including bears and snakes. Please practice bear safety (guidelines will be posted on the refrigerator). Remember to keep your doors locked, throw trash in the bear-proof containers, don't feed or try to approach a bear, and don't leave any food outdoors, including on the grill nor in your car. Pets: Pets are NOT allowed. We love pets, however some of our family members and guests are very allergic to pet dander. Please be considerate and make alternate vacation arrangements for your furry family members. There are many pet-friendly cabins in the area that would love to host your family. Check In/Out: Check-in at 4:00 PM. Check-out at 10:00 AM. We do not offer early check-in nor late check-out. We do not allow check-ins nor check-outs on holidays. We provide a starter pack consisting of dishwasher tablets, paper towels, toilet paper, trash bags, kitchen sponge, and K-cup pods. Shampoo and other toiletries, condiments, ground coffee, creamer, sugar, zip lock bags, and charcoal are NOT provided.Guest accessYou will have access to our entire home.

description: **Come socially distance in the beautiful Smoky Mountains!  Pet friendly cabin!  Bring up to 2 dogs with you during your stay.  Dogs must be kept with you or in a kennel when you leave the cabin.  No additional fee for your furry friend.**Perfect for both a romantic getaway and a weekend away with the family, Cozy Bear Lodge is the perfect Smoky Mountain cabin for a TRUE mountain experience.  It's a very large 1 BR (sleeps 6) with wifi, a hot tub and tons of space.The spaceCozy Bear Lodge is central between Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge and just 6 miles away from the action.  But it FEELS isolated, being in the middle of the woods and hills.The cabin is located deep in the woods, down a beautiful and winding mountain road.   It's located directly between Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg, so it's right where you want to be.  Getting there, you even cross a small creek and pond...  It's perfect for having your "cabin" experience in the Smoky Mountains! You can take in the birds and trees from rockers on both the front and back porches, soak in the hot tub after a long day hiking/shopping, or relax with the TV and pool table or even play a game on the arcade  (Netflix, Disney+ and YouTube TV are all logged in and ready to go).The cabin itself is appointed just as you'd hope and is huge for a 1 bedroom (1386 sf) so you never feel cramped for space.  Upstairs is the open living area with soaring ceilings and plenty of windows to let the light in.  A sleeper sofa and comfy chair frame the gas fireplace so everyone can stay warm on those cold evenings.  Also, the kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need - Keurig and a coffee maker, pots, pans, silverware, glasses, blender, crock pot, microwave, iron and board, washer and dryer. Just bring any food you want and you're all set.There is a 4 burner propane bbq grill on the porch with all the tools you need to grill up a tasty meal, if that's your preference.  (Propane take will be there but you may need to swap it out)The two flat screen TVs have Netflix/YouTube TV/Disney+ hooked up and of course there is wifi so you stay connected.  (But ONLY if you want to!)The bedroom features a king bed with extra comfy mattress, which is perfect for getting a great night of sleep.  If you're feeling in the mood (hint-hint guys looking for brownie points), an in-room Jacuzzi tub is perfect for that.   (There is a full shower+bath here too!) We recently added a second sleeper sofa and table to the room just in case you either want to relax or bring along an extra person or two.  On the outside, there's a private hot tub on the porch to warm your muscles and help you relax after a long day exploring the area.  Keep your eyes open because if you're lucky, every week or two guests spot a black bear (Dolly) and her cubs walking by!! When you're done relaxing in the hills, the entire area is chock full of things to see and do. Head to Great Smoky Mountains National Park for a long hike and your eyes peeled for wildflowers, white-tailed deer and 60+ species of birds that are there year round. If it happens to be rainy, climb into your car and take a drive through the park for glimpses of historic buildings dating back to the 1800s. In either case, pack a picnic lunch and make a day of it!Dollywood is the beating heart in the area and has something for all ages, whether it be amusement park rides or fun live entertainment. Gatlinburg Golf Course is there if you have a desire to get in a few holes... But most don't know that there is a Harrah's Casino a short drive away in Cherokee, NC. And of course you can ski at Ober in Gatlinburg as well as Cataloochee Ski Area in North Carolina if you want to get some half decent shredding action.**  I want to note that if there is snow/ice on the ground, you will want a 4WD vehicle.  The Smoky Mountains are very hilly and the cabin is on a hill too.  I'm not aware of any wrecks due to weather but I definitely want you to be safe! **Also, our team will be following all CDC guidelines on cleaning & using EPA registered products to thoroughly clean & disinfect so you can feel more comfortable staying at our cabin.For a couple seeking a relaxing and romantic retreat or a small family looking for a getaway, there's no better place than here in the Smoky Mountains. Don't miss out on Cozy Bear Lodge - book your stay now!★COUPONS AND DISCOUNTS★Shortly before you arrive I'll send you a coupon book with dozens and dozens of discounts for all of the top attractions in the area.  This includes the best dinner shows, pancake restaurants, adventure parks, museums and even an exotic animal park.  If you want inspiration for your vacation activities, this will definitely give you enough for your visit!★COOL THINGS TO DO IN THE AREA★Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg and Sevierville are the three main cities that comprise the area.  Everything is spread out a bit and there are amazing things to keep you busy...- World class hiking trails of all types and skill levels- Dollywood theme park (of course!)- Putt putt, go karts and pancake restaurants on every corner- Amazing dinner shows to entertain kids of all ages- Museums of all types:  classic cars, Alcatraz, Titanic and several childrens' museums- Restaurants of all types... Always come hungry because serving sizes are HUGE!Guest accessThe cabin is exclusively yours for the duration of your stay, so relax, unwind, and make yourself at home. It's worth repeating... Our cabin features:✔ High-Speed Wi-Fi✔ Hot Tub✔ Arcade✔ Washer/Dryer✔ Free Private ParkingOther things to note***  The entire Smoky Mountain area is very hilly (After all, it IS the Smoky Mountains!) so do yourself a favor and download an "offline map" in your Goo gle Maps program.  This will let you navigate to our cabin and around the area even if you don't have cell coverage.   Neat, right??!To do this, it's easy:1. Open the Goo gle Maps app and log in.2. Search for Pigeon Forge.  Zoom in/out so that the map you see contains everything from Gatlinburg on the bottom to Sevierville on the top.  Don't be afraid to zoom way out because it'll get everything in between.3.  On iPhone:  Tap the name, tap More.., select "Download Offline Map > Download"On Android: Tap the name, select Download, click Download

Walk to all the action during the day, and return to beautiful views from your private balcony!  Imagine those same views that evening while relaxing in your KING sized bed? description: "Murphy's Lazy Haven" Cabin is close to Downtown Gatlinburg, the Great Smoky Mountain National Park, Dollywood, and Pigeon Forge! It is far enough off the beaten path to relax in peace; but at the same time, close enough to enjoy all the local tourism and downtown hot spots in Gatlinburg! The Cabin is perfect for couples and business travelers.  It has two comfy king beds, 2 full bathrooms, fireplace and hot tub.The spaceThe Mountains are Calling!!!  We Purchased this cabin in November 2020.  After purchasing this Cabin we completed the following updates:-New King Mattresses in both Bedrooms-Replaced dated carpet in both bedrooms with new flooring-Upgraded toilets-New shower heads in both bathrooms-Vizio Smart-TV added to living room-Samsung Smart-TVs added to both bedrooms-Most importantly, A deep clean of the Cabin!!!Murphy's Lazy Haven is an exceptionally maintained cabin that sleeps 4 people. It is located in the highly desirable Sky Harbor Subdivision.  The Cabin is far enough off of the beaten path to enjoy the peacefulness of the Great Smoky Mountains, but close enough to be at all the area attractions in just minutes. The first stop light into Gatlinburg is 10 minutes away.  Murphy's Lazy Haven is within 15-20 minutes of downtown Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Dollywood, Splash Country, Dixie Stampede, and the legendary hiking trails of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.  Don't forget Ober Gatlinburg for winter skiing, ice skating, and snow tubing.  This chalet style log cabin is perfect for couples wanting refuge for their exciting Smoky Mountain Vacation or honeymooners looking for a quiet romantic getaway.Murphy's Lazy Haven offers guests thoughtful amenities so your stay can be relaxing, enjoyable, and your home away from home in the mountains. Enter the Cabin into the open-concept kitchen and living room.  There is a floor to ceiling stone fireplace to enjoy during the winter months.  A newly added Smart-TV has over 120 cable channels.  You also have the option to login to your favorite Streaming Apps.  This cabin features two Master Suites, each with a private bathroom.  The first bedroom shares the living room fireplace.  The King log bed has a brand new mattress.  The bedroom has its own exterior door providing access to the rear deck with a beautiful wooded view and hot tub.  A Smart-TV provides both cable and the option to login to your favorite Streaming Apps.The second bedroom has a King log bed with a brand new mattress.  The bedroom has its own exterior door providing access to the rear deck with a beautiful wooded view and hot tub.  This room also has a Smart-TV.  Please note: this TV utilizes the Spectrum App to access Cable television.  The rear deck has a table for dining and 4 rocking chairs for relaxation.  There is a hot tub to relax in after a long day of hiking.The kitchen is fully equipped to prepare home cooked meals.  A spacious island will assist with meal preparation.  The island also has two bar stools to provide seating so the Chef of your party can have an audience.  A charcoal Weber grill is located outside to grill up your favorite BBQ meats.  Enjoy your meals out on the deck or inside.  The kitchen table seats four.There is a small washer and dryer for small loads of laundry.Murphy’s Lazy Haven provides Wi-Fi free of charge for your enjoyment! Feel free to watch as much Netflix as you'd like!!There is a Keurig and regular coffee maker at the cabin.  I make every effort to supply basic K-cups and coffee grounds.  Feel free to bring your own favorite coffee. Owner Information:  I can be contacted via text or phone anytime before, during, or after your stay via Airbnb or 847/894-3239.YOU AGREE TO AND/OR ACKNOWLEDGE THE FOLLOWING IF BOOKING THIS CABIN:Strict Extra Guest Fee:  I price my Cabins for couples!  There is a $25 per person per night extra guest fee which I’m very strict on.  If more than two people (including children over the age of 2) are traveling in your party, you must indicate such when booking.  More than two people cause more wear and tear on amenities and Cabin mechanicals.  Please consider another Cabin if the extra person fee puts a strain on your vacation budget.  Thank you.Pets/Animals: I do NOT permit pets or animals of any kind for any reason.  My housekeeper has SEVERE respiratory allergies. Hot Tub Cleaning: The Hot Tub is drained and refilled after each guest.  Therefore, depending on when the hot tub was filled, it might be cool upon your arrival.  The hot tub does take several hours to reach max temperature.  This should be kept in mind if booking for only one night.  Keeping the lid on will heat the hot tub faster.  Any body of water has a potential for drowning.  It is slippery in and around the hot tub.  Use at your own risk.  Children are not allowed in the hot tub.Heating & AC: The Cabin has a residential system in it like any other home.  It is not a commercial system.  I ask the AC be set no lower than 68 degrees and the heat no higher than 74.  Additionally, the AC cannot be run before, during,  or after fireplace use.  If you like it cooler, warmer, or like to run the AC with the fireplace, I kindly request you choose another Cabin.  Fireplace: For obvious reasons, the fireplace is non-operational during warm weather months.  The fireplace is operational October 15th through March 15th.  Again, the AC cannot be run before, during,  or after fireplace use.Cell Service: My Verizon cell service works "ok" for calling or texting.  Data usage is not the best but the Cabin Wifi works great.Mountain Roads: This Cabin is on a mountain in the Sky Harbor subdivision.  It is easily accessed via asphalt roads.  There are sharp turns and steep grades, which might be a shock to some.  Please take your time driving.  Some roads require you to pull over so another car can safely pass.  Don't panic, our fully loaded Honda Odyssey mini-van and Honda Civic get to the cabin with no problems under dry and rainy conditions.With that being said, in the event of snow, going up or down the mountain is not recommended.  This area averages 10 inches of snow per year.No Smoking: There is no smoking or vaping of any kind permitted in the Cabin!!Grill Charcoal: Unfortunately, I do not guarantee a supply of charcoal at this time.  Please plan accordingly.Cleaning Supplies: There is a starter supply of dishwashing soap, garbage bags, and paper towels.  You will need to supply your own after the starter supply runs out.  Laundry detergent is not supplied.Check in Time: 4:00 PM (sometimes my housekeeper will have the Cabin ready sooner but there is no guarantee).Check Out Time: 10:00 AM.  The housekeeper arrives shortly after 10:00 A.M..Pest Control: The cabin is treated regularly for insects, mice, & scorpions.  However, you are on a mountain and at times they may make their way inside the cabin.  Keep all doors and windows closed at all times to prevent unwanted guests.**If you are making a reservation on or around October 15th; you are agreeing to permit a service technician to enter the Cabin to start fireplace service for the season.  I try to do this in between guests but the schedule sometimes does not work out.Guest accessHaving a vehicle is a necessity.  However, Uber is available in the area.  You will have access to all living spaces of the Cabin.Other things to noteI have a strict no refund policy.  As in any home, sometimes things break.  There will be no refunds for any reason to include power outages, cable outages, malfunctioning TV's, fireplace, hot tub, appliances, etc..  If you encounter any problems, please contact me right away.  I will attempt to rectify the issue as soon as is reasonable based on availability of the required technician.Refunds will not be given for cancellations; no matter the reason.
additional_house_rules:
No smoking or vaping is permitted in the Cabin.
No Pets or Animals of any kind are permitted at the Cabin.  My housekeeper has very severe allergies which affect the respiratory system.
I take great pride in my Cabins. As a result, I provide a rental agreement guests must sign in order to gain access to the Cabin. I supply this rental agreement through email. I also require a copy of a government issued ID even if you have one on file with Airbnb.
interaction: I can be reached by phone 24 hours a day. I can be reached by text message for a majority of the day.
transit: There is parking for two vehicles at the Cabin. You will need to have your own transportation to get around the area. Note: Snowy conditions may make travel up or down the mountain very difficult and/or impossible. The subdivision does remove snow but it might not be as efficient as areas you live in.

description: A memorable alpine retreat awaits at 'Bear Paw Inn,' offering close proximity to Great Smoky Mountain trails and filled with everything needed for a restorative getaway with your loved ones. The 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental is the perfect place to call home for a while, whether you're choosing to spend time exploring Pigeon Forge attractions like Dollywood or simply spend time reading by the fire, taking a dip in the hot tub, and shooting pool from the comfort of this lovely cabin!The spacePrivate Deck | 2 Mi to National Park | Heart-Shaped Jacuzzi | Charcoal GrillTailor-made for a small family getaway or a spontaneous romantic retreat, 'Bear Paw Inn' is ideally located for exploring all Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge have to offer. Bedroom: Queen | Living Room: Sleeper Sofa | Additional Sleeping: Portable Crib STEP OUTSIDE: Deck w/ rocking chairs & swing bench, hot tubINDOOR LIVING: 2 Smart TVs, pool table, gas fireplace, dining tableKITCHEN: Fully equipped, dishwasher, drip coffee maker, full knife setGENERAL: Free WiFi, linens/towels, complimentary toiletries, central A/C & heat, laundry machines, first aid kit, trash bags, paper towelsFAQ: Pets fee (paid pre-trip, max of 2), exterior security camera (facing outward), quiet hours (10:00 PM-7:00 AM), 1 step required PARKING: Driveway (2 vehicles)COMMUNITY AMENITIES: Outdoor pool, hot tub, playground
additional_house_rules:
- No smoking
- Pet friendly w/ $50 fee (+ fees & taxes, max of 2)
- No events, parties, or large gatherings
- Must be at least 22 years old to book
- Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-7:00 AM
- Additional fees and taxes may apply
- Photo ID may be required upon check-in
- NOTE: Your safety matters. This property features 1 exterior security camera located on the left side of the cabin, facing outward toward the front porch and driveway. It does not look into any interior spaces. The camera records video and sound when activated by motion. It will record when it first senses motion and 30 seconds after the last motion is detected
interaction: Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

description: Nothing beats the gorgeous views of the Smoky Mountains, and you can enjoy it from the comfort of your rental when you stay in our secluded cabin. The cabin sits on a 6-acre private property which makes the perfect scene to start your morning off with a coffee or end it by watching the sunset behind the mountains. The cabin is conveniently located in Gaitlinburg, literally a few minutes away from all attractions, restaurants, sports facilities, shops, library, gas stations, Dollywood and etc.The spaceRock Top is one of the top rated cabins in Gatlinburg. Cabin is located on a 6-acre secluded property, with perfect privacy, and features full kitchens and bedrooms, and many amenities. City's paved way leads to the property, only 30 seconds to Highway 321. Gravel driveway on the property. Guests stay here for nature exploration, animal observation, musical festivals, sports events, anniversaries, photography, and etc. All guests enjoyed their stay. You won’t regret!Guest accessIt's a private driveway with "131" street number at the entrance.
additional_house_rules: Dear guests, please carefully review the house rules and agree before check-in. The cabin is a place for nature lovers and those who want a quiet get away or attend events in the Gaitlinburg-Pigeon Forge area. It is NOT a place for hosting loud parties or social events on site. The cabin allows a maximum of 4 individuals. No more than 2 children/teenagers under the age of 18. No drug, no smoking/vaping, no party, and no pets. Please do not disturb the nature - including plants and wild animals. No outside burning due to the government ban from October to May. While you go out for fun in the Great Smokies, please remember to lock the exterior doors and windows to prevent wildlife animals from entering the cabin. Guests are responsible for the repair or replacement cost of damaged or missing items during their stay. Please help keep the place clean and organized for next guests. Please make sure to lock all the exterior doors and windows when you check out. Failure to check out by 11 AM will result in $50 fine per 30 minutes due to 1) the extremely tight schedule of the cleaning contractors and 2) increased wait time for next guests. The host reserves rights to cancel the reservation if house rules are not being followed. Exceptions could be made, case by case, only for repeat customers in good standing. Your consideration and support is greatly appreciated. Please do not hesitate to ask questions or express concerns. Look forward to having you as our special guests 🙂
interaction: I am available all the time to answer questions and provide assistance. I can be reached at (469) 964-4120
transit: 5 minutes drive to the Gatlinburg downtown commercial district.  3 minutes drive to the Great Smokey National Park.

description: With a bedroom that includes both a heart-shaped Jacuzzi and a fireplace, Magic Moments II is made for romantic getaways. But because the 1-bedroom cabin includes a sofa that converts into a queen-size bed, it’s also a delightful, conveniently located option for a family of up to 4. Located in the quiet Hemlock Hills community in the foothills of the Great Smoky Mountains, Magic Moments II was designed with relaxation and romance in mind. Wood-planked walls and floors, a sloped ceiling, and a stacked-stone fireplace make the living room a place for stretching out and taking it easy. Whether you sprawl out on the plush sofa to watch a movie on the large flat-panel TV, nestle in the armchair with that book you never have time to read at home, or treat yourself to a nap beneath the gentle breeze of the ceiling fan, you’ll feel blissfully removed from the everyday.  The breakfast bar, which seats 2, is a handy spot for surfing the web via the free WiFi. Or one of you can perch there mixing batter while the other heats up the pan for whipping up a batch of pancakes in the fully equipped kitchen. While there are plenty of restaurants to choose from just minutes away, sometimes it’s more restful—and romantic—to dine in. That’s why the kitchen has all the appliances, gadgets, cookware, and tableware you’ll need, whether you’re preparing a gourmet feast or simply mixing margaritas to enjoy out on the deck. You’ll find a grill outside too, so you can enjoy a home-cooked Smoky Mountain barbecue. You might find yourself spending much of your time on the spacious covered deck or in the yard. When you’re not enjoying a sunny picnic on the well-manicured lawn, you can kick back on a deck rocker and watch the trees sway in the mountain breeze as birds chirp and trill. Or you can laze in the deck’s hot tub; it’s especially rejuvenating when you return from a day on the slopes or the hiking trail. Back indoors, you’ll love luxuriating in the en-suite bedroom. Here’s where you’ll find the large heart-shape jetted tub, along with a 2nd stone-surround fireplace. While the warming fire bathes the room in a golden glow you can watch a movie on the bedroom’s flat-screen TV or listen to the crickets serenade you from outside the window. From the tub it’s just a few steps to the king-size bed. You might find yourself turning in early and staying in bed late, simply to revel in the bedroom’s cocoon of luxury. Whether it’s just the 2 of you or you brought the kids along (don’t forget about that queen-size sleeper sofa in the living room), you’re sure to enjoy the cabin’s full-size pool table. If you’ve never played before, here’s your chance to learn—and then you can surprise your friends when you return home! For all its serenity, Magic Moments II is conveniently close to all the area’s major attractions. In less than 15 minutes you can drive to downtown Gatlinburg, where you’ll find plenty of restaurants, shops, thrill rides, and attractions (Ripley’s Aquarium of the Smokies, anyone?) to keep you busy. The cabin is just as close to the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, home to waterfalls, hiking trails, historic cabins, and some of the highest ridges of the Appalachian range. And let’s not forget the Gatlinburg Arts and Crafts Loop, Dollywood, miniature golf, skiing, white-water rafting… Once you stay in Magic Moments II you’ll want to return again and again—it really is that magical. Let yourself fall under its spell; book your stay today. Other things to noteWith a bedroom that includes both a heart-shaped Jacuzzi and a fireplace, Magic Moments II is made for romantic getaways. description: Smoky Mountain Reserve is a recently renovated modern cabin that is located just 3 miles to downtown Gatlinburg! This charming and cozy cabin has everything you need for the perfect relaxing getaway while visiting the Great Smoky Mountains. Modern and comfortable with all the amenities, our cabin is a cozy place for friends and family to gather for a memorable stay in the mountains!The space+ Upstairs Master Suite with King Bed + Upstairs Master Bathroom with Tiled Shower+ Two Downstairs Bedrooms both with Queen Beds+ Additional Fourth Bedroom Downstairs with Full Bed+ Downstairs Full Bathroom + Fully Equipped Kitchen+ Gas Fireplace+ Large Porch with Hot Tub and Mountain Views+ High Speed WiFi and Cable TV+ Resort Pool + BBQ Grill Three bedrooms, two bathrooms, and an additional small fourth bedroom located throughout the 2 spacious levels, “Smoky Mountain Reserve” accommodates 8 comfortably! This cabin offers modern and upscale features that you will notice throughout your stay! Cozy and comfortable, the cabin’s decor and surroundings beg you to unwind and destress. It is ideal for couples, families, & friends looking for a mountain getaway. Smoky Mountain Reserve offers guests seclusion without being far from the area attractions!Upon entering the cabin you will notice tall arched ceilings throughout the cabin! The main level features a living room with a gas stone fireplace, a fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances and a coffee maker, a dining table that seats 8, and a laundry room. Also located on the main level is a bedroom with a queen bed, a second bedroom with a queen bed, mountain views, and private access to the hot tub, and a small room that acts as a “fourth” bedroom with a full bed. There is also a spacious deck off the main level that is the perfect place to spend a quiet morning drinking a cup of coffee or enjoying a glass of wine in the evening while soaking in the mountain views. Sit in the rocking chairs or soak in the private hot tub and enjoy the surrounding nature. The second level features the master bedroom, full master bath, and a little reading nook that offers as a small sitting area for guests. Smoky Mountain Reserve is located in a gated resort called Outback Resort. While staying at our cabin guests have access to a seasonal outdoor swimming pool! The pool opens Memorial Day weekend and closes Labor Day weekend.Guest accessThe entire cabin is yours while you stay with us! Within 24 hours of booking, a rental agreement will be sent to you. A Welcome Package with detailed information including address and directions will be sent one week prior to your arrival date.Other things to noteSmoky Mountain Reserve is a newly updated cabin as of May 2021!
additional_house_rules: Must be 25 years or older to book
interaction: We are just a phone call or text away! Please do not hesitate to contact us during your stay.

description: Eternal Love is a 1-bedroom romantic log cabin that sleeps 4 people comfortably.  The cabin is located between Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge and is close to Dollywood. If you are looking for a cabin that is just far enough from town and away from the hustle and bustle of crowds then this is the cabin that you are looking for.**Please view our other Cabin - ALWAYS & FOREVER - for guests reviews:https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6128978The space"Eternal Love" is a well-appointed, semi-secluded, romantic log cabin, located between Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge and close to all the wonderful attractions, fine dining and the natural beauty of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.The open floor plan features vaulted ceilings, with incredible picture widows to enjoy an unobstructed view of the forest. The living room features a plush leather sleeper sofa and chair, a rustic stone gas fireplace(seasonal), a 42 inch flat screen TV, Internet and Wi-Fi. The kitchen is fully equipped and the dining table provides seating for four. The bedroom offers a luxurious king bed, a cozy fireplace, a romantic two person Jacuzzi and a full bathroom. The front porch offers two rocking chairs and a charcoal grill.The loft game room comes complete with a pool table, board games, card games and tabletop gaming system. Out on the back balcony guests can enjoy their morning coffee/devotion if they choose while they listen to the sounds of nature and enjoy the awesome mountain view. The Spring/Fall season will offer the best view of the mountains.  After a long day of hiking or shopping, you can also enjoy some time in the six person hot tub while you sit under the twinkling globe lights at night which can add a little touch of romance to your night.**Please view our other Cabin - ALWAYS & FOREVER - for guests reviews:https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6128978Guest accessYou will have access to the entire cabin! Your door access code will be provided to you a few weeks prior to checking into the cabin. So, you can arrive at your leisure anytime after 4:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time day of arrival. There are many times the housekeeping finishes early on cleaning so there is a chance that you will be able to check in early. I will let you know that day by text when the cabin is clean and ready to go if you would like me to. :-)Other things to noteWEATHER AND DRIVING CONDITIONS **Eternal Love is located in an area where the roads are maintained and cleared as soon as possible if there is snow/ice storms, etc. Though significant winter storms are rare, you may need 4-wheel drive and/or tire chains during winter storms to travel the mountain roads. Please prepare accordingly because road surface conditions are not guaranteed at any time. No refunds will be given for fear of curvy or steep roads. No refunds are given due to weather conditions.**If during your stay very cold weather occurs (below freezing), PLEASE, PLEASE drip the faucets in the cabin during the night. If the pipes freeze, please contact Maintenance as soon as you can.
additional_house_rules:
Eternal Love has a completely equipped kitchen with all the modern conveniences of home, linens and towels. We provide an initial amount of toiletries (1 roll of bath tissue per each bathroom & 1 roll of paper towel in kitchen) if you need more you will need to purchase these.

The cabin has a washer and dryer, you will need to provide your own detergent and softener should you choose to use them. Other personal items you should consider bringing are hair dryers, tooth brush, extra beach towel if you plan to utilize the outside hot tub, etc.
If you plan to use the coffee machine please bring standard size coffee filters for your own use. Lastly, you will need to provide your own charcoal if you plan to utilize the charcoal grill.

1.	Check-In is after 4:00 PM EST and Check-Out is 11:00 AM EST, unless otherwise approved. 
Early check-ins =$25 each hour early
2.	This is a NON-SMOKING unit. If smoke of any kind is detected, a minimum fee of $200 will be charged. 
3.	This is a PET FREE unit. If we detect that an animal has been in the cabin, a minimum fee of $100 will be charged. 
4.	WEATHER & DRIVING CONDITIONS If there is a snow/ice storm, no refunds will be given. Though significant winter storms are rare, you may need 4-wheel drive and/or tire chains during winter storms. Please prepare accordingly because road surface conditions are not guaranteed at any time. No refunds will be given for fear of curvy or steep roads.  
**If during your stay BELOW FREEZING weather occurs, PLEASE, PLEASE drip the faucets in the cabin during the night & day (if needed) or you stand the chance of pipes freezing. No refunds for weather conditions (snow/ice, rain storms/outages, etc) as they are out of our control. 
5.	Parties at the cabin will not be allowed. You will be charged accordingly.  
6.	Cabin sleeps 4 guests. 
7.	Please note if there is ever a time that repairs are needed outside of the cabin that are Safety Related that can’t wait we will work with you on these issues during your stay (work performed while you are away from the cabin, etc.) 
8.  Any movies you rent at the cabin will be charged to you upon departure.
interaction: Maintenance will be available to help if issues arise during your stay. If you have questions I can also offer assistance.
transit: There is ample amount of parking at the cabin for at least 2 or 3 cars.
