description: Retreat to the beautiful Smoky Mountains in a brand new construction luxury cabin just 5min away from the attractions in Gatlinburg AND the entrance to Great Smoky Mountain National Park! This cabin is the perfect blend of seclusion and activity, an incredible location that cannot be beat!Book your next trip where mountain escape meets luxury getaway!The spaceWhile you will find that many of the Cabins situated in the smokeys lack Wifi (or cellular service), rest assured that we offer wireless broadband internet service, including Live-TV DVR & Streaming Services, on any of the 3 HD flat screen TVs in the cabin. A perfect way to get a way from it all while still maintaining the modern amenities of the new decade.Warm up by one of the multiple fireplaces while watching your favorite show. Or relax in the hot tub, located on the sprawling back deck with picturesque views.Beautiful granite countertops line the custom made kitchen and bathroom cabinets, while the stainless appliances give you confidence for cooking your next meal. Don’t feel like cooking? Have Uber Eats deliver directly to your cabin from one of dozens of restaurants in the area.After a long day in the National Park or riding rides at Dollywood, retreat to the master suite. A generous master bedroom features a large king bed and HD TV. The on-suite luxury bathroom offers a large Jacuzzi tub with a giant walk-in-shower with 3 shower-heads.Guest accessFull CabinOther things to note**Our driveway is considered steep. During the warmer months, most cars can make it 99% of the time. However, during the wintery months with ice and snow, it is HIGHLY advised to have 4-wheel drive to make it up and down the driveway. It is also encouraged to message me before booking in the winter months so I can discuss some tips and advice for your stay.**NO PETS. We love animals, but we are not currently hosting them at any of our properties. A $300 fine will incur if a pet is found in/near the cabin. We have VERY active wildlife around our cabin, and pets have been known to either wander or get hurt. Please do not bring a pet. Service animals may be an exception with official paperwork provided. But that must be approved and discussed with me before booking.
interaction: We will be available to help with any questions or needs throughout your stay... one text or call away!
transit: This new construction cabin is 5min away from the attractions in downtown Gatlinburg AND 5min to the entrance of Great Smokey Mountain National Park! An incredible location that cannot be beat. Turing left out of the driveway takes you past the aquarium and directly in front of Anakeesta. Turing right out of the driveway takes you to the National Park entrance or to the ‘Bypass’ to escape the downtown traffic on your way to Dollywood.

description: Located in Sky Harbor, Restful Ridge is a peaceful retreat with seasonal views! This 1 bed/1 bath cabin can accommodate 4 guests--perfect for a romantic getaway or small family vacation. Plenty of privacy off the back deck, bedroom and living room. Cathedral ceilings and large windows fill this cozy cabin with light. Relax by the river rock-encased gas fireplace or head to the loft for a movie, game of pool or foosball! Soak in the hot tub or jacuzzi tub. Restful Ridge is an escape from it all!The space1075 Sq FtPrimary bedroom: queen bed ; loft-- sofa sleeper, queen sizeIndoor living: jacuzzi tub in master bedroom, vaulted ceilings, natural light, 3 flat-screen cable TVs, gas fireplace, pool table, foosball tableOutdoor living: private hot tub, seasonal mountain views, deck, patio furniture, charcoal grill, swing, rocking chairsKitchen: fully equipped, spacious counters, coffee maker, stainless steel appliances.NOTE: Bring your own spices, food, coffee and coffee filters, etc.General: Free WiFi, washer/dryer, linens/towelsParking: Driveway (2 vehicles)Guest accessWhen we stayed at the cabin, we found an easier way to get out of the driveway that worked for us. We backed out of the driveway down the hill, then drove uphill and around the corner and did a u turn using the jug handle on the left side of the road. Perhaps this might work for you, too.Other things to noteThere is a new cabin being built up the hill, so there may be some construction noise at times.
additional_house_rules:
Things to note:

Roads are steep and narrow! 

Must be 21+ to book. No exceptions.

Cell service can be spotty, depending on your carrier. Make sure you write down the door code that you will receive seven days in advance, in case your phone isn’t working in the driveway. (If your cell coverage is weak, consider using Wifi to make your calls.)

Keep car doors locked at all times and do not leave any food or sweet-smelling items in your car due to curious bears. 

Gas fireplace is turned off between April 1 and October 1. 

Please make sure you rinse off before using the hot tub as oils and lotions can damage the tub and dirty the water.

Ring security camera located on front deck pointing at the driveway.

If you bring more people than agreed upon by your reservation you will be asked to leave without a refund and/or charged an extra $50 per person per night.

Please note the cabin is in the woods adjacent to a national forest/park where wildlife, including bugs are allowed to thrive and are to be expected. We have seen bears, wild turkey, bobcats, raccoons and other creatures. The cabin is sprayed on a regular basis but you may encounter harmless insects. No refunds are given for bugs.

By confirming your booking you agree to adhere to the Rental Rules set forth in this listing:

- Check in time is 4 pm and check out time is 10 am.

- Before you leave, we ask that the items below be completed to help our housekeepers quickly prepare for the next guest:

1. Please empty the refrigerator and take all trash outside to the bear proof receptacle.

2. Please load all dishes into the dishwasher and run it. Soap provided. (We will send a more detailed check out letter the day before you depart.)

- The hot tub is all ready for you and should be set no lower than 95 or more than 104 degrees at all times

- We have stocked the cabin with many items including start-up supplies. However, you will likely need to supplement with your own during your stay. We appreciate that our guests take good care of the home we have set up, and we do ask that you use only what you need during your stay.

We are so happy that you are considering staying in our cabin! We do appreciate all feedback, and please privately let us know of any areas in which we can improve.


RENTAL RULES
1. Smoking is NOT allowed on the premises and drugs of any kind are NOT permitted on the premises.

2. People other than those in the Guest party set forth in the on-line agreement may not stay overnight on the property. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of Guest. Guests are not allowed to exceed the occupancy limit agreed to in the on-line itinerary. No more than 6 persons are allowed in the cabin at any time.

3.Guests should not create excessive noise at a level that disturbs neighbors. Code- enforced neighborhood quiet hours are from 9:00p.m. – 8:00a.m. If you plan to party do not book this cabin. It is our home and you must treat it with respect.

4.The owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to the premises.

A $45.00 service/shipping fee is required for any item that guests leave in the cabin that they want shipped to them. 

5.Keep the property and all furnishings in good order. Removing any items from the cabin including living and kitchen furnishings is not permitted.

6.Only use appliances for their intended uses

7.Pets are NOT allowed.

8.Parking is limited to 2 vehicle(s). Vehicles are to be parked in designated parking areas only. Parking on the road is not permitted. Any illegally parked cars are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees are the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner.

9.Housekeeping: There is no daily housekeeping service. While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the units. Check Out is at 10am. Before you leave, we ask that the items below be completed to help our housekeeper quickly prepare for the next guest. Please load all dishes into the dishwasher and run it on the normal cycle. Please remove and dispose of all items in the refrigerator. Kindly remove the sheets from all beds and place sheets and towels on the floor (not in the bathtub) of the bathrooms.

10.Please lock all doors and all windows upon departure

11. Garbage: Any garbage must be stowed in the proper bear-proof garbage receptacle, located near the driveway.

12.Hot Tub: No children under the age of 18 permitted in hot tubs at any time without adult supervision. NO FOOD, DRINKS OR ALCOHOL while using the hot tub. When using the hot tub, remember there is a certain health risk associated with this facility. Use at your own risk. Our housekeepers drain, sanitize, refill and replenish chemicals in all tubs prior to your arrival; therefore, it may not be warm until later that evening. [DO NOT STAND ON THE HOT TUB COVERS. Hot tub covers are for insulation purposes and are not designed to support a person or persons. They will break and you may be charged for replacement.] Remember when not using the hot tub, leave cover on so hot tub will stay warm.

13.The fireplace is a non-vented propane gas log fired firebox. Please do not throw any paper or other combustible materials in the fireplace. [Fireplace is turned off from April 1 to October 1. It is not operational during this time of the year.]

14. Please DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products should be flushed at anytime. If it is found that feminine products have been flushed and clog the septic system, you could be charged damages of up to $1000.

15.Storms: No refunds will be given for storms. Mountain roads can be curvy and steep. We highly recommend a four-wheel drive vehicle during the snow months. We do not refund due to road conditions.

16. Any damage to any items in the cabin including couches, chairs, tables, TVs, pool table, hot tub, beds, sheets, towels, pillows, etc, are the responsibility of the renter. Every item will be looked at before arrival and after departure. If you cause damage, notify the owner immediately. We will find it and charge you regardless. It is our home. Treat it as if it were your own.

Failure to comply with the above rules will result in non-return of security deposit and possible additional charges. Booking through Airbnb assigns your consent to all listed under "House Rules."

description: A log cabin for 2 nestled at the end of a private drive, Shooting Star is designed for relaxation and romance.  Not only does the gas fireplace, set in rustic stone, warm up the cabin on chilly evenings, but it also bathes the wood-planked walls and beamed ceiling in a romantic glow.Views for days of Mt LeConte, the snow at Ober Gatlinburg and the lights of Pigeon Forge. Only 10 minutes to Gatlinburg proper or 15 to Pigeon Forge. Hiking close by in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.The spaceYou and your sweetheart can while away the hours luxuriating in the outdoor hot tub or the indoor Jacuzzi, snuggling in front of the fireplace, and sipping drinks on the deck swing beneath the star-studded sky.  And when you want a change of scenery, you can head to action-packed downtown Gatlinburg; it’s only ten minutes away.Perched atop a ridge and nestled among towering trees, the cabin offers exceptional privacy. The only sounds you’re likely to hear are singing wrens and warblers in the day and serenading whip-poor-wills and tree frogs at night. A table for two on the front lawn allows you to enjoy your meals out among the birdsong and the fresh mountain breezes. Or kick back on one of the back porch’s rockers with a frosty drink—relaxation is practically guaranteed. The porch’s swing is ideal for both of you to snuggle amid the silvery sheen of the moonlight, listening to owls hooting in the woods. And for the ultimate in alfresco luxury, there’s the deck’s hot tub. After a day of hiking, skiing, or biking, a long soak will have your tired muscles feeling as good as new.The cabin has a jetted tub indoors as well, in the spacious bedroom. The tub is designed for two, so you can enjoy the massaging jets of steamy water with your sweetie before climbing into the king-size bed. The lustrous wood-planked walls, the vaulted ceiling, and the rustic furnishings definitely add to the romantic ambience. All that’s left is to play your favorite music on the cabin’s CD player.The living area has the same elevated woodsy vibe. The stone-surround gas fireplace bathes the wood walls and cathedral ceiling in a golden glow on chilly winter evenings. Sprawl out on the plush sofa to watch a movie on the flat-screen TV with cable or settle back in an armchair to surf the web via the free WiFi.The open kitchen includes all your major appliances and plenty of minor ones as well, such as a coffeemaker, a toaster, and a blender (did someone say margaritas?). There’s a full array of cookware and tableware too, plus a charcoal grill outside. When you don’t want to eat outdoors, you can do so at the restaurant-style booth just off the kitchen, outfitted with a table, benches, and even lace curtains. After dinner, shoot some pool in the game room—no need to head to town for your evening entertainment.When you arrive at Shooting Star, you’ll find the bed beautifully made up and plenty of clean towels in the bathroom, which features a roomy shower. Among other conveniences, the cabin has its own washer and dryer.Guest accessYou get the entire cabin to yourself.Other things to noteThe road up to the cabin is very STEEP. The access road to this cabin is paved  but does have an incline. At times it narrows to one lane. There are a quite few twists and turns. It's about .3 miles of steepness. We can make it up in a Prius with no problem. This cabin is not for the less adventurous type. If you want flat roads this is not for you. If you want to be near the park with a breathtaking view and hiking nearby... look no further!Note the fireplace is only open beginning of October though end of March.Motorcycles and trailers are not recommended. 4-wheel drive is recommended for adverse winter conditions. No refunds for weather or driving issues.

description: If you are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway, but still want to be close to the action of Pigeon Forge, then Do Not Disturb is the place for you! Located walking distance to downtown Pigeon Forge and a 10-minute drive to Gatlinburg this one bedroom studio cabin offers a queen size bed, indoor whirlpool tub, stacked stone gas fireplace, private hot tub, charcoal grill and high-speed WiFi. The easy, flat roads are motorcycle & trailer friendly.The spaceDo Not Disturb features a cathedral ceiling inside and a nice private deck outside. The deck is equipped with rocking chairs and your very own hot tub awaits, secluded from view by walls and roof, but still open to the clear mountain air. Cook dinner for two in the fully equipped kitchen or on the charcoal grill outside.From the covered porch to the warm wood interior, this cabin will help you and your special someone take life at a slower pace.Take your coffee or tea to the front porch and sit in the matching rocking chairs as you look over the valley. The interior is all about southern comfort, from the lodge-style decorations and comfy couch to the large stack-stoned fireplace. Cuddle up in front of the fire and stream your favorite flick or show on the widescreen television or let the bubbles in the jacuzzi soothe you.
additional_house_rules: Quiet hours after 10pm.
interaction: We aren't always in the area but are readily available via Airbnb messaging. This is a new cabin for us but check out 1500+ reviews for us and our other cabins in the area!
transit: Great access to the nearby attractions in Pigeon Forge and only a 10 minute drive to Gatlinburg and the Smoky Mountain National Park entrance for the best hiking!

description: Welcome to Smoky Mountain Dream Stream!  This luxurious cabin is one mile to the downtown Gatlinburg, TN Parkway!  Sit on and above the historic Roaring Fork Stream that flows right out of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park!  Enjoy the beautiful mountain stream right from the hot tub on the paver patio area!  My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).  You won't find a nicer 1 bedroom 1 bathroom cabin in The Great Smoky Mountains.The spaceGorgeous cabin originally built in 1930 and located directly on and above the mighty Roaring Fork Stream.  This cabin has been completely renovated and offers a rustic modern feel.  It is conveniently located .9 miles to the heart of downtown Gatlinburg, TN!Bedroom 1- Queen bed, flat screen TVLiving Room- Queen sleeper sofa, flat screen TVPatio- hot tub, charcoal grillGuest accessEntire cabinOther things to noteThe Roaring Fork Stream is stocked weekly by the city of Gatlinburg. description: Come stay in our 2 bedroom, 1 bath  condo located in Gatlinburg, TN located right on the river! This condo is one mile from downtown Gatlinburg (to Ripley's Aquarium) . Walking distance to many of the main attractions In Gatlinburg. This condo offers 1 queen bed and 1 full bed. . Will sleep 5 (only up to 4 adults). Dining table seats 6, internet TV, FREE Netflix, WiFi, central heat/air, washer/dryer room on premises, large private balcony overlooking the river.The spaceCome stay in our 2 bedroom, 1 bath  condo located in Gatlinburg, TN located right on the river! This condo is one minute from downtown Gatlinburg. Walking distance to all the main attractions In Gatlinburg. This condo offers 1 queen bed and 1 full bed. Will sleep 5 (only up to 4 adults). Dining table seats 6, internet TV, FREE Netflix, WiFi, central heat/air, washer/dryer room on premises, large private balcony overlooking the river.Guest accessGuests have access to the entire unit, a covered parking bay for up to 2 standard sized vehicles, and access to a shared laundry room.
additional_house_rules:
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
Your must be 21 years of age or older to book with us.
CHECK IN TIME:
Check in time is 4:00 PM EST or after. 

CHECK OUT TIME:
Check out time is 11AM EST. It is possible that there will be incoming guests arriving later in the day, and
our cleaners need ample time to prepare for their arrival. A $25 per half hour fee will be charged if you 
are late checking out, unless you have been given approval by the owners. 

CHECK OUT INSTRUCTIONS/GENERAL HOUSEKEEPING:
• Please wash all dishes and return to the cabinets.
• Take out trash to the onsite dumpster.
• Place all used towels in the bathroom.
• A $40 fee will be charged to your credit card if additional cleaning is required.
• If you disconnect TV cables for game systems, etc, please be sure that you reconnect back 
correctly. If a TV repairman has to come to rewire or reattach said cables, you will be charged 
$25 or the amount of the service call. Whichever is greater.
• Furnishings are NOT TO BE MOVED! 
• Guests are responsible for damaged or missing items and for any extra cleaning or service calls 
due to negligence. 

RATES:
Rates are subject to change at any time. Reservations for holidays and during the months of July and 
October require a minimum stay of 3 nights. Exceptions can be made, but only at the owners approval.

RESERVATIONS AND RULES:
• You must be 21 years of age or older to make a reservation. 
• NO PARTIES! A Minimum fine of $500 will be charged if you break the NO PARTIES RULE. 
• The condos are NON SMOKING and can result in a $1000 fine for cleaning, immediate removal, 
and loss of the remaining reservation, with no refund. All monies paid by the guest will be 
forfeited.
• NO PETS ALLOWED. Violation of this rule will incur a $1000 fine for cleaning, immediate 
removal, and loss of the remaining reservation, with no refund. All monies paid by the guest will be forfeited.

INSECTS:
All units are sprayed monthly by a professional pest control company, but wasps, ladybugs, and other 
insects sometimes find their way in. Always wipe up messes and spills to help prevent this. Refunds will  not be given due to bugs.

MAINTENANCE:
Hemlock River Condos performs regular maintenance on all condos and make every effort to keep all 
amenities in working order. As in any home, appliances, A/C, heating, etc, may malfunction on occasion. 
While we cannot offer refunds or discounts for such malfunctions, we will make every effort to correct 
any deficiencies as soon as possible during regular business hours. Please report any maintenance issues 
immediately.

DRIVING AND ROAD CONDITIONS:
Mountain roads can be rough at any time of the year. We do not guarantee any road surface conditions. 
Most roads in our area are well maintained, however some are curvy and steep. No refunds will be given 
due to fear of curvy, narrow, or steep roads. During adverse weather conditions, we strongly 
recommend guests use four-wheel drive or vehicles with tire chains. NO REFUNDS WILL BE GIVEN DUE 
TO WEATHER CONDITIONS.
• Please be advised that the road leading to the condo, Hemlock Street, does have a 100 foot 
section that is single lane. Please use caution when approaching that area.

LINENS/SUPPLIES
All linens are provided including bed linens, bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths. A “starter”
supply of toilet paper, paper towels, bath soap, and dish soap are supplied. This is only a complimentary 
supply to get your vacation off to a good start. If any additional items are needed, we recommend 
bringing them with you or stopping at one of the nearby grocery or convenience stores. We do not clean 
or resupply the condos during your stay. A coin operated washer and dryer are available in the building 
(not in the condo) for you to use.
interaction: While we like to give our guests space, we are always just a phone call or message away. Please feel free to message us through the app if you have any questions.
transit: While the condo is within walking distance of the main parkway of Gatlinburg, we do recommend having your own transportation. Parking is provided at the condo, at no additional charge. The Gatlinburg Welcome Center and Mass Transit Center (Trolleys) can be found next to Ripley's Aquarium, 1 mile from the condo.

description: "Mountain Freedom" NEW! Private & Cozy Mountain Retreat for 2! Wi Fi & hot tub!Enjoy this quaint and cozy mountain retreat! This lovely cabin will provide you the relaxation you desire with forest views and fresh mountain air. This cabin has a master suite that's ideal for a romantic getaway. Relax in a private hot tub while taking in the sights and sounds of the nature around you.  Located close to many area attractions and the Great Smoky Mountains!The spaceThe cabin is located in a quiet and peaceful area near the Arts and Crafts Community of Gatlinburg. It's towards the top of a mountain in a secluded and woodsy area. There are only a couple of cabins near by that are seperated by many trees and plenty of distance for privacy. It is also at the end of a gravel road, so there is no traffic passing by. It's a great place to go and get away from  it all!Guest accessThe whole cabin is available for guest  use. The only exception is the locked closets for the owners, house cleaners,  and maintenance use. Thank you.Other things to noteThe roads to the the cabin are all paved with the exception of the last 75 yards. You will have to turn off the paved road onto a gravel road to access the cabin. The gravel road is a somewhat hidden and also slightly steep. There is a sign attached a tree pointing you in the right direction. Just look for the "Mountain Freedom" sign.  Also, the roads can be somewhat winding and steep in a few areas, but nothing a regular car can't handle.
additional_house_rules:
Welcome to Mountain Freedom
We hope you have a great stay while visiting the Smoky Mountains! We strive to make your stay as pleasant as possible, please help us to keep things in tip top shape by following the guidelines below. This will help us to maintain a great experience for you and those who visit in the future. Thanks so much!  

A FEW NOTES AS YOU CHECK IN (check in: 4pm)
Please report any issues or damages found upon arrival.
WI-FI PASSWORD - mountainfreedom
The fireplace is CLOSED April 15 - October 15 (DO NOT USE DURING OFF SEASON) 
Do Not leave the fireplace unattended while it is ON.                                      
The garbage can to the side of the cabin is in a bear proof cage. Please make sure it stays secured shut to keep animals out.
Comcast cable TV is provided. Please do not make changes or place orders when using this service. Movies are available to rent at the REDBOX located at Food City.
There is a charcoal grill and fire ring outside for your use. Please make sure all fires are monitored and put out when you’re finished. Firewood and charcoal are available at Food City.
Do Not Smoke in the cabin.
Do Not move furniture inside or outside of the cabin.
A FEW NOTES AS YOU CHECK OUT (check out: 11am)
Turn off all lights.
Insure that all windows and doors are closed and locked.
Put all dirty towels in the tub and leave the sheets and comforters on the beds. 
Bag all trash and place it in the outside secured trash container.
Make sure any dirty dishes are placed in the dishwasher and start the dishwasher.
Turn the air conditioning thermostat to 68 in the winter and 75 in the summer. 
We hope you enjoy you stay!!
Safe Travels!
Ashley
interaction: I won't be available in person, but if you need anything please feel free to email, text, or call.
transit: A car is your best option when visiting our cabin. Although, if you choose to take a break from all the driving, Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge have an excellent trolley system to get you to the most popular places in the area. The Gatlinburg Park-N-Ride lot is located next to City Hall at 1230 East Parkway, Gatlinburg, TN. There is also a trolley stop close to the cabin at the corner of Glades Rd and Powdermill. For more information visit gatlinburgtrolley.org.

description: Top 5 honeymoon cabin in Gatlinburg!Less than 10 minutes to downtown or the national park. * Full kitchen,  well equipped* Private Hot tub* Queen Bed* Charcoal Grill* Fast Wifi with a small work space* Cable tv * Wood burning fireplace available for use in the winter months (wood/lighter not provided).* Self Check in/out* Community pool (usually open Memorial Day to Labor Day)Read the FULL listing before booking : )The spaceClose to the parkway, 10min to downtown Gatlinburg!Comfy Queen Bed next to full bathroom.Patio with private Hot tubFull kitchenCable TVFast WifiGuest accessYou have it all to yourself. Self checkin using a key code we provide the day before checkin.The roads to the cabin are well maintained mountain roads. It's just a short drive off the main road into Gatlinburg (the parkway).  They may feel a little intimidating the first time you drive it if you've never been to the mountains before.  Nothing too serious, and any vehicle can handle it.  If it's icy/snow you may want to have 4WD/AWD.Other things to noteAll guests staying here must be 25 or olderSometimes there may be a lighter at the cabin for the grill/fireplace but we strongly recommend bringing your ownThe cabin is in the WOODS!  You may see or hear bears and crittersNo pets allowed, you will be fined and asked to leave if you bring a petNo candles or flames allowed inside, aside from fire placeFirewood is not provided; fireplace can only be used from November-MarchNo refunds for bad weatherBath towels and bed linens are provided but bring your own towel for pool useA starter supply of TP, paper towel, dish soap are provided but you will probably need to buy more.   Soap, shampoo, ziplocks, food, spices, etc are not provided.Host is not responsible for pool opening/closures.
additional_house_rules:
By making your booking through the platform you agree to all of the guidelines and rules set forth here and are legally binding yourself to them.
YOU MUST BE 25 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER TO BOOK THIS PROPERTY.
Only guests included in your initial reservation are allowed on premises at any time. If it is determined that you have brought more guests, your reservation will be terminated without refund.
Check-in time is 4:00 PM and check-out time is 10:00 AM.  We do not allow early check-in or late check-out.  If you arrive early or leave late it will be a $100 charge.

Before leaving the cabin, we kindly ask that the items below be completed to help our housekeeper prepare for the next guest in a timely manner:
• Empty the refrigerator and deposit all trash outside in the bear proof receptacle.
• Load all dirty dishes into the dishwasher and start it. 

A few additional guidelines to observe during your stay:
• Please do not run the fireplace and the air conditioner at the same time.
• The hot tub is ready for your enjoyment when you arrive, and the temperature should always remain set between 100°F and 104°F.  When not in use, please cover the hot tub in order to retain the temperature. Please only adjust the temperature, jets and lighting settings. If a setting is changed that hinders the operation of the hot tub and a service call is required, guest will be responsible for all charges associated.
• The cabin is stocked with start up supplies (i.e. paper towels, toilet paper, trash bags, etc.).  However, you will likely need to supplement with your own during your stay.  We are extremely grateful of the good care guests take of our home, and we ask that you only use what you need during your stay.

Rental agreement is as follows:

1. Smoking and drugs of any kind shall NOT be permitted.  If ANY SMOKE SMELL is detected inside the cabin after your stay, or if cigarette butts are laying around outside, ADDITIONAL CLEANING FEES of $200 MINIMUM will apply.
2. People other than those in the Guest party set forth above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of Guest. Guests are not allowed to exceed the occupancy limit agreed to in their initial booking.
3. Guests should not create excessive noise at a level that disturbs neighbors; HOA code-enforced neighborhood quiet hours are from 9:00 PM – 8:00 AM.  Parties are not allowed at our cabin.  It is also our home and must be treated with respect.
4. This property is privately owned; the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest.  Guest understands their use and occupancy of the property is at their own risk.  By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.
5. Keep the property and all furnishings in good order; removing any items from the cabin, including living and kitchen furnishings is not permitted.  Please do not rearrange our furniture.
6. Only use appliances for their intended uses
7. Pets of any kind are NOT allowed.  If you sneak in a pet you will be charged $175 and asked to leave.
8. Parking:
• Parking is limited to 2 vehicles.  Vehicles are to be parked in designated parking area only  
• Parking on the road is not permitted.  Any illegally parked cars are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees are the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner.
9. Housekeeping:
• There is no daily housekeeping service.  While linens and bath towels are included in the cabin, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate.
• We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the units.  
• Check-out is 10:00 AM.  Before you leave, we ask that the items below be completed to help our housekeeper quickly prepare for the next guest:
Please load all dishes into the dishwasher and run it on the normal cycle.
Please remove and dispose of all items in the refrigerator.
10. Please lock all doors and windows upon departure.
11. Garbage:
• Any garbage must be stowed in the proper bear-proof garbage receptacle, located outside of the front door to the left
12. Hot Tub:
• Use at your own risk. Renter agrees to hold owner harmless for any injuries.
• Guest(s) are responsible for any damage to equipment, spa cover or spa surfaces.
• Our housekeepers drain, sanitize, refill and replenish chemicals in all tubs prior to your arrival; therefore, it may not be warm until later that evening.
• Minimum age for unsupervised use of the hot tub is 18 years old.
• Minimum age for supervised used of the hot tub is 5 years old.
• Maximum safe spa temperature is 104° or less.
• Replace spa cover after use.
• No eating, no smoking and only drink water from plastic cups only.
• Do not use spa if pregnant or hypertensive (high blood pressure).
• Do not use spa if under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
• Do not use spa if water looks poor, smells bad, or without pump running.
• Notify owner of any equipment failure or water problems.
• DO NOT STAND ON THE HOT TUB COVERS. Hot tub covers are for insulation purposes and are not designed to support a person or persons.  They will break and you may be charged for replacement. 
• Remember to replace the cover on the hot tub when not in use so it will remain warm.
**Please only adjust the temperature and jets on/off. If a setting is changed that hinders the operation of the hot tub and a service call is required, guest will be responsible for all charges associated.
13. Gas Fireplace
In operation From October to April.  Do not run while A/C is on.  Turn off gas knob when not in use.
15. Inclement Weather
• No refund will be given for storms or other weather occurences.
• Mountain roads can be curvy and steep.  We highly recommend a four-wheel drive vehicle during the snow months.  We do not refund due to road conditions. 
16. Any damage to any items in the cabin including couches, chairs, tables, TVs, table, hot tub, beds, sheets, towels, pillows, etc., are the responsibility of the booking guest.  Every item will be looked at before arrival and after departure.  If you cause damage, notify the owner immediately.  We will find it and charge you regardless.  It is our home, please treat it as if it were your own.
17.  Pool
The community swimming pool is controlled by the local HOA.  Generally, it is open from Memorial Day to Labor Day.  However, owner is not responsible if the pool is closed for any reason and guest understands owner has no control over pool closures.  
GUEST MUST BRING THEIR OWN TOWELS FOR USE AT THE POOL – BATH TOWELS FROM OUR CABIN ARE NOT PERMITTED TO BE BROUGHT TO THE POOL
18.   Septic System
The cabin utilizes a Septic waste system.  NOTHING OTHER THAN HUMAN WASTE AND TOILET PAPER MAY BE PUT DOWN THE DRAINS.  All other items/food/waste including feminine products must be put into trash cans.  GUEST WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGES OR PLUMBING STOPPAGES THAT RESULT FROM NOT FOLLOWING THESE INSTRUCTIONS.  

Failure to comply with the above rules will result in reservation being canceled with no refund , eviction, non-return of security deposit and possible additional charges.  

Any guest over the maximum capacity will be $75 per guest per night if allowed to stay. Or reservation may be termination without refund

description: If you are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway, but still want to be close to all the action of Pigeon Forge, then Knotty Knotty is the place for you! Located walking distance to downtown Pigeon Forge and a 10-minute drive to Gatlinburg this one bedroom studio cabin offers a queen size bed, indoor whirlpool tub, stacked stone gas fireplace, private hot tub, charcoal grill and high-speed WiFi. The easy, flat roads are motorcycle & trailer friendly.The spaceKnotty Knotty features a cathedral ceiling inside and a nice view of the city lights outside. The deck is equipped with rocking chairs and your very own hot tub awaits, secluded from view by walls and roof, but still open to the clear mountain air. Cook dinner for two in the fully equipped kitchen or on the charcoal grill outside.From the covered porch to the warm wood interior, this cabin will help you and your special someone take life at a slower pace.Take your coffee or tea to the front porch and sit in the matching rocking chairs as you look over the valley. The interior is all about southern comfort, from the lodge-style decorations and comfy couch to the large stack-stoned fireplace. Cuddle up in front of the fire and stream your favorite flick or show on the widescreen television or let the bubbles in the jacuzzi soothe you.Guest accessYou get the cabin all to yourself!

description: Enjoy spectacular views of the Smoky Mountains during your stay at this vacation rental cabin that boasts room for 3 - perfect for a romantic couples retreat! With a private deck, hot tub, and majestic views of the mountains, this loft cabin is ideal for those wanting to spend every moment outside! Venture out to explore the nearby national park, browse the local art, or join in on all the excitement of downtown Gatlinburg during your stay at this cozy, rustic cabin!The spaceOpen Loft Bedroom: King BedTowering trees and a natural wilderness environment surround this charming Gatlinburg cabin. The simple charm extends inside, where you’ll be treated with floor-to-ceiling windows, vaulted ceilings, and log furnishings. If the mountains immediately catch your eye, step out to to the private deck. With plenty of seating, a charcoal grill, and hot tub, this area is perfect no matter the season. Be sure to return every morning to bask in the remarkable views while sipping your morning coffee.Back inside, this loft cabin boasts a fully equipped kitchen with granite counter tops, stainless steel and black appliances, and cozy living area. Start up the electric fireplace for year round enjoyment and cuddle together while a sweet treat bakes in the oven!If the weather isn’t cooperating, stay at home and entertain yourself with a friendly game of pool or enjoy a movie on one of the 2 cable TVs.Come nighttime, enjoy a long soak in the red, heart-shaped Jacuzzi tub before tucking into the plush king bed up in the loft!Other things to noteKey Residence Features:- Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, air conditioning, central heating, ceiling fans, free WiFi, 2 flat-screen cable TVs, DVD player, in-unit laundry machines, complimentary toiletries, electric fireplace, pool table, Jacuzzi tub, furnished deck, private hot tub, charcoal grill, 2 driveway parking spaces, and more!- Serene Gatlinburg location - Enjoy easy access to hiking, skiing, snowboarding, shops, restaurants, area attractions, shows, and more! Just 20 minutes from Great Smoky Mountains National Park!- Airport: McGhee Tyson Airport (~ 47 miles away)

description: Newly updated, true log cabin in Gatlinburg! Under 5 miles from both downtown Gatlinburg and the National Park.Sleeps up to 8 people! Lots of space to kick back and relax in privacy. 3 HDTVs with live TV channels, 400 Mbps wifi, indoor jacuzzi, fireplace, 20-ft ceilings, upper balcony, spacious lower deck, and unlimited access to the Chalet Village clubhouses and pools.Hot tub on private porch overlooking a quiet wooded setting.The spaceMinimum age to rent cabin: 25 years of ageThis beautiful cabin is owned and managed by us – there is no middle man. When you reach out, you will be talking directly with us!The dining area seats eight. Six can gather around the table, and two more can sit at the adjacent kitchen island. On the other side of the kitchen island is our well-equipped kitchen. New appliances, pots and pans, small appliances (crockpot, toaster, blender, hand mixer, grittle), both Keurig and regular coffee makers, and tableware complete the kitchen.There is also an outdoor park-style charcoal grill available for your use!• Main Floor: Master Bedroom with King Bed and Full Bathroom• 2nd Floor (Loft open): King Bed, Jacuzzi, and Full Bathroom• Living room: Sofa converts into a Queen-size BedAdditional details:CLEANING: We take cleaning and sanitizing very seriously. Our cleaners have been vetted to ensure that enhanced cleaning protocols are being performed.PARKING: Three vehicles can fit in the private driveways.ACCESS: The front door has an electronic lock. You will be provided the gate code and door code at least 48 hours before arrival.GETTING HERE: The road is paved all the way from the main road to our driveway. However, it may seem steep to some folks. Although snow here is rare, 4WD or AWD is recommended in the winter.COMMUNITY AMENITIES: Between June 1  - Sept 1,  unlimited access to the Chalet Village clubhouses, which include outdoor pools, tennis courts, ping pong and foosball tables, and other fun features.BABY GEAR: We have a pack n' play, high chair, and baby gate available for use.CRITTERS: There are critters AND bears in the area. If you encounter a bear do not feed or try to approach them.CHECK IN/OUT: We do not offer late check out or early check in. If by chance we can accommodate, we will. However, late check outs without permission accrue a $50 charge every 30min.We have a strict cancellation policy; we do NOT offer refunds for weather, natural disasters, and power outages.Condiments, zip locks, charcoal, and coffee are NOT provided.The fireplace is available for use from October 1 - April 1.Guest accessThe whole cabin!Other things to noteThis is a non-smoking cabin. If you smoke inside the cabin you will be charged $500, plus the increase in cleaning fee and any damages.Pet fee: Only dogs are allowed at this cabin by pre-approval only. We charge a $100 fee (includes tax) per dog. Dogs are not allowed on the furniture and must be house-trained. When left at the property alone, dogs must be confined (i.e. in a crate) when left at the property alone. The pet fees are due separately within 48 hours of booking.
additional_house_rules:
1.	MINIMUM AGE TO RENT DUE TO HOA RESTRICTIONS IS 25. IF YOU ARE NOT 25, DO NOT BOOK. If you do: (1) your reservation will be cancelled with no refund or (2) If you are already at the property, you will be asked to leave by local authorities and no refund given.

2.	Check-in/Check-out: We do not offer late check out or early check in. Late check outs without permission accrue a $50 charge every 30min.

3.	We have stocked the cabin with many items including start-up supplies. However, you will likely need to supplement with your own during your stay.  We appreciate that our guests take good care of the home we have set up, and we do ask that you use only what you need during your stay.

4.	Bugs and Animals: Leave the windows closed at all times and the doors closed when they are not in use. Small critters (bees, insects, spiders, raccoons, scorpions) and large critters (bears) will come in if they have a way to get there.  Please note that the cabin is in a wooded area. Though the cabin is regularly serviced by a professional pest control company, critters may still find a way to make it into the cabin. We do not refund for insects or critters found inside the cabin.

5.	Smoking is NOT allowed inside the cabin and Drugs of any kind are NOT permitted. Firearms are NOT allowed on the property. If you smoke inside the cabin you will be charged $500, plus the increase in cleaning fee and any damages. Smoking is only permitted outside, and ashes and cigarette butts must be properly disposed in the trash or dedicated ash trays.

6.	People other than those in the Guest party set forth in the online agreement may not stay overnight in the property. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest. Guests are not allowed to exceed the occupancy limit agreed to in the online itinerary. No more than 8 persons (including infants) are allowed in the cabin at any time. If the occupancy limit is exceeded you may be evicted and all payments and deposits will be forfeited.

7.	Guests should not create excessive noise at a level that disturbs neighbors. Code- enforced neighborhood quiet hours are from 9pm-8am.   If you plan to party, do not book this cabin. It is our home and you must treat it with respect.

8.	All of the units are privately owned; the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

9.	Keep the property and all furnishings in good order. Removal of any items from the cabin including living and kitchen furnishings is not permitted. Only use appliances for their intended uses.

10.	Dogs are only allowed on a pre-approved basis. There is a $100 per dog fee that must be paid within 48 hours of booking. If you sneak in a pet without pre-approval, you will be charged an additional $250 per pet.

11.	Housekeeping: There is no daily housekeeping service. While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. We do not permit towels or linens to be taken from the units.   Check Out is at 10am. Before you leave, we ask that the items below be completed to help our housekeeper quickly prepare for the next guest:
a.	Please load all dishes into the dishwasher and run it on the normal cycle.
b.	Please remove and dispose of all items in the refrigerator.
c.	Place all towels in the bathtubs.
d.	Please lock all doors and all windows upon departure.

12. 	Garbage: All garbage must be tied up in trash bags and stowed in the proper bear-proof garbage receptacle, located below the deck. This is for the safety of you and your guests. Trash placed outside of the bear-proof receptacles will attract bears, and any damages/additional cleaning fees will be passed down to you. If the bear-proof receptacles are full, notify us and temporarily stow the trash bags inside the cabin. All trash must be bagged; loose trash (even inside the cabin) will result in a penalty of at least $200.

13.	Hot Tub: No children under the age of 18 are permitted in hot tubs at any time without adult supervision. When using the hot tub, remember there is a certain health risk associated with this facility. Alcohol is not allowed near the hot tub. You are not allowed to use the hot tub if you have consumed alcohol or you are pregnant. Use the hot tub at your own risk! You agree that the owners/hosts are not held responsible for any health conditions that arise from your use of the hot tub. Our housekeepers drain, sanitize, refill and replenish chemicals in all tubs prior to your arrival; therefore, it may not be warm until later that evening. DO NOT STAND ON THE HOT TUB COVERS. Hot tub covers are for insulation purposes and are not designed to support a person or persons. They will break and you may be charged for replacement. Remember: when not using the hot tub, leave cover on so hot tub will stay warm.

14.	Fireplace: The fireplace is a non-vented propane gas log fired firebox. Please do not throw any paper or other combustible materials in the fireplace. Fireplaces are turned off from April 1 to October 1. They are not operational during this time of the year. Do NOT run the fireplace and the air conditioner at the same time.

15.	Water and Septic: The cabin is on a well and septic systems. The mineral content in the water is high. During a drought, the well water may have an odor. The septic system is very effective; however, it will clog up if improper material is flushed. DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products should be flushed at any time.   If it is found that feminine products have been flushed and clog the septic system, you could be charged damages of $1,000 or more.

16.  Strict Cancellation Policy: We have a strict cancellation policy. We do NOT offer refunds for weather, natural disasters, power/water outages, or any other unexpected situations. There is no backup generator at the property. Mountain roads can be curvy and steep. We highly recommend a four-wheel drive vehicle - especially during the winter. We do not provide refunds if you are unable to drive up to the cabin due to steepness or other road conditions. 

No alterations or changes are allowed after 48 hours of booking for any reason including (but not limited to): sickness, injury, scheduling conflicts, death, etc. If you decide to check-out early for any reason, you agree not to request or receive any refunds. If this is a concern for you, we encourage you to obtain travel insurance; note: some credit card companies provide travel insurance by default. 

17.   Internet: If you illegally stream or download using our cabin's internet, you will be charged a $200 penalty and the wifi will be disconnected for the entirety of your stay.

18.	Any damage to any items in the cabin including couches, chairs, tables, TVs, hot tub, beds, sheets, towels, pillows, etc, are the responsibility of the Guest. Every item will be looked at before arrival and after departure. If you or your pet(s) cause damage, notify the owner immediately. We will find it and charge you regardless. It is our home. Treat it as if it were your own.

19.  Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Owner(s) against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises and hot tub, regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. 

20.  Please remember that you are staying at our home, not a hotel. While we actively do our best to maintain quality, it will never be perfect. All it takes is one bad previous guest to ruin the experience for everyone else.

Failure to comply with the above rules will result in non-return of security deposit and possible additional charges. Booking through AirBnB assigns your consent to all listed under this Rental Agreement.
interaction: Available from 9am-6pm EST via Airbnb messenger only. No phone calls or texts. If you have an emergency, please dial 911.
transit: Check out our guidebook on Airbnb!

description: It's unique and private! New building codes don't allow you to build right against the river or have cantilevered porches over it as these have. The sound of the water is so relaxing!Come stay in our 2 bedroom, 1.5 bath  condo located in Gatlinburg, TN located right on the river! This condo is one mile from downtown Gatlinburg (to Ripley's Aquarium). Walking distance to many of the main attractions In Gatlinburg.The spaceCome stay in our 2 bedroom, 1.5 bath condo located in Gatlinburg, TN, right on the river! This condo is 1 minute from downtown Gatlinburg and walking distance to many popular attractions. The condo offers 2 queen beds, accommodating 4 guests. Dining table seats 4. Cable TV, Netflix, WiFi, central heat/air, and a large private balcony, situated right over the river! You can fish right from the balcony! (must have a TN fishing license to do so). Need more space for your group? Be sure to inquire about our other unit in the same building.Guest accessGuests have access to the entire unit, a covered parking bay for up to 2 standard sized vehicles, and access to a shared laundry room.
additional_house_rules:
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
Your must be 21 years of age or older to book with us.
CHECK IN TIME:
Check in time is 4:00 PM EST or after. 

CHECK OUT TIME:
Check out time is 11AM EST. It is possible that there will be incoming guests arriving later in the day, and
our cleaners need ample time to prepare for their arrival. A $25 per half hour fee will be charged if you 
are late checking out, unless you have been given approval by the owners. 

CHECK OUT INSTRUCTIONS/GENERAL HOUSEKEEPING:
• Please wash all dishes and return to the cabinets.
• Take out trash to the onsite dumpster.
• Place all used towels in the bathroom.
• A $40 fee will be charged to your credit card if additional cleaning is required.
• If you disconnect TV cables for game systems, etc, please be sure that you reconnect back 
correctly. If a TV repairman has to come to rewire or reattach said cables, you will be charged 
$25 or the amount of the service call. Whichever is greater.
• Furnishings are NOT TO BE MOVED! 
• Guests are responsible for damaged or missing items and for any extra cleaning or service calls 
due to negligence. 

RATES:
Rates are subject to change at any time. Reservations for holidays and during the months of July and 
October require a minimum stay of 3 nights. Exceptions can be made, but only at the owners approval.

RESERVATIONS AND RULES:
• You must be 21 years of age or older to make a reservation. 
• NO PARTIES! A Minimum fine of $500 will be charged if you break the NO PARTIES RULE. 
• The condos are NON SMOKING and can result in a $1000 fine for cleaning, immediate removal, 
and loss of the remaining reservation, with no refund. All monies paid by the guest will be 
forfeited.
• NO PETS ALLOWED. Violation of this rule will incur a $1000 fine for cleaning, immediate 
removal, and loss of the remaining reservation, with no refund. All monies paid by the guest will be forfeited.

INSECTS:
All units are sprayed monthly by a professional pest control company, but wasps, ladybugs, and other 
insects sometimes find their way in. Always wipe up messes and spills to help prevent this. Refunds will  not be given due to bugs.

MAINTENANCE:
Hemlock River Condos performs regular maintenance on all condos and make every effort to keep all 
amenities in working order. As in any home, appliances, A/C, heating, etc, may malfunction on occasion. 
While we cannot offer refunds or discounts for such malfunctions, we will make every effort to correct 
any deficiencies as soon as possible during regular business hours. Please report any maintenance issues 
immediately.

DRIVING AND ROAD CONDITIONS:
Mountain roads can be rough at any time of the year. We do not guarantee any road surface conditions. 
Most roads in our area are well maintained, however some are curvy and steep. No refunds will be given 
due to fear of curvy, narrow, or steep roads. During adverse weather conditions, we strongly 
recommend guests use four-wheel drive or vehicles with tire chains. NO REFUNDS WILL BE GIVEN DUE 
TO WEATHER CONDITIONS.
• Please be advised that the road leading to the condo, Hemlock Street, does have a 100 foot 
section that is single lane. Please use caution when approaching that area.

LINENS/SUPPLIES
All linens are provided including bed linens, bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths. A “starter”
supply of toilet paper, paper towels, bath soap, and dish soap are supplied. This is only a complimentary 
supply to get your vacation off to a good start. If any additional items are needed, we recommend 
bringing them with you or stopping at one of the nearby grocery or convenience stores. We do not clean 
or resupply the condos during your stay. A coin operated washer and dryer are available in the building 
(not in the condo) for you to use.
interaction: We like to give our guests space, but are just a message or phone call away. Please do not hesitate to message us through the app if you have any questions.
transit: While the condo is within walking distance of the main parkway of Gatlinburg, we do recommend having your own transportation. Parking is provided at the condo, at no additional charge. The Gatlinburg Welcome Center and Mass Transit Center (Trolleys) can be found next to Ripley's Aquarium, 1 mile from the condo.

With downtown Pigeon Forge 5 minutes away and easy access to Dollywood and The Island, this vacation rental is the ideal retreat for couples or families. The 1-bedroom, 1-bath pet-friendly cabin boasts a private hot tub, mountain-view deck, pool table and community pool access. Enjoy live entertainment nearby, head to Great Smoky Mountains National Park or simply soak in the jetted tub for a relaxing escape.The spaceMaster Bedroom: King Bed | Game Room Loft: Queen Bed | Living Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa With its luxury amenities, wooded surroundings, and pet-friendly policy, this 1,000-square-foot Pigeon Forge cabin is the perfect retreat for small families or couples! Whether you’re enjoying the Sherwood Forest community pool or kicking back with the cabin’s private hot tub, gas grill, and mountain-view deck, you’re sure to be impressed on this Smoky Mountain getaway.Rustic decor details the cabin’s open layout, complete with plush furniture, a stone fireplace, and a mounted flat-screen TV. Warning: Bears are wild animals that are dangerous and unpredictable. Do not approach bears or allow them to approach you!
Willfully approaching within 50 yards (150 feet), or any distance that disturbs or displaces a bear, is illegal in the park.Violation of this federal regulation can result in fines and arrest. Use binoculars, telephoto lens, or a spotting scope to view the animals.
Check the "Bear Closures" and "Bear Warnings" section of the Temporary Closures page before planning a hike in the park.

Attacks on humans are rare. If you are physically attacked by a black bear, fight back aggressively with any available object--the bear may consider you as prey! Do not "play dead." Help protect others by reporting all bear incidents to a park ranger immediately. Keep your distance from bears.

What Do I Do If I See A Bear?
Bears in the park or at your cabin are wild and their behavior can be unpredictable. Although extremely rare, attacks on humans have occurred, inflicting serious injuries and death. Treat bear encounters with extreme caution! Learn what to do if you see a bear by watching this short video.
If you see a bear:

Remain watchful.

Do not approach it

Do not allow the bear to approach you.

If your presence causes the bear to change its behavior (stops feeding, changes its travel direction, watches you, etc.) you are too close.

Being too close may promote aggressive behavior from the bear such as running toward you, making loud noises, or swatting the ground. The bear is demanding more space. Don't run, but slowly back away, watching the bear. Increase the distance between you and the bear. The bear will probably do the same.

If a bear persistently follows or approaches you, without vocalizing, or paw swatting:

Change your direction.

If the bear continues to follow you, stand your ground.

If the bear gets closer, talk loudly or shout at it.

Act aggressively to intimidate the bear.

Act together as a group if you have companions. Make yourselves look as large as possible (for example, move to higher ground).

Throw non-food objects such as rocks at the bear.

Use a deterrent such as a stout stick.

Don't run and don't turn away from the bear.

Don't leave food for the bear; this encourages further problems.

If the bear's behavior indicates that it is after your food and you are physically attacked:

Separate yourself from the food.

Slowly back away.

If the bear shows no interest in your food and you are physically attacked, the bear may consider you as prey:

Fight back aggressively with any available object!

Do not play dead!

Help protect others, report all bear incidents to a park ranger immediately. Above all, keep your distance from bears! 

Stay safe in black bear country! Please watch this short video.

 Black bears are dangerous and unpredictable wild animals. Do not approach bears or allow them to approach you.
Gary Carter Photo
Bears in the Smokies
Great Smoky Mountains National Park is one of the largest protected areas in the eastern United States where black bears can live in wild, natural surroundings.
Bears inhabit all elevations of the park. Though populations are variable, biologists estimate that roughly 1,500 bears live in the park. This equals a population density of approximately two bears per square mile. At one time, the black bear's range included most of North America except the extreme west coast. However loss of habitat has resulted in a significant reduction in this range.

Black bears in the Smokies are black in color, but in other parts of the country they may be brown or cinnamon. They may be six feet in length and up to three feet high at the shoulder. During the summer months, a typical adult male bear weighs approximately 250 pounds while adult females are generally smaller and weigh slightly over 100 pounds. However, bears may double their weight by the fall. Bears over 600 pounds have been documented in the park. Bears can live 12-15 years or more, however bears which have had access to human foods and garbage have a life expectancy of only half that time.

Bears, like humans, are omnivores. Plant materials such as berries and nuts make up approximately 85% of their diet. Insects and animal carrion provide valuable sources of protein for bears. 

Bears have color vision and a keen sense of smell. In addition, they are good tree climbers, can swim very well, and can run 30 miles per hour.

Bear Behavior
Bears are most active during early morning and late evening hours in spring and summer. Mating usually takes place in July. Both female and male bears may have more than one mate during the summer.

Bears choose a denning site with the coming of cold weather. Dens are usually hollow stumps, tree cavities, or wherever there is shelter. Bears in the Smokies are unusual in that they often den high above the ground in standing hollow trees. Bears do not truly hibernate, but enter long periods of sleep. They may leave the den for short periods if disturbed or during brief warming trends.

One to four cubs are born during the mother's winter sleep, usually in late January or early February. Bears weigh eight ounces at birth. Females with newly born cubs usually emerge from their winter dens in late March or early April. Commonly born in pairs, the cubs will remain with the mother for about eighteen months or until she mates again.
 
The park has replaced garbage cans with bear proof dumpsters to prevent bears from gaining access to garbage.

Garbage Kills Bears!
The bear's keen sense of smell leads it to insects, nuts and berries, but the animal is also enticed by the tantalizing smells of human food and garbage such as hot dogs, apple cores, chips, and watermelon rinds left on the ground in picnic areas, campgrounds, and along trails. Feeding bears or allowing them access to human food and garbage causes a number of problems:

It changes the bear's behavior and causes them to lose their instinctive fear of humans. Over time, these bears may begin approaching people in search of food and may become more unpredictable and dangerous.

Bears that obtain human food and garbage damage property and injure people. These bears pose a risk to public safety. They can also teach other bears this dangerous behavior. Often, they must be euthanized.

Studies have shown that bears that lose their fear of people by obtaining human food and garbage never live as long as bears that feed on natural foods and are shy and afraid of people. Many are hit by cars and become easy targets for poachers.

For these reasons, park rangers issue citations for littering, feeding bears, and for improper food storage. These citations can result in fines of up to $5,000 and jail sentences lasting up to six months. Visitors are urged to view all wildlife at a safe distance and to never throw food or garbage on the ground or leave it unattended. Garbage Kills Bears!
 
Help keep the bears wild. Do not feed bears. Remember, a fed bear is a dead bear!

Bear management is really people management. How visitors behave while in the park has an impact on the safety of bears. If you are careless with your food or litter, YOU may be responsible for a bear's death!
The park has done many things to make it easier for you to protect bears. Bear proof dumpsters or trash cans can be found in all campgrounds and picnic areas. Please use them to dispose of garbage.
During summer months, some of the busiest picnic areas close at 8:00 PM so these areas can be thoroughly cleaned before dark and any food scraps or trash left by careless visitors can be removed. Park rangers patrol picnic areas and campgrounds to enforce evening closures, littering and food storage regulations. They also strictly enforce regulations that prohibit approaching, harassing, disturbing or feeding bears.
An army of park volunteers patrol the park's most popular trails, picnic areas, and campgrounds to educate visitors about protecting bears. They confiscate unattended food or coolers and clean up food scraps left behind by careless visitors. These volunteers also assist in managing people during roadside bear jams.
In the backcountry, food storage cables have been installed to make it easier for backpackers to hang their food and garbage so that bears cannot get to it. At some campsites, telephone poles were flown into remote backcountry areas because the trees around the campsites were too small to set up an effective cable system!
The park's Resource Education staff provides information about bears at visitor centers, in the park's newspaper, and at evening programs. Educational signs about bears can be found on picnic tables throughout the park and bear safety videos are posted on this website.
Wildlife managers actively monitor for bear activity and use innovative and proactive techniques to keep bears shy, secretive, and afraid of people. This approach allows bears to remain in their home range, and discourages them from visiting developed areas or approaching people.
Results of these efforts are very encouraging. In some areas the number of bears that have to be trapped and moved away has decreased by ten fold!
What Can You Do To Protect Bears?

Dispose of all garbage or food scraps in bear proof garbage containers or take it with you.

Do not feed wildlife. Feeding a bear guarantees its demise!

Do not approach within 50 yards or any distance that disturbs a bear.

Do not allow bears to approach you (See "What Do I Do If I See A Bear?" above).

Use the food storage cables to store your food and garbage when camping in the backcountry.

If you see another visitor breaking these rules, or encounter a bear in a picnic area or campground, on a trail, or in any other developed area, please call (865) 436-1230 or stop at a Visitor Center to report it.

Other Threats to Bears

Non-Native Species: The European wild hog is one of the most direct threats to the black bear. These pervasive intruders feed on the acorns and other foods that are mainstays of bear diets. Another non-native species, the gypsy moth, is expanding its range toward the park. This insect defoliates oak trees, weakening them and leaving them susceptible to other insects and diseases which may kill the trees. Not only could bear's food source of acorns be affected, but some of the prime denning spots in old growth trees may be lost.

Poaching: Unfortunately, the lure of high profits on international markets encourages the poaching of black bears. Several cultures believe that bear gall bladders, paws, and claws have medicinal powers or consider them gourmet delicacies.

Urban Encroachment: Community and private developments near park boundaries are causing a loss in habitat for the bears. Poaching activities can be somewhat curtailed, and bear populations can eventually rebound from the losses. But once the critical habitats are destroyed, major declines in bear populations are inevitable. In addition, bears that venture outside park boundaries into neighboring communities may encounter human food and become unpredictable, dangerous, and a threat to human safety.

 Additional Information
 Wildlife Watching in the Park 
Every year park animals must be destroyed because of mistakes humans make. Learn how to protect park wildlife.

Learn More About Black Bear Research in the Park
Scientists at the University of Tennessee discuss work they conducted through 2009.

Hot tub I cannot guarantee that the hot tub will be working for every guest. They do break down by agreeing to this you cannot leave me a bad review over a hot tub. I have no control over when they break down. It's only happened twice in two years it is rare but it can't happen.

Hot Tub Rules and Policies

For your safety and protection, please read these rules and precautions prior to using the hot tub.

When using the hot tub, basic safety precautions should always be observed including the following:
As a result of cleaning and servicing, hot tubs are sometimes not up to full temperature at the time of check in and may need several hours to heat. Please do not adjust the temperature of the water in the hot tub. The Maximum safe operating water temperature for a hot tub is 104 degrees Fahrenheit.  You may adjust the jets and lights as desired.
Do not use, or allow the hot tub to be used, alone. Do not permit children under the age of eighteen (18) to use the hot tub unless they are closely supervised at all times. Unsupervised use by children is strictly prohibited. In no case should children under the age of eight (8) be permitted in the hot tub. Never leave children unattended in the vicinity of the hot tub.
Pregnant women and individuals under medical care (for such problems as heart disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, skin sensitivities, cardiac or circulatory problems) should consult their physician prior to using the hot tub. Never use the hot tub when taking anticoagulants, antihistamines, vasoconstrictors, vasodilators, stimulants, narcotics or tranquilizers. In all cases, if you are not thoroughly familiar with the medication(s) that you are taking, please consult with your physician prior to using the hot tub.
Guest(s) with skin, ear, genital or other body infections, skin sores, or open wounds are not allowed to use the hot tub due to the possibility of spreading infection.
It is recommended that guest(s) shower before and after using the hot tub. Showering before use removes any lotions, deodorants, creams and/or common skin bacteria which reduce the effectiveness of the sanitizing chemicals used to disinfect the hot tub water. The hot tub is professionally cleaned and maintained; please do not add any chemicals.
Long hair should be restrained in a bathing cap or other restraining device. Never allow long hair to float in the hot tub. Suction through the drains and skimmers can be powerful. It is recommended that no jewelry is worn in the hot tub due to the chemicals used. The chemicals in hot tubs can also affect color-treated hair and damage swimsuits.
Always use caution when entering and exiting the hot tub. Surrounding patio/deck may be slippery and dangerous when wet.
Soaking for too long at high water temperatures can elevate body temperature and the temperature of internal organs beyond safe limits. Observe reasonable time limits to avoid nausea, dizziness and fainting. Should you experience any of these symptoms, carefully exit the hot tub immediately.
Alcoholic beverages should not be consumed before or during hot tub use. The temperature of the water may intensify the effects of alcohol and cause drowsiness, dizziness and/or unconsciousness.
Never use glass near or in the hot tub as broken glass can be a risk to a guest(s) which are barefoot and is very difficult to see within the hot tub.
Never walk, climb, play or jump on the cover of the hot tub. Never swim or play under the cover when it is installed on the hot tub. Also, do not rely on the cover as a way of keeping children out of the hot tub. Children must be supervised when they are in or around the hot tub. No diving or jumping into the hot tub.
Do not add anything to the water including foaming bubbles, chemicals, soaps, bath oils, etc. If these items are used in the hot tubs, an additional cleaning fee will be assessed.
Absolutely no candles (floating or any type) are allowed on or in the hot tub.
Absolutely no shoes are to be worn in the hot tub.
Absolutely no electrical appliances should be used in or near the hot tub.
When the hot tub is not in use, the cover must be reinstalled in the proper position and secured, especially if there are any children in the vicinity. Hot tub covers are easily damaged. Guest(s) agree(s) to inspect the hot tub cover for any damage upon arrival and report any problems to the owners immediately.
Please do not turn off or unplug the hot tub. This can interfere with maintaining the cleanliness and temperature of the unit.
Guest(s) agrees to leave the hot tub in the same condition it was received. If cleaning and/or repairs are required due to negligence or abuse, guest(s) will be required to pay for the cleaning and/or repairs.
Guest(s) understands there will be no reduction in rental fees if the hot tub is unused or unavailable during the term of Lessee's rental period.
The owners of Michael Ryion accept no responsibility for the use of this hot tub by any guest(s).

TRAVEL insurance

Whether you need to travel interstate, overseas or to another city for business or for personal reasons, any trip away from your home involves planning, expense and some risk.

Travel insurance can cover you for financial losses caused by a wide range of events that can affect your trip, whether they occur before, during or even after your trip. These might include travel modification, cancellation or interruption, medical expenses, baggage damage or theft, and more.

Travel insurance should be a priority in all travel arrangements, whether you travel regularly, occasionally or you are setting off on a once-in-a-lifetime trip.


You should purchase a travel insurance policy as soon as you have paid for you trip. That way you may be covered for unused travel and accommodation in the event that you must cancel your trip due to a covered event, such as illness or a natural disaster.

Most travel insurers offer policies that cover families and couples, and some also offer multi-trip and annual policies for frequent travellers.
interaction: I love meeting new people but I understand you will be exhausted when you arrive. We will not run into each other unless you have questions. I would love to answer any questions you have about Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge or the surrounding area. If not, I will leave you alone to enjoy yourself.

description: Wet Your Whistle is a PRIVATE 1/1 with loft with pool table on one of the highest mountains in Wears Valley Just off the 321 Wear Valley Road.  4x4 adventure awaits  experience with MTN driving a plus! SPECTACULAR views from the wrap around deck! Wild West Theme decor,  pool table, hot tub, and floor to ceiling windows.  The cabin offers guests full bathroom, livingroom, kitchen, gas fireplace, two flat screen TVs, washer & dryer and a Propane GRILL! ,with covered porch. WIFI, Direct TV!The spaceWhen you arrive you will be greeted by the amazing view. The stairs lead up to the front door.  GPS directions bring you right up. When you open the door you will be transported back to the old west with the decor and the wanted posters. Embrace your inner outlaw making your getaway to hide out for a few days.At Wet Your Whistle we supply Basic Linens, towels, dishes, pots & pans, spices, keurig, coffee pot, toaster. Please be aware you need to bring with you items you require to help your vacation be exactly what you wish it to be!Guest accessThe cabin is 100% accessible. You are up a private gravel road with what seems like no Neighbors but rest assured there are other cabin dwellers. Hot tub is around the back side of the cabin and EXTREMELY private. BE AWARE We are on well water and at times the water may discolor with iron sediment which is not harmful!Other things to noteThe adventure starts after you exit off the 321. Once you exit off and go toward the mtn remember to take in all the beautiful country. You will start the climb up the side of the mtn and be sure to follow the exact signs to Raven's Den. There are a quite few twists and turns. This cabin is accessible via a regular car as I have done it and my cleaners do it all the time. BUT I recommend  and guests may feel more comfortable with a 4x4 for your getaway. Last push to the cabin is gravel.ATTRACTIONS:10 miles to Pigeon Forge Parkway light #3. Where going either left or right gains access to dining & attractions.15 miles DOLLYWOOD18 miles to Gatlinburg.8 miles Alpine Slide & Goats on Roof 5 Miles to Townsend & RAFTING, AND HORSEBACK RIDING!!Just Minutes to waterfalls and trailheads. Secret BACK Entrance to Great Smoky Mtn National Park. Search Wears Valley.

We are a PET FRIENDLY cabin. YOU are responsible to clean all pet hair, poop, debris or smell. If you pet messes up the rug please replace it or help me purchase a new one. Please pick up POOP BOMBS from the FRONT PARKING area. There is an awesome hiking gravel road that circles around so plenty of exercise places. 

MY FAMILY lives locally and we visit our cabin often! We survive off our income from the cabins and we take very good care along with our cleaners. Please help us help you enjoy your stay! 
Thanks.
