description: Welcome to Country Cabin! My name is Eric, owner/host of this newly updated, secluded, private, all original wood cabin surrounded by nature.This is a wonderful Honeymoon cabin, perfect for a couples private romantic getaway! Located in the Arts and Crafts community near Glades road. Only five minutes away from some fantastic local restaurants, arts and crafts, hiking, swimming and a quick 3.8 miles to downtown Gatlinburg.-6 person hot tub to relax and enjoy the views-Gas grill -Fire pitThe spaceCountry Cabin is a wooded private cabin for up to 2 travelers looking for relaxation and or adventure. Located about 15 min from the Great Smoky Mountain National park entrance. Country cabin offers a lofted bedroom with a new Hybrid/memory foam King bed, ceiling fan, garden tub, sink and commode. Enjoy the beautiful views of the mountains from the loft.The 1st floor offers a full kitchen with all new appliances (full size). Ceiling fan, electric fireplace, washer dryer combo, full bathroom with shower.The front porch offers wonderful views of the mountains, ceiling fan, seating and a new (2021) 6 person Hot Tub!! The back has a gas grill and 2 person porch swing and 2 rocking chairs. Great "quiet place" to relax with views of the woods.Fire pit and seating is ready for small fires, s'mores and memories. There is a ROKU enabled 55" TV in the family room great for streaming shows  and music. The loft  features and a 32"  ROKU enabled TV.The kitchen is fully stocked with plates, bowls, coffee mugs, pots, pans, bake-ware, cookware, cooking utensils, silverware, drinkware,  blender, corkscrew and bottle opener. Crock pot (great for prepping your meal in the morning before leaving to explore the area), programmable drip and a Keurig single use coffee maker (K cups are not provided), microwave, full size stove/oven, full size refrigerator freezer and dishwasher! The cabin comes with linens, pillows, blankets, towels, dish soap, dishwasher soap, hand soap, trash bags, paper towels, laundry soap, sugar, dry creamer, coffee filters, seasonings (salt, pepper and many other seasonings and spices).Located in the Arts and Crafts community near Glades road. Only five minutes away from some fantastic local restaurants, arts and crafts, hiking, swimming and a quick 3.8 miles to downtown Gatlinburg. Enjoy a short ride, 15 minutes to the Great Smoky Mountains park entrance and 20 minutes to the heart of Pigeon Forge.Guests can use anything in the cabin and its decks.#countrycabingatlinburgGuest accessGuests have full access to all areas of the cabin.

description: Relax.....take a deep breath.....you're at the chalet now. Life is good at the chalet! A completely secluded hot tub and gorgeous views overlooking Ober Mountain & Gatlinburg await at “Grin and Bear It”, a lovely mountain chalet nestled among the mountains and trees. Close to town yet above it all. The chalet is in a resort neighborhood, yet secluded and maintains that highly sought after "tucked away" and private feel,  just 10 minutes from downtown.The spaceOur chalet is very secluded up in the mountains, yet close to town. Keycode entry means you don't have to meet anyone to check in.  Come here to get away and enjoy the mountain air. **fast wifi Roku with appsDisneyPlus, Hulu, ESPN and more appspool tablehot tub w/viewfull kitchenwasher & dryer2 HD tv’s2 Electric fireplaces2 decks (upstairs and downstairs)charcoal grillking bed (new mattress!)sleep sofa (new mattress!)key code door lock (flexible check in time available)early check in available for a small feePools (3 locations with multiple pools: shared: via Guest Access Pass for Chalet Village Owners Club)Tennis Courts (shared: via Guest Access Pass for Chalet Village Owners Club)Discounts to various restaurants: (via Guest Access Pass for Chalet Village Owners Club which provides a discount card.)As you enter the chalet, the bright and airy decor and the views from the windows welcome you to your Smoky Mountain retreat.Delight in the comfort and coziness of the family room; with its comfortable seating, sleep sofa, lovely fireplace, and charming mountain decor. The cooks among you will enjoy our well equipped kitchen which is open to the dining room and our outdoor grill. As an added bonus you can unwind in the steaming hot tub on the back deck while admiring the beautiful views. Enjoy the seclusion, peace and privacy of this glorious spot as you admire Ober Mountain and overlook Gatlinburg.  Waking up to the mountains every morning will never disappoint. The view from any room in the house is great, especially from the Master bedroom’s King bed upstairs. With vaulted ceilings soaring above you, it is a delightful world of your own.When you return from your day of excursions our chalet is a wonderful oasis for you to enjoy and socialize. Envision coming home to the chalet after experiencing the beauty and splendor of the Great Smoky Mountains. The glow of the fireplace casts a dreamlike ambiance. Surrounded by your friends and loved ones, you sip hot chocolate or your favorite refreshment while you reminisce, laugh, and reconnect. This is where memories are made.We want our chalet to be a place for you to relax, rejuvenate, and renew your spirit. This is your vacation. With you in mind we designed “Grin and Bear It” as an affordable and comfortable retreat. We’ve included modern amenities so that your experience will be carefree and enjoyable.You'll feel like you are a part of the mountains staying here, yet with all the comforts of home. You might even see a few bears. Soak up the delicious views from the hot tub, the many windows inside or the two decks outside. The solitude and sounds of nature will be just what you need, and the close proximity to Gatlinburg makes this the perfect getaway. This lovely chalet will make you feel like you're on the top of the world, and the views are definitely worth the climb.Guest accessAccess to the entire house!
additional_house_rules:
Thank you for taking care to read our chalet house rules. 
If under 25 or a TN local, you will need to submit a request to book (not instant book) and answer a couple additional questions. Then, we can approve your booking request.

Other rules:
Please leave the place how you found it. Additional cleaning above average or damage may incur additional charge.  
Please lock the trash outside in the bear safe trash can to prevent bears from accessing it. 
No parties.
-no smoking. Smoking indoors will result in an additional smoke cleaning removal fee.
-Hot tub cover must be secured by cable after use to avoid blowing away. Please no soaps/oils in the hot tub. 
-Kitchen sink doesn't have garbage disposal so please put food scraps in trash can.
-Do not move the charcoal grill onto chalet decks. Leave it on the front parking/overlook area.  For fire safety reasons this is a city of Gatlinburg requirement for all cabins and chalets. 
(If children are present: they must be supervised near railings on decks/water/tubs/fireplace. Window safety devices we provide must not be disabled. You are responsible for your children's safety. This is not a child proofed cabin. ) 
-In Dec, Jan, and Feb, chains and four wheel drive are required.
-We are not responsible to refund for weather and acts of God. You are visiting a cabin in the mountains where it snows. Please be prepared that on some occasions, the weather may limit your travel. Also please bring enough food with you that in case you get snowed in, you are comfortable. 


Thank you, and wishing you a wonderful vacation! :)
interaction: I will be available primarily though the Airbnb messaging system. I check messages frequently throughout the day.
transit: During December, January and February chains are required. Located in the mountains, there will be some steep winding roads but it's definitely worth the climb. Our driveway is steep, but easily managed in 1st gear. In normal conditions any car can make the trip, but in conditions of snow 4 wheel drive and chains are recommended. This is typical of almost every property located in the mountains of Chalet Village.

description: The Seclusion is the perfect couples retreat! Fall in love all over again in the newly renovated cabin with modern touches that pairs perfectly with the laid-back cabin living of the Smoky Mountains. Oh! and the breathtaking mountain views looks even better in person!Private and catered to couples - you can sit back and relax in our private hot tub with unreal views of the Smoky mountain, enjoy a night in the whirlpool tub while watching a movie, or cuddle up in front of the fireplace.The space• Location!! 4 mi to downtown Gatlinburg. 9 mi to Pigeon Forge• Master Suite with King Bed• Newly renovated Bathroom w/ Large Walk-in Shower• Fully equipped Kitchen• Wood-burning Fireplace• Private porch w/ a propane grill and hot tub• Jacuzzi Tub• Pool table• High Speed Wi-Fi and 2 TV's with RokuThe Seclusion was designed in a way to be the perfect couples getaway, so you will not want to go anywhere...but we are actually only minutes away from downtown Gatlinburg as well! Whether you decide to stay in and escape with your loved ones or go out and experience all the local attractions, you truly get the best of both worlds here at The Seclusion.Our romantic cozy cabin comes with all the amenities you could possibly need for your getaway including an indoor Jacuzzi, a wood burning fireplace, two smart TV’s with Roku, a pool table, a hot tub, and a completely private porch overlooking an out of this world view. description: The Mountain Views and Location you have been waiting for!Pure View Retreat is perfect for your Pigeon Forge/Smokey Mountain vacation!★ HIGHLIGHTS ★-Panoramic Smokey Mountain View!-New Hot tub-Pool Table-2 King Beds-Wood Burning fire place-WiFi (non high speed)-5 mins to Pforge pkwy-15min to Dollywood-Well-equipped kitchen-Park-style grill-Washer & dryer-55" Smart TV with 240 Dish channels-Cul-de-sac Parking for 5 cars-20 min to the Smoky Mountain National Park and Gatlinburg!The spaceWhen you enter our private cabin, you'll immediately notice the genuine hand hewn log beams and the craftsmanship throughout. Prepare your meal in the well-equipped kitchen. Have a seat at the dining table and enjoy while planning your daily adventures. The kitchen is fully equipped for all your needs. For coffee, the cabin has both a drip-style coffee maker and a Keurig single-cup machine. We offer each guest a starter pack of kcup and coffee, bring more as needed!. If you love to grill, we have a brand new park-style grill out front.After a day of adventures in Pigeon Forge/Gatlinburg/Smoky Mountains, head back to the cabin minutes away and slip into the hot tub for a soak and enjoy the Mountain View evening. As it approaches bedtime, lie back on the reclining sofa or beds and tune in the HDTVs to your favorite shows/movies to end the evening.Sip your morning coffee and enjoy the smokey mountain views and the sounds of Mill creek rushing below.We have parking for 5 vehicles in the cul-de-sac. Please be considerate of the other cabin next door when parking your vehicles!Booking the Cabin/Cabin notesThe road leading to the cabin is somewhat steep. 4WD is recommended and tire chains if there is snow as the roads are not plowed!All guests must be 25+ with exception of children of parents. A 50% payment is due on booking with the remainder due 60 days before arrival. If your arrival date is within 60 days, the total amount is due on booking.There is an external video camera for monitoring the street, walkway, and the parking areas — they have no internal view. If you touch/tamper with the cameras you will be asked to leave the property immediately!  These are for your protection.Wireless speeds are currently slow but unlimited.  Internet is tough to come by currently in the rural mountains! (save us Elon Musk!) Please do not move or touch the wireless router as it is not cheap to replace and may require forfeiture of your security deposit if damaged. We are working to up the ante on this soon!This cabin is in a wooded setting. You will likely see and hear 2/4/6/8 legged creatures, if this is a fear, please reconsider booking a mountain cabin!. Monthly pest control is in place but occasionally they may slip through the cracks. Black Bears are also present, please do not feed the bears as they can be dangerous but they are a rare sight!Pets are NOT allowed, if you are caught with a furry friend you will be asked to leave or fined.6 Human maximum.  If you bring more than accounted for on your reservation you will be charged $150 for each human over said number.No Late Check-out or early Check-ins, we need proper time for our cleaning crew to abide by the enhanced cleaning policies!Every booking is covered by the Accidental Damage policy. It provides coverage in case of accidental damage to the cabin or its contents. We require a $350 refundable security deposit to guard against non-accidental damages and items not covered by the policy. This is done by placing a "hold" on your credit card a few days before arrival. If all is good, the "hold" is released after departure and completion of our inspection.We STRONGLY recommend guests consider obtaining Travel Insurance for your trip, especially if you are concerned about possible cancellation for weather or other travel interruptions. Be sure to read and understand our cancellation policy. We will not be responsible for any cancellations outside of our policy - that is what Travel Insurance is for.Guests must review and sign our Rental Agreement, a sample of which (without specifics of names and dates) is available. This agreement must be digitally signed and returned to us within the specified timeframe. A copy of the signer's government-issued ID must also be submitted. Instructions will be provided upon booking.Safety & Security* Keyless wireless remote controlled and monitored lock is installed* Locking bars on each of the 4 sliding glass doors are installed* Smoke detectors are installed throughout the cabin.* The cabin is outfitted with CO detectors.* There is a fire extinguisher located in an easily accessed location on each floor.Cabin LayoutLower Level: 3 Bdrm w/ 2 king beds, and 1 queen bed, full bath with tub/shower, laundry center, locking sliding glass doors, huge deck, 3 teak deck rockers, bench, new hot tub.Main Level: Full bath with shower, kitchen, living area, large leather reclining sofas, main entrance, pool table, deck, 4 poly wood deck chairs, park style grill.Your Well-Being is ImportantOur housekeeping partner has always had a strict cleaning regimen that is performed after every guest stay. In light of the recent health emergency, we have worked closely with them and updated it to include additional processes and procedures to increase protections for both our guests and our housekeeping team members.The high points of our cleaning process include the following:Hot Tub: Drained, cleaned, and refilled after every guest; fresh Bromine added.Linens: laundered and processed in temperatures that exceed those recommended for laundry operations; dried at temperatures needed for sanitization; and, packaged until put out for guests.Cabin:All Housekeeping and inspection staff have been fully trained in the proper methods of cleaning and preparing our home for our guests.. They are instructed to immediately report anything that may lead them to believe that there is/was any kind of health issue in the cabin, with themselves, or with other staff.Thank you for considering Pure View Retreat!
additional_house_rules: Wood burning Fireplace can only be used OCT1 through APR31.   Guest must sign and return the rental agreement along with copy of government issued ID

description: The Shirebrook cabin is nestled in the hills of Pigeon Forge in the Sherwood Forest resort community. The cabin features 1 King bedroom with an adjoing full bathroom with shower.After you arrive the spectacular mountain views will  take your breath away. The listing pictures do not truly capture the absolute stunning views this cabin has to offer.You can end your fabulous day with a relaxing dip in the outdoor hot tub overlooking the Smokies !The spaceLocated between Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg, the Shirebrook cabin is PERFECT for doing nothing (but enjoying the peaceful mountain views), or doing everything that the Gatlinburg\Pigeon Forge area has to offer.No narrow mountain road driving, and no crazy steep driveways to deal with. Easy access to the gated resort community.Fast WiFi - 220 Mbps average using speedtest.net.5 Minutes to the Pigeon Forge parkway.15 Minutes to Dollywood15 Minutes to Gatlinburg attractions and the gateway to the Smoky Mountains.The master bedroom is located downstairs, and features a cozy electric fireplace with  plenty of space to relax in a King sized handmade log bed !The living area features a stone natural gas fireplace (available Oct-March) and comfortable seating for you and your guests to watch the game on the flat panel T.V.A queen sofa bed in the living room is also ready for two additional guests.We also keep a fold away single bed in the loft to help keep the  peace with the brother and sister who want their own sleeping space!The upstairs loft area features a full size pool table, high-top game table, and a 60 game full size upright retro arcade !!The kitchen features everything you need for preparing and serving a home cooked meal.  A full size dishwasher, fridge, stove top, oven, and microwave - everything you need for a short or long term stay.A pack n play bed is available in cabin for an infant or toddler. Restaurant style high chair and childrens utensils. Baby gate can be used to block stairs.A stackable washer and dryer along with an iron and ironing board makes this incredible cabin a true home away from home. Once you stay at the Shirebrook Cabin the first thing on your mind will be when you can take time off to return againGuest accessGuests have access to any room in the cabin. There is an "Owners Closet" in the loft where  we keep cleaning supplies, seasonal decorations etc.. This closet is locked and not accessible. There is a resort community pool that is shared among the owners and their overnight guests. This pool is open seasonally.Other things to noteWe supply a few days worth of coffee, sugar\splenda, and powdered creamer. There is a Keurig machine as well (you supply pods). We also supply a couple days worth of laundry detergent and dish washer pods. Guests must stock their own supplies beyond this. We ask that you do a final load of dishes on checkout, if you need a dish washing detergent pod let us know !The living room fireplace is natural gas and is operational from mid  fall through early spring. The gas is shut off to the fireplace during the warmer months.
additional_house_rules: Community quiet hours are 11:00 PM to 9:00 AM
interaction: If there is anything you need or would like to report a problem, you can contact me through Airbnb or telephone.
transit: The Shirebrook Cabin is centrally located between Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg. If your plans are Dollywood it's 15 minutes away. If your plans are Gatlinburg or Smokey Mountain National Park, it's also 15 minutes away. The location is PERFECT and one of the primary reasons we chose this cabin. Another important point in terms of location, is that it is an easy drive... no narrow, crazy steep and frightening roads to get to the cabin !

description: Mountain Chic in the middle of the Action!! Newly updated and completely renovated Condo! Located in Downtown Gatlinburg and walking distance to all of the excitement! Condo has beautiful new flooring, stone and granite HUGE Jetted Tub, Gas Fireplace (seasonal), 2 TVs (58" and 32"), GORGEOUS shabby chic decor with adorable new granite kitchenette, Queen Bed in the Master Bedroom and Queen Pull Out Sofa Bed in the Living Room. Swimming Pool available during the Summer at this Beautiful Property!The spaceGreat condo for anniversaries, honeymoon, couples, girl's or guy's trips, family vacations, weekend trips, visits to the National Park, and visits to Downtown Gatlinburg. Bring the kids in the Summer - they will love our Kiddie Pool!Guest accessOur Property has a cool Pool that is available in the Summer! We also have a laundry (pay per load) that you can use in our building.
additional_house_rules:
- Quiet Hours after 10 pm
- No PETS allowed in condo or on Property

Mountain Chic
Lease Agreement
1. Check In Time: 4 PM - Check Out Time: 10 AM
No late check-outs or early check-ins without permission from the owner. 
MAX Occupancy: 4

2. This is a NON-SMOKING Condo. No smoking is allowed in our condo. There will be a $500 fine for any guest that smokes in our condo along with any fees to clean and deodorize the condo.  

3. PETS ARE NOT ALLOWED - ANY PET Found to occupy the condo will be charged a pet fee of $500 in addition to any damage that may have been caused by your pet. Housekeeping staff performs a thorough inspection after every guest checks out to ensure compliance with this policy. 

4. Cleaning - Your stay rate includes a one-time towel and linen set up. There is NO DAILY MAID SERVICE - while linens and bath towels are included in the cabin, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. Please leave all wet or dirty towels at end of your stay either in jetted tub or shower.   Dishes - dishes, pots/pans, and utensils are provided. Please wash any dishes used during your stay and put away leaving condo in the same condition as guest found it upon arrival. 

5. Trash - please place all trash in trash in the dumpster for our condo located in the parking lot near Baskins Creek Road. 

6. RESERVATIONS
RATE CHANGES - Rates vary thru-out the year and are subject to change. Once your reservation has been booked and a deposit is paid, your rate is locked. 
FALSIFIED RESERVATIONS - Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of advance payment, deposit and the party will not be permitted to check in. 

7. STORM POLICIES/ROAD CONDITIONS/FIRES- although our condo is located in a populated resort area with very little steep inclines, the surrounding area may experience road condition issues during storms, snow, sleet or icy weather. No REFUNDS will be provided for Storm / weather related cancellations or FIRES that are not under the control of the owner. 

8. JETTED TUB – NO OIL or BATH BOMBS ALLOWED
Please do not add or use any oil based bombs, glitter bath bombs, oil based bath beads, or bath oils in the Jetted Jacuzzi tub. If these items are used in our tub you will be charged a $75 Cleaning Fee for our team to thoroughly remove all of OILY SUBSTANCE and/or GLITTER from our jets and sanitize the jets thoroughly plus any charges or fees if the jets or the motor has been damaged

9. Fireplace – our condo has a gas fireplace that is available for our guests to use seasonally in the winter months. You are not allowed to put anything into the fireplace or adjust the programmed settings on the fireplace. 

10. Our condo is privately owned and the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its supporting facilities. The owners are not responsible for loss of personal property or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise. 

When accepting and completing your reservation – you acknowledge and agree to terms of this contract and agreement. 
* Credit Card/Bank Draft: Guest hereby gives permission to debit their account for any charges for damages or fees according to this agreement.
interaction: I am here for you!!
transit: You can seriously WALK everywhere in Downtown Gatlinburg!! Its awesome!! If you are tired then just grab a ride on the Gatlinburg Trolley! We have a trolley stand right in front of our building!!

description: Located in between Gatlinburg & P.F.Step back in time and enjoy the modern amenities with Old World charm at Cedar Point log cabin.  This beautiful and unique retreat was once a one room functioning log home. The reclaimed 100 year old logs created a one of a kind formal parlor with fireplace.  The modernized sections of the home features a kitchen, cozy dining room and a relaxing family area for entertaining with a pullout sofa for additional sleeping all under beautiful cathedral ceilings.The spaceCabin name:  Cedar Point No Pets: The cabin has a loft that area boasts a pool table, flat screen television with yet another additional sleeping space, providing a wonderful entertainment area for the entire family. The master bedroom features a queen size bed, a wall fireplace and a relaxing jacuzzi tub for quiet romantic getaways.  Enjoy your morning coffee in a private wooded setting while relaxing on one of two porch's that nearly wrap the entire home. Relax in the outside hot tub or grill a gourmet meal on the gas grill. You get the best of both worlds in this one of a kind cabin.  The feel of days gone by with the modern amenities of today. Cabin is a one bedroom but can accommodate up to 4 people.Guest accessentire cabinOther things to noteNightly price includes 3% lodging tax.All linens, towels, blankets and pillows are all provided.   Initial Paper toiletries and hand soap are also provided but please provide your own shampoos, conditioners and bath soaps.Kitchen is equipped with pot, pans, dishes and utensils.  I provide your first pot of coffee but food is also not provided.
additional_house_rules:
We just purchased this cabin at the end of November as a second home.  We are very excited about sharing it with all our family and friends (old and new).  We can not visit the cabin after every visit so please be kind and curtious to our new home.  We appreciate the upmost care you can provide to keep this home as special as possible for everyone to enjoy..

In order to reserve our vacation home, everyone who is traveling must be at least 21 years old or accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.
interaction: We  have 24 hour maintenance and home care.  If there is anything you need, please do not hesitate to call.
transit: Cedar Point Log Cabin is only minutes away from the arts district of Gatlinburg.  Down town Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge are less than 15 minutes away.  Gatlinburg Trolley has 100 trolley stops throughout Gatlinburg to explore everything Gatlinburg has to offer.  They offer free park and ride areas to leave your vehicle and enjoy the experience.

description: If our Timeless Memories cabin is booked please search our other cabin "Heaven's Reflection". Both located in the beautiful Sherwood Forest Resort, minutes from GSMNP, Dollywood, The Islands, Ziplining,  Gatlinburg, Alpine Coaster and dozens of other attractions. The cabin featues an open concept blessed with sunlight, 1 gas/1 electric fireplace, cable, high speed internet, pool table, 60 game arcade, hot tub, outdoor pool, jacuzzi, washer/dryer, and a fully equipped kitchen & dining area.The spaceI hope you'll find this cabin as special to you as it is to us. From the moment we saw it, we fell in love with it. From the open floor plan that basks in sunlight, to the views from the deck, you'll fall in love with it the moment you enter. We sleep comfortably in the King bed and my little guys use the King or sleeper sofa. We play pool and video games late nights while mom relaxes in the jetted tub in the master bedroom. Cold nights are especially nice by the gas fireplace. From there we run to the heated hot tub on the deck. My wife and I are continually updating the unit. We just purchased a new dining room set and arcade console  in December with more updates to follow. I hope you enjoy the cabin as much as we do and you'll stay with us in the future. Please be aware that the gas bbq on the deck has been replaced with an inground heavy duty charcoal bbq in front of cabin for safety reasons.Guest accessGuests have use of the entire cabin with the exception of the owners closet which is locked. Guests may use the resort pool June through August. Be advised there is no lifeguards present so please supervise little ones closely.Other things to note- My property manager manages many properties. With that being said, I have to keep tightly to the arrival and departure times to avoid conflicts for the next guests arriving. - Single night bookings are permitted only if the day before and after are booked. - Please note that you are in a gated resort community with cabins spaced about 50 feet apart. If seclusion is what you desire, you may want to stay elsewhere- We are pet free as too many guests are allergic( Sorry to my furry friends)- Cell service can be tricky in the mountains. Please insert the cabin address, and your door/resort gate code in a note on your phone when I send them- We cater to honeymooners or couples looking for an intimate getaway and small groups of families and friends looking for quality family time together...- Beds/Baths: One King Bed upstairs with jacuzzi and attached bathroom with walk in shower. One Kind Bed downstairs with tub/shower just outside bedroom- We are beautifully decorated for Christmas and seasons- Due to sometimes inclement weather in the winter, we recommend travel insurance, which we do have a source for obtaining.- REPAIRS & SERVICE CALLS: We take pride in maintaining our cabin & perform regular maintenance to keep everything in good working order. It is impossible, however, to guarantee that all appliances, hot tub, fireplaces, etc., will be in working order 100% of the time. We will, however, make every effort to correct any problem you encounter during your stay as soon as possible. Non-emergency maintenance issues will be handled during normal business hours. If you need emergency assistance for any reason, please contact me immediately. I'm available for guests 24 hours/day.  While we will make every attempt to correct all issues as quickly as possible, no refunds will be made for mechanical failures of hot tub, appliances/electronics, or interruption/loss of utilities (including satellite TV), etc. Any and all repairs to be made during your stay have to be approved by the guest before I allow a repair person in, unless the repair is of urgent circumstances, ie. water leaks, structural issues, and /or dangerous situations. Thank you so very much for your understanding.
additional_house_rules: Garbage must be placed in pails in front of cabin and dishes must be washed prior to departure. Guests failing to do so will be charged $50.00. The cabin has beautiful mountain views, but with that being said, they can be dangerous for children. The rear deck deck is no less than 50 feet above the ground and the fall would be fatal. Rest assured the deck is safe as I had a contractor add additional supporting structures under the hot tub area when I purchased the cabin. Children can drown in the hot tub, so they must always be supervised. The cover must always be on the hot tub when not in use. There is no gate on the deck, so if a child is on the porch, they can walk freely to the front of the cabin where guest traffic passes. Please, please watch little ones carefully.
interaction: I'm available to my guests by phone, text or email. I prefer a phone call/text upon arrival to ensure you've arrived safely and the cabin is in acceptable condition. You will forfeit your booking if the guest and owner do not speak within 48 hours of booking. Please call me if I do not get to call you. This is just to ensure that the guest and the rental property are a good fit.
transit: Please make sure you have a vehicle for transportation. If your flying in, I can refer you to numerous car rentals. Although the cabin is close to the attractions, you'll still need a vehicle to access them all. There is a trolly to get you into downtown Gatlinburg, just understand no matter what you drive, when the "Parkway" gets busy, everybody slows down. It may be busy, but it's only because there's so much to do and so many people wanting to do it like yourself.

description: Surround yourself with the serenity the Smokies have to offer.  Windows galore look out to privacy in every direction, yet just a few miles from Dollywood, the Gatlinburg Golf course, and the Pigeon Forge Pkwy! We like a cozy setting wherever we go, so we hope you enjoy the comforts of home plus the AWE of the views and Smokies around you! Avoid Bears, Dodge bugs or sweep them off the porch (we have swarming ladybugs seasonally and wood burrowing carpenter bees), flying squirrels, bats, rats, and sometimes a Raccoon that visits the porch. additional_house_rules:
- 21 Min Age to Book
- Lease Agreement
- 1. Check In Time: 4 PM - Check Out Time: 10 AM
- No late check-outs or early check-ins without permission from the owner.
- 2. This is a NON-SMOKING Condo. No smoking is allowed in our condo. There will be a $500 fine for any guest that smokes in our condo along with any fees to clean and deodorize the condo.
- 3. PETS ARE NOT ALLOWED - ANY PET Found to occupy the condo will be charged a pet fee of $500 in addition to any damage that may have been caused by your pet. Housekeeping staff performs a thorough inspection after every guest checks out to ensure compliance with this policy.
- 4. Cleaning - Your stay rate includes a one-time towel and linen set up. There is NO DAILY MAID SERVICE - while linens and bath towels are included in the cabin, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate. Please leave all wet or dirty towels at end of your stay either in jetted tub or shower.   Dishes - dishes, pots/pans, and utensils are provided. Please wash any dishes used during your stay and put away leaving condo in the same condition as guest found it upon arrival.
- 5. Trash - please place all trash in condo trash dumpster as you depart which is located in the parking lot near Baskins Creek Road.
- 6. RESERVATIONS
- RATE CHANGES - Rates vary thru-out the year and are subject to change. Once your reservation has been booked and a deposit is paid, your rate is locked.
- FALSIFIED RESERVATIONS - Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of advance payment, deposit and the party will not be permitted to check in.
- 7. STORM POLICIES/ROAD CONDITIONS/FIRES- although our condo is located in a populated resort area with very little steep inclines, the surrounding area may experience road condition issues during storms, snow, sleet or icy weather. No REFUNDS will be provided for Storm / weather related cancellations or FIRES that are not under the control of the owner.
- 8. Fireplace – our condo has a gas fireplace that is available for our guests to use seasonally in the winter months. You are not allowed to put anything into the fireplace or adjust the programmed settings on the fireplace.
- 9. Our condo is privately owned and the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its supporting facilities. The owners are not responsible for loss of personal property or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.
- 
- When accepting and completing your reservation – you acknowledge and agree to terms of this contract and agreement.
- * Credit Card/Bank Draft: Guests hereby give permission to debit their account for any charges for damages or fees according to this agreement.
interaction: I work with a team that helps me out - If you need anything don't hesitate to let us know and we will be here to help! We try to respond super quick - just give us a holler - we are here to help!!
transit: You can seriously WALK everywhere in Downtown Gatlinburg!! Its awesome!! If you are tired then just grab a ride on the Gatlinburg Trolley! We have a trolley stand right in front of our building!!

description: Sparkling Clean Sanitized Bear Dance is a whimsical, private rustic log cabin with a romantic mountain view decorated with dancing bears complete with stone gas log fireplace that will make you smile.  Conveniently located between Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge in Beautiful Sky Harbor Resort/quick access to all the attractions, the Smoky Mountain National Park, eateries/shops  Paved roads to the cabin.    Enjoy the  inspiring Smoky Mountain views surrounded by nature and peace.  Pet & Smoke FreeThe spaceYou must be 21 years of age or over to rent with proof of age from Drivers License or other acceptable picture IDWe take pride in having the cleanest cabins.  We empty hot tub water and sanitize between each guest, wipe down doorknobs, hard surfaces and disinfect in addition to regular cleaning so that you and your guest can enjoy nature and feel comfortable during your stay  This has been a very popular rental and 5 star cabin  in which we strive to keep our guests returning. We have made it into a whimsical Dancing Bear theme to enhance your stay.     Bear Dance is perfect for couples, honeymooners, solo, anniversaries, birthdays, business stay or just to get away from it all.  If you are looking for a cabin that is private and not next to other cabins and conveniently located to all of the attractions in Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg with a paved road all the way to the cabin....this is it!  Beautiful views and very peaceful.  We always get compliments on our cabins and cleanliness.  The only cabin on Old Barn Circle for privacyOpen concept with everything on one level except for game room downstairs with pool table, queen sleeper sofa  and half bath downstairs. New carpet downstairsHot tub on 10x22 deck overlooks the mountain viewKing size comfy bed with high count thread sheets and Designer Dancing Bear CoverletWIFI Cable Internet Phone Two new rocker reclinersNew full size washer and drier in own utility roomTwo new rockers on deckNew Bistro table for two on deckFully equipped kitchen, dishes, glasses,wine glasses, silverware, pots and pans coffee pot and toaster.Regular size washer and drier in utility roomKeurig coffee pot with coffee, cream and sugar packetsBeautiful Dancing Bear Theme throughoutPool table, new sleeper sofa and second tv downstairs plus 1/2 bathWifi, cable, phone and internet providedCentral AC and HeatStone Gas Log FireplaceSecond large deck 10x22 downstairs for the views with rocker and tableLarge deck 10x22 upstairs with hot tub overlooks the mountains and magnificent treesPlush towelsBarbeque charcoal pit area outside with a nice view (bring charcoal and lighter)Privacy- No cabins on either side, in front or behind- You will love this!If Bear Dance is unavailable on your requested nights we have 3 other fabulous 5 star quaint cabins, adorably decorated and clean with spectacular views called Just the Two of Us, Falcon Crest and Eagle's Nest    Please feel free to inquire with any questionsGuest accessAccess all areas except owners closet.Other things to noteSome cabins have rough rocky roads and sometimes dirt roads.  Sky Harbor provides a nice paved road all the way to the cabin.

description: Enjoy a memorable vacation in the Great Smoky Mountains in our cozy cabin, “Pinewood Getaway.” Located between Gatlinburg & Pigeon Forge, you will be close to all the major attractions.  We offer the following amenities to make this the perfect getaway✓ King bed in master suite with jacuzzi✓ Queen bed in loft✓ Queen sofa bed✓ Work Space✓ Hot tub (Brand New)✓ Gas Fireplace (Seasonally)✓ 65" TV in living area & 50" in BR w/Apps & YouTubeTV✓ Super fast WiFi✓ Washer & dryer✓ Charcoal GrillThe spaceIn the living area you will find a 65” 4k HDR flat screen TV with YouTubeTV, Netflix & hundreds of new release movies on Movies Anywhere, there is a deck with hot tub and sitting area, gas fireplace (available seasonally), sleeper sofa that converts into a queen size bed with a brand new mattress, chair and kitchen table seating for four. If you decide to spend a night in, our kitchen offers all the cookware needed to prepare a meal at home.Also downstairs is our spacious master suite, you will find a new king size mattress, 50” 4k HDR flat screen TV with YouTubeTV, Netflix & Movies Anywhere, jacuzzi tub, and an en-suite bathroom with a shower/tub.Upstairs you will find a loft with a new queen mattress, love seat (with a pull out twin mattress), TV with game consoles, a dedicated laptop working station and a hidden washer and dryer.   We are nestled up in the mountains (3 miles from the main parkway; mostly main roads through the mountain) so please keep in mind the roads can be steep and may require 4 wheel drive in the winter if you’re lucky enough to experience snow.*We do provide a starter set of toilet paper, paper towels and hand soap. Please note that we do not provide shampoo or spices/oil for cooking*Due to allergies, our cabin is not pet friendly, thank you for understanding.Guest accessYou will have access to the entire cabin and outdoor area. We are available by messenger during your stay.Other things to noteIf we happen to get snow, you may want to be sure you have a capable vehicle to get to the cabin.  The roads are all main roads; however, you should be cautious of the weather during the winter.Please note: no smoking is allowed on the property.  Due to allergies, no pets allowed on the property. Thank you
additional_house_rules:
Thank you for choosing our cabin! All guests must review and agree to the following rules before booking:
- No refunds will be given for storms. Mountain roads can be curvy and steep. We highly recommend a four-wheel drive vehicle during the snow months. We do not refund due to road conditions.
- All guests must be at least 25 years of age to rent this cabin. People other than those in the Guest party set forth in the on-line agreement may not stay overnight in the property. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of Guest. Guests are not allowed to exceed the occupancy limit agreed to in the on-line itinerary. No more than 6 persons (excluding infants) are allowed in the cabin at any time.
- The cabin is privately owned; the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.
- Please use appliances ONLY for their intended use.
- WIFI/CABLE SERVICE: Our internet and cable provider is responsible for the speed, reliability and quality of internet service provided which can be affected by weather.
- HOUSEKEEPING: There is no daily housekeeping service. Bed linens and bath towels are provided along with basic kitchenware and utensils. A starter supply is provided of personal soap, dish washing detergent, toilet paper, trash bags, and paper towels. Please note, we do not supply shampoo or body wash. Please be sure to pack your own.
- WATER AND SEPTIC: Pinewood Getaway is on well water. Please do not flush anything down toilets but toilet tissue. Feminine products, baby wipes etc. should not be flushed at anytime. If it is found that such products were flushed and a clog results you may be charged all fees associated with unclogging and resulting damages.
- HOT TUBS: Hot tubs are drained, cleaned and refilled after each guest stay. The bromine floater in the tub should provide the proper amount of chemicals to maintain the water quality. Hot tubs should not be used if you are pregnant or have health conditions where extended periods in hot water may not be safe. Children must be supervised at all times and never left unattended in the tub. Jewelry may become discolored from the chemicals. Never put additives such as bath salts or bubbles in the hot tub. Hot tub covers must remain on hot tubs when not in use. DO NOT STAND OR SIT OR PLACE ITEMS on hot tub covers. If cover is damaged by you, you will be required to pay for replacement. No children under 18 years of age in hot tub without adult supervision.
- OUTDOOR GRILLS: A charcoal grill is provided for guest use. Guests are expected to read and adhere to all instructions regarding use of grill.
- FIREPLACES: Fireplace season is Oct 1 – March 31. The fireplace will be shut off after this period. Do not place hands in or around fireplace or any vent. 
- We require that you place all trash in bear proof containers outside and latch the metal clip in place, leave the kitchen clean, dirty dishes ran through dishwasher. Lock all windows and doors; turn off lights, TV’s etc. before you depart.
- DAMAGE: In the event of damages or extra cleaning requirements created by guests, additional charges may be applied from damage deposit.
- WILDLIFE AND PESTS: The Great Smoky Mountains has more than 1,000 square mile of continuous wilderness including the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, National Forests, state parks and wilderness areas. Though relatively rare, black bear and other wild life can be encountered outside of these wildlife sanctuaries. Wildlife normally will stay away from cabins and chalets unless it has been food conditioned. For your own safety and the protection of our wildlife, we request that guests behave in an appropriate manner and keep their distance and that you do not feed bear, raccoons or any wildlife. You also need to make sure all food and garbage is secured so that wildlife does not have access to it. DO NOT LEAVE FOOD OR FOOD WRAPPERS IN YOUR CAR, bears have exceptional noses and may cause damage trying to get at the food/wrapper.
- There are also plenty of insects. Pinewood Getaway is treated monthly however it does not eliminate all pests. Certain times of the year we experience high volumes of a beetle which looks like a lady bug they are harmless just a nuisance. Other frequent pests are wood boring bees and wasps.
- Failure to comply with the above rules will result in non-return of security deposit and possible additional charges. Booking through Airbnb assigns your consent to all listed under "House Rules"
interaction: We offer instant self check-in upon arrival. We do our best to respond as quickly as possible to any questions you may have during your stay. Send us a message and we’ll get back asap.
transit: Once you get to the Parkway, you can take the trolley all around the popular places in Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg

description: ***Cabin is available for Thanksgiving but No Thanksgiving Day check-inAs you enter the cabin, the stunning beauty of imported Scandinavian logs fill your senses, and welcomes you to your new home away from home.  Enjoy the many comforts and conveniences in this professionally designed cabin which is located in a serene semi-secluded wooded setting.  Take a short 2.5 mile trip to the main parkway in Pigeon Forge which puts you minutes away from Dollywood, The Island and many other attractions.The spaceElegant Design and ConveniencesThe main floor of this cabin features a sitting area with comfortable furnishings in front of a tranquil gas log fireplace where you can settle in and watch a movie on the large 55’’ flat-screen 4k Smart HDTV with Cable and Netflix as well as Wi-Fi throughout the cabin for your added enjoyment. The kitchen is fully equipped with stainless steel appliances, a stack washer/dryer is located in the nearby laundry closet and the stylish dining table comfortably accommodates six. There is also a charcoal grill provided for cooking outdoors. Doors from both the living room and bedroom lead to the covered deck that offers a soothing hot tub and deck rockers to relax and enjoy the fresh mountain air. The Integrated Touchscreen Smart Panel allows you to control the temperature, lighting and alarm system throughout the cabin.Unwind and RelaxUnwind in regal fashion in the luxurious king bed suite or in the romantic jetted tub for two. Here you can cuddle in front of the cozy gas log fireplace and watch your favorite program on cable TV. The adjoining full bathroom features an amazing glass enclosed stone shower with a rainfall fixture and to make your stay even more special, there is a sauna where you can truly refresh your body, mind and spirit.Fun and GamesThe open loft features a pool table, board games, pub table, love seat sleeper, large flat-screen HDTV for hours of entertainment.What To Bring We will provide towels and bed linens, a starter set of toilet paper, dishwasher detergent, paper towels, garbage bags, shampoo and body wash. Our fully equipped kitchen includes appliances, pots, pans, cutlery, dishes and utensils. Items you need to bring include but are not limited to your toiletries, bottled water, cooking spices, coffee filters, extra blankets, laundry detergent and a flashlight.Guest accessGuests are welcomed to the entire cabin during there stay.Other things to noteIn order to ensure all future guests are able to enjoy our cabin, before departure please take a look at our Check-out Check list – Check out is at 10 a.m.	Please place all dirty dishes in the dishwasher and start it.  (Place coffee pot & filter basket in as well)	Place trash in trash bins outside, leave any that won’t fit in the bins in the kitchen	Place towels on the floor by the shower in the bathroom	Please strip the linens from the sleeper sofas if they were used during your trip.  You don’t need to strip the bed	Set the thermostat to 70 degrees during the winter months & 75 degrees during the summer months	Cover the hot tub if it isn’t covered already	Turn off all lights, TVs and appliances (big and small)	Set the alarm
additional_house_rules:
Self check-in with keypad
Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $250
Check-in is anytime after 4PM and check out by 10AM

Rental Rules

1. Smoking is NOT allowed inside the Property a $100.00 fine will be charged for additional cleaning in the event that evidence of smoking is found within the property.
2. People other than those in the Guest party may not stay overnight in the property. Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.
3. Pets are NOT allowed inside the Property.  Any guest found with a pet will be charged an additional cleaning fee, asked to leave immediately and no refund will be given.
4. The guest is expected to keep the Property clean and follow the check-out checklist, any excessive cleaning (BBQ Grill, Trash, etc.) will incur extra cleaning fees after departure.
5. All garbage must be placed in the bear proof garbage receptacles located in the front of the cabin.
6. Hot Tub: No children under the age of 18 are allowed in the hot tub without adult supervision. When using the hot tub, remember there is a certain health risk. USE AT YOUR OWN RISK. Hot tub covers are for insulation purposes and are not designed to support a person(s) weight.  They will break, and the Guest may be charged for replacement. Remember when not using the hot tub, leave the cover on so the hot tub will stay warm.
7. No refunds are given for weather. It snows in Tennessee and there are a steep hill’s entering the development which may require a 4-wheel drive to access if snow is present.
8. Parking in the driveway on the property is limited to 2 vehicle(s). Parking on the road is not permitted. Any illegally parked cars are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees are the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner.
9. Do not flush anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products should be flushed at anytime. If it is found that feminine products have been flushed and clog the septic system, you will be charged the cost of repairs.

Booking our cabin assigns your consent to all listed rules

Other things to Note

1. There is a steep hill leading to the community where the cabin is located but the roads are well paved so unless there's inclement weather any car should be fine.  With that being said we do recommend 4-wheel drive vehicles when visiting the area especially if there's inclement weather.
2. The cabin is in the woods so you will likely see and hear critters and may even be lucky enough to spot a bear!
3. The fireplace is shut down April 1 to October 1 as with most cabins in the area.
4. Please be respectful of our home as this is also a vacation home for us, thanks!
5. Video Cameras are installed outside the front and left side of the cabin closest to the road for your safety.
6. There is a camera lens located on the security panel inside the cabin which is meant to record security events (burglar alarm, fire alarm, etc.) which has been blocked so that it can no longer capture any media but we're disclosing its existence.
interaction: My co-host Kevin and I are best available via Airbnb messaging should you have any questions or need anything during your stay we will do our very best to accommodate as soon as possible. For emergencies please text and then call if there is no reply within 5 minutes.
transit: Be sure to drive or rent a car for easy access to all you may need during your stay including getting to your favorite attractions. Since our cabin is located in the Great Smokey Mountains use caution on your way to and from the cabin as you drive and maintain slower speeds.

description: "Her Majesty's Way" is a beautiful custom built cabin with breathtaking mountain views. This cabin has high vaulted ceilings in the Living Area and wall to wall picture windows that allow you to enjoy amazing mountain views any time of the year.  The view from deck see the Gatlinburg lights at night! Located close to Gatlinburg, and approximately 10 minutes from Dollywood & Splash Country. There are paved, curvy mountain roads that can be steep and narrow at times, but this private cabin would be considered motorcycle friendly only at the rider’s discretion. Available parking for 2 vehicles. This 2 Bedroom, 2 Bath unit that sleeps 6 is 2 levels. On the main level, you will find a fully equipped kitchen with bar seating for 6 and a very spacious Living Area with a Queen sofa sleeper, loveseat, stone wood fireplace, pool table, and a TV. There is a King bedroom and a full bath with a shower/tub combo.  The washer and dryer is also located on this level. On the upper level there is the master King bedroom with a Jacuzzi tub and a private bath with a walk in shower. There is also a large walk in closet. The large deck holds the Hot tub, patio furniture, and breathtaking mountain views. If you are looking for a gorgeous 2 bedroom retreat with all  the amenities of home with awe inspiring mountain view, look no further, "Her Majesty's Way" is the perfect cabin for you. description: Located at 3,000ft Gatlinburg Summit has unrivaled Smoky Mountain views. Our unique unit unlike other units at this property is newly built in 2016(other buildings were built in 1984). Our Studio Loft unit includes a private balcony and skylight in the loft area of incredible views of Mt. Leconte. It includes a real wood burning fireplace, new furnishings, granite countertops, new appliances, FAST Private Wi-Fi, Cable w/HBO, & Free Netflix. Outdoor & indoor pool & two hot tubs in the ClubhouseThe spacePoolhouse temporarily closed, indoor pool and hot tub will NOT be available for unknown period of time. Outdoor pool will be available.Our unit is truly unique. Just built in 2016, and it has never been on the rental market till now. Enjoy the unrivaled view along with all the modern amenities and furnishings. From the custom stone fireplace, the exposed wooden beams, to the granite countertops, this unit will make you feel at home in the mountains.**Please be aware that due to unbelievable views, great location, and amenities at The Summit of Gatlinburg, a large number of units have been popping up on AirBNB. Not all units at The Summit are equal. Only a select number of units in certain Bldgs have the GREAT VIEWs. Make sure the view pictured in the listing is from that Host's private balcony. On listings that don't specifically show the balcony view make sure to ask that host what building they are in. Only Buildings 1, 6, 7, & 8 will have the GREAT views. The pictures posted here are from Matt's balcony and are real photos from his balcony.Kitchen:New granite countertops, appliances, cabinets. Full-size refrigerator/freezer, K-Cup Coffee Maker and regular coffee maker, stove/oven, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, plates, cups, pots, pans, and all basic cookware. NEW-Added a 4qt CrockPot and Brita water filter pitcher.Living Room:All NEW flooring (Jan 2019), tall vaulted ceilings with real wood burning stone fireplace. Comfy couch and leather recliner. Brand NEW 55" Samsung HDTV. Private High-Speed WiFi. Private Balcony off living room with stunning views of Mt. Leconte. Two comfortable rocking chairs with a table to enjoy the views while drinking a glass of wine or your favorite drink.Bathroom:Full Bathtub/Shower with glass doors. Granite countertop vanity. Towels, hand towels, wash cloths, make up cloths as well as a basic starter set of Shampoo, Conditioner, Lotion, and soap supplied.Beds:Queen size alcove bed is tucked away off living room space. Upstairs is a stand alone Queen size bed in the loft area. The loft bed looks out the upstairs sky light that is aimed at Mt. Leconte. You can lay in bed and enjoy the mountain view or starry nights. Fresh and comfy linens, blankets, and pillows all included.Location:Gatlinburg Summit is located in a wonderful area that is a very quiet and peaceful setting. While it is atop the mountain in order to have the magnificent views, it is still close to all the action. You are just around the corner from Ober Gatlinburg. You can skip all the Gatlinburg traffic by taking the bypass and arrive quickly and stress free. Downtown Gatlinburg is quickly accessible by 4 different locations to give you plenty of options including Ski Mountain Rd(Light #10), Sugarlands Welcome Center in the National Park(via bypass), Light #3 at Ripley's Aquarium(via Campbell Lead Rd) and the entrance of Gatlinburg(via the bypass). All of these options are just a short 10-15 minute trip. In addition, Pigeon Forge is right down the road via the bypass in about 15-20 minutes. Don't feel like driving much? Take a very short drive to Ober Gatlinburg(less than 2 miles) and ride the scenic Aerial Tram into downtown Gatlinburg. The trams run every 20 minutes so you can return whenever you please.Guest accessGuests have full access to all facilities at Gatlinburg Summit including: Outdoor Pool, Indoor Pool, 2 indoor hot tubs, clubhouse, small arcade, laundry room, picnic/grill area, basketball goal.Other things to noteWhile I don't have "Instant-Booking" turned on, I always respond very quickly. If you see in gaps in my calendar for 1 or 2 night stays that don't meet the 3 night minimum feel free to send me an inquiry. I generally will allow these as they form in the calendar. If this space is booked or doesn't accommodate you and your guests properly please consider my other units at the same location.Wild bears do wander onto the property often. Please do NOT feed the bears or attempt to interact with them for your own safety.
additional_house_rules:
Absolutely No Smoking of any kind allowed. Any evidence of smoking will result in forfeiture of Security Deposit. 

My HOA has a strict - No Pet Policy. We fully comply with FDA Service Animal requests, however Emotional Support Animals(ESA) are not permitted. Service Animals that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for persons with disabilities are welcomed. Comfort or Emotional Support Animals are not Service Animals, and therefore not permitted. I apologize for any inconvenience, this is an HOA rule that is strictly enforced, of which I have no control over.
interaction: I am available as much or little as needed by phone, text, or email. I am very knowledgeable about Gatlinburg, the National Park, Pigeon Forge, and Sevierville area. I was a 2-3 times a year tourists to the area for 30 years before owning this condo. My wife and I married in Gatlinburg so it is truly a special place for us and we would like to make your trip special and memorable for you.
transit: The condo is located just above Gatlinburg w/convenient access via Gatlinburg Bypass. The last 2.5 miles to the condo can be curvy at times, but is a nice fully paved, 2 separated lanes Scenic Mountain Road. Located close to the aerial tram at O'ber Gatlinburg(1.5 miles). Free public transportation throughout Gatlinburg via Trolleys(the trolleys do not run on the mountain).

description: Our chalet is nestled in the woods with great views in Gatlinburg. A home away from home with super comfortable sofas, the chalet is private, quiet and relaxed. Far enough from the craziness of town, yet only 10 mins away from Gatlinburg.Whether you want to explore 800 miles of hiking in the Smoky Mtns or spend time indoors with friends and family - Lazy Bear Retreat is the perfect place for you!★ Experience mountain living & wake up to amazing views❤ Full refund 5 days prior to arrivalThe spaceLazy Bear Retreat features a king-bed master suite with its own bathroom downstairs. There is a work desk with a chair for those who want to ‘work from home’ with high speed WiFiThe loft bedroom has a full on queen bunk bed comfortable for two adults and a teenager.  Each bed contains a memory foam mattress complete with luxurious linens and four down pillows.   We have video games and an air hockey table in the loft. This is our cabin and you will get all the attention before and during your stay here unlike the ones run by a big rental company. Enjoy a great book or your favorite movie by the fire, wrapped in one of our cozy throws as you take in the wooded views from the living room with vaulted ceilings and a 55”flat screen TV. The beautiful dining area comes complete with a large dining table and seating for four plus two countertop chairs - ideal for family meals, game nights, or breakfast in. Our customized kitchen comes complete with new countertops, stainless steel appliances, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, and all the cookware you will need. When it comes to additional food options, the choices in the Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg are endless. You are a short, 10 minute drive to Gatlinburg and a 25 minutes drive to downtown Pigeon Forge. Outside you’ll find our spacious deck with great views. You can also unwind after a day of hiking in the sauna or get in the hot tub with top of the line jets and lighting. ★ Located on Ski Mountain in Gatlinburg. This cozy home sleeps 6 (Max 4 Adults)★ The interior of the cabin has been updated with new carpet, furniture, appliances and granite countertops. The warm and cozy furniture feels like you are at home. The bedroom has a king bed with a 42” TV. The loft room has a bunk bed, sauna, multi-game arcade table and air hockey table.The living room has a seasonal gas fireplace, 50” LCD TV.★ Downtown Gatlinburg (5 mins), Pigeon Forge (20 mins), Ober Ski Resort (5 mins) and Great Smoky Mountain Nat. Park★ Fully-equipped kitchen is open to a large living room and dining★ In-house Sauna ★ Working Desk + WiFi★ Enjoy the privacy, while relaxing in hot tub with a glass of wine as you watch the sunsetGuest accessWe have flat parking for two cars.

description: Whispering Creek is a beautifully upgraded & remodeled Cabin nestled conveniently between Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg, The Great Smoky Mountains National Park and World Famous Dollywood! Beyond the easy access to all Tennessee's local attractions you'll enjoy our new jacuzzi spa under the stars outside, Amish furniture & cozy fireplaces inside while surrounded by natural knotted wood interiors, hard wood floors & new kitchen appliances. Easy access driveway with room for several vehicles alongside our own gently babbling brook.

description: Mountain PEAK Lodge, which is a new custom construction cabin located near Downtown Gatlinburg will put you close to all the action! You will be only 1.3 miles from Parkway and 2.3 miles from the downtown Space Needle! Get ready to experience up close and personal views of the amazing Mt LeConte and the Anakeesta Tower from the deck of your cabin! Between the views and the fantastic location it’s hard to go wrong with Mountain Peak Lodge! This is the perfect cabin for couples or small families!The spacePanoramic Mountain Views | Mt LeConte/Anakeesta Views | Keyless Entry | Outdoor Grill | WIFI | Cable | New Construction | Hot Tub | Barrel Arcade Games | Rare Flat Parking with only two steps!Tucked aloft a beautiful mountain overlooking the gorgeous Smoky Mountain National Park and Gatlinburg! The cabin boasts an open concept floor plan where you can entertain and enjoy one another's company during your stay. The living room features a comfy sleeper sofa and chairs, whiskey barrel arcade game, electric fireplace, 55" Flat screen TV, and direct access to the covered deck overlooking the Smoky Mountains!The kitchen boasts all stainless steel appliances and fully stocked to cook your favorite mountain meals! Enjoy sitting at the granite counter top bar as you eat your fluffy pancakes! Make sure to checkout the coffee station which offers a dual coffee maker for K-Cups and traditional coffee.The master suite offers a king size bed, 40" flat screen TV, and en-suite bathroom where you will enjoy the oversized soaker tub and breathtaking fully tiled shower! The second bedroom offers a queen size bed and 40" flat screen TV!For those of you who look forward to spending your time gazing at the stars and mountains, you will certainly love the fully covered deck where you will find a brand new hot tub, outdoor patio furniture, propane fire pit, Gas Grill, and twinkle lights. Let the adventures begin at “Mountain Peak Lodge” near the heart of Downtown Gatlinburg!
additional_house_rules: RENTAL RULES •NO PETS: If pets are identified in the lodge, the renter will be assessed a $500 fee. •SMOKING: Smoking is allowed outside only. Guest agrees to pay an additional cleaning fee of $250 if Guest or any member of Guest’s party smokes inside the lodge. • People other than those in the Guest party set forth above may not stay overnight in the property. • AGE REQUIREMENT: The renter of the property must be 25 years of age or older. • OCCUPANCY AND USE: Occupancy and use of premises shall not be such as to disturb or offend neighbors or residents. Cabin occupancy is determined by the number of guest over the age of 2 years old. Children, teenagers, and young adults MUST be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. • FRATERNITIES AND SORORITIES: Under no circumstances will Fraternities and Sororities be allowed in the lodge. • RATES AND MINIMUM STAYS: We have a two-night minimum stay on all reservations. Major holidays and other peak season weekends require a 3- to 5-night minimum stay. • PARKING: Parking is limited to 2 vehicle(s). Campers are not allowed to be parked in the lodge yard • WATER/SEPTIC: The property is on a well and septic systems. PLEASE DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper. • STORMS/WEATHER: No refunds will be given for storms/inclement weather. Mountain roads can be curvy and steep. The roads and driveways leading to the property are all paved and well maintained; however, we highly recommend four wheel drive and/or chains during the snow months. We do not refund due to road conditions. Please consider purchasing trip insurance (traveler insurance) if you are concerned about bad weather affecting your vacation. • ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES: Guest shall not perform any illegal activity while residing in the property. Guest shall not manufacture, use or abuse any illegal drugs while residing in the property. • HOUSE PARTIES: are strictly prohibited. Any loud party, rowdy, loud or disruptive behavior/activities are strictly forbidden. • COMMUNICATION: It is a crime to obtain this rental property under false pretenses. Communication about a reservation, even after departure, must only be with the guest named on the reservation. • DAMAGE/THEFT: Guest(s) agrees to leave the premises in a clean, undamaged condition. Guest accepts full responsibility for all damages caused by any member of the party staying in or visiting the reserved lodge. • USAGE: In cases of accommodations with pools, jacuzzi tubs and/or hot tubs, decks, observation decks, gas and charcoal grills, etc. the Guest agrees to use such at their own risk and to hold the Owner harmless from liability. • CABIN SUPPLIES: We will provide a starter supply of soap, dishwasher detergent, toilet paper, trash bags and paper towels. Cabin is supplied with linens and towels as well as kitchenware and utensils. • WEAPONS AND DRUGS: PROHIBITED on the premises. • MALFUNCTIONS: We do not guarantee that utilities, appliances, or amenities will not fail; but we will do our best to repair them as soon as possible. • NO REFUNDS due to any failures or any malfunctions. NO REFUNDS or reduction in rent • Check-in begins after lodge inspection is completed, no earlier than 4:00 p.m. local time. We will check guests in as soon as the cabin is ready. We cannot guarantee early check-in or late check-out requests. • Bears: Guest shall not leave any food or garbage outside the property, except within the special Bear-Proof trash receptacles located in front of the cabin. Bears do roam the neighborhood at night and will cause a HUGE MESS if any trash is left outside without securing it within the proper receptacle. Guest is responsible for cleaning up any mess that results from improperly stored trash. Guest will not purposefully place food outside to attract bears. This is not only dangerous and foolish, but also a violation of Tennessee State Law and will result in immediate eviction without refund. • Check Out Procedure: Check-Out Time is 10 am Please make sure that all trash is out in the outside trash bin no later than 9 am Make sure all towels are left in the bathtub. Dispose of all food from fridge and cabinets All dirty dishes are placed in the dishwasher and the dishwasher has been started Thermostat is set at 60 degrees in the WINTER and 80 degrees in the SUMMER.
interaction: We are always available for any guest needs/questions/concerns, before during or after your stay.
transit: Parking for 2 vehicles on a paved driveway which is flat! All roads leading to the cabin are blacktop/paved! 4WD recommended during the winter months due to potential snowfall/ice and mountain terrain with some steep inclines.

name: On the River | 👀Charming Decor + River View = Romance😍
amenities: Hot water,Washer,Dryer,Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper,Bed linens,TV with standard cable,Air conditioning,Indoor fireplace,Heating,Smoke alarm,Fire extinguisher,Wifi,Dedicated workspace - Guests have a desk or table that’s used just for working, along with a comfortable chair.,Kitchen - Space where guests can cook their own meals,Refrigerator,Microwave,Dishes and silverware - Bowls, chopsticks, plates, cups, etc.,Dishwasher,Stove,Oven,Coffee maker,Private entrance - Separate street or building entrance,Free parking on premises,Hot tub,Single level home - No stairs in home,Pets allowed - Assistance animals are always allowed,Self check-in,Keypad - Check yourself into the home with a door code,Long term stays allowed - Allow stay for 28 days or more
description: Luxurious, inviting, and ideal for 2 guests, On the River is a charming pet-friendly, 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom cabin rental in Gatlinburg, Tennessee. Not far from downtown attractions, shops, and eateries, you'll be near all the fun! Plus, you'll be right on the river's edge, so you can enjoy the flowing water while soaking in the hot tub or sipping wine in the rockers on the screened deck or lounging in the log seating in the grassy space. Inside, the living room is warm and inviting and features a stone (gas) fireplace, an antler chandelier, cozy furnishings, a big screen TV and DVD player, and a cushioned reading nook with a small library. Craving a bite to eat or something refreshing to drink? Head to the retro-chic kitchen that's fully equipped with everything you need to prep and serve meals throughout your stay in the Smokies. There's even a romantic dining space with a table for 2. Ready to snuggle with your partner? First, draw a hot bubble bath in the copper soaking tub or take a relaxing rain shower. Next, slip into your favorite jammies and curl up in the king-size bed together. You can switch on the lamps or TV and stay up for a while if you like. Additional amenities at this Gatlinburg river cabin include free Wi-Fi, a charcoal grill, a washer and dryer, a flat and paved driveway with parking for 3 vehicles, and keyless entry. Make your Smoky Mountain stay a memorable one at On the River!The space...living area with a big screen TV and stone fireplace, a relaxed reading nook and mini library, a large tiled rain shower, and a spacious bedroom with a soothing copper tub and comfy king-size bed. Combining these great amenities with an optimal location less than 1 mile from downtown attractions, On the River is an ideal escape — perfect for romantic weekends away, an unforgettable honeymoon, or extended anniversary vacations.Living RoomStep into the inviting living room, featuring a plush sofa, matching recliner, big screen TV, and stone gas fireplace. The light wood flooring and ceiling complement the dark walls in between, and the stylish décor and an antler chandelier pair well with the cream tables and patterned area rug. Snuggle with your spouse and a soft throw on the sofa, pop in a drama DVD for movie night, or curl up with a romance novel by a toasty fire. Oh, and don’t forget the lounge area nearby, boasting cushioned seating, a mini library, and lovely river views. It’s the perfect place to unwind with a good book, update social media, chat with your honey, or sip champagne.KitchenA bright contrast to the warm living area, the galley kitchen is fully equipped, providing all the appliances, tools, dishware, and prep space you’ll need for homemade meals. Home to mint-green, retro-style appliances, a white farmhouse sink, open wood shelving, plus stainless-steel touches, whipping up tasty dishes, in-between-meal munchies, and midnight snacks in this kitchen will be a piece of cake…which you can bake at the cabin or bring back from town. Hot breakfasts on the stove, fresh veggies and fruits from the fridge, steaming cups of joe from the coffeemaker, parmesan-topped popcorn from the microwave, and a dishwasher to take care of the mess — the kitchen at On the River sure does deliver!Dining AreaJust off the kitchen lies the quaint dining area, harboring a woven rug, wooden table for 2, and a modern chandelier overhead. While dining on self-prepared meals, reheated leftovers from town, or delivery is good, why not go the extra mile for this romantic occasion and splurge on a private in-cabin chef? Or you could opt for a gift basket filled with goodies instead — yum! Either way, the dining space is sure to come in handy for delectable meals, card games, or checking emails.BedroomAh, the spacious, restful bedroom awaits with chic furnishings, including a king-size bed with extra pillows, a copper tub, metallic chandeliers, and bedside lamps. There’s even a mounted flatscreen TV for entertainment. After exploring the area and hiking in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, you’ll enjoy a muscle-relaxing soak in the copper tub — add lavender-scented candles and calming tunes to really enhance the luxurious experience. Or maybe you’d prefer a wash in the tiled rain shower with room for 2. And the bathroom vanity with his-and-her sinks will make getting ready for town or bed a breeze.Outdoor Spaces Picturesque to say the least, On the River boasts a top-notch riverfront location, making the great outdoors a place you’ll want to be throughout your Gatlinburg stay. After smooth travels along flat roads, pull up and park up to 3 vehicles (there’s room for a trailer) in the paved, motorcycle-friendly driveway, grab your suitcases, head 3 steps up into the cabin, and make yourself right at home.On the screened-in deck, you’ll find a bubbly hot tub for relaxing riverfront soaks in addition to rocking chairs, which pair perfect with a glass of sweet tea in summer or a mug of hot cocoa in winter. Reconnect with nature on a deeper level as you head to the outdoor seating area, featuring cushioned Adirondack chairs with throw pillows, lush overhanging trees, and the rushing Little Pigeon River. Breathe in that fresh mountain air and listen to the sounds of wildlife as you unwind with a cup of coffee in the mornings. And don’t forget to fire up the charcoal grill for evening barbecues!Other AmenitiesOn the River has it all — and then some! Use the high-speed wireless internet to plug in for a bit, update social media, browse local deals, and check out our blog. Best of all, this humble riverfront abode is pet friendly, meaning Fido is more than welcome to take in the wondrous sights, head-turning sounds, and intriguing scents of Gatlinburg! It's also motorcycle friendly, making parking much easier. Local FunEnjoy the best of both worlds at this cozy Smoky Mountain cabin: soak up the serenity of the Little Pigeon River and take advantage of the convenient location near downtown Gatlinburg — less than 1 mile away! Go for a leisurely walk or a short drive to local attractions, restaurants, and shops with ease when you book a relaxing stay at On the River.Ripley’s Davy Crockett Mini-GolfPutt-putt to victory with family and friends at Ripley’s Davy Crockett Mini-Golf, boasting innovative and amusing courses.Gatlinburg Mountain CoasterSpeed through the trees, over high hills, around sharp turns, and down the mountain aboard the Gatlinburg Mountain Coaster!Ole Smoky Moonshine Taste that good Ole Smoky Moonshine at the most-visited distillery in the nation, then bring a few jars back to the cabin!It is not uncommon to encounter wildlife animals, such as bears while staying in cabins in the Smoky Mountains.Other things to noteNo parties or events allowed.  It is not uncommon to encounter wildlife animals, such as bears while staying in cabins in the Smoky Mountains.
additional_house_rules:
All renters will be required to sign a guest agreement after booking. 

For 1-4 bedroom properties, guest must be at least 18 years of age to book. For 5+ bedroom properties, guest must be at least 25 years of age to book. 

Should an event be held at the property that hosts a higher number of guests than the property can sleep, an additional charge of $750 will be imposed. 

Should a student organization be interested in booking the property, they must inform the host of their college club. Additionally, at least one guest staying at the property must be 25 years of age or older.
