description: If you want a cabin with character, views, and a location in Gatlinburg, "Hiker's Hideout" is just for you! Located in Chalet Village, it is 2 miles from Downtown and 5 minutes from the GSMNP entrance.Sleeping 6, this cabin comes with 2 BR (2 Qs), 1 Full pullout, 1.5 bath, Hot tub, Gas Grill, WIFI, Gas Fireplace, 3 clubhouses/pools, and much more! Enjoy the surreal mountain views off the deck, and from inside this A-frame.Large driveway for parking! Pool and clubhouses are available in season.The spaceCabin sleeps up to 6 guests maximum.  Cabin has 2 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms. Pools available in season!Bedroom 1- Queen Bed, Smart TV, Main FloorBedroom 2- Queen Bed, Smart TV, 2nd FloorBathroom 1- Stand-Up Shower, Main FloorHalf Bathroom- 2nd FloorKitchen- Custom Cabinets, Granite Countertops, Stainless Steel Appliances, Pots, Pans, Dishes, Keurig and Regular Coffee Maker (Bring Coffee), Silverware, Cups, Wine GlassesLiving Room- Sleeper Sofa (Sleeps 2), Smart TV, Gas Fireplace (Seasonal)Deck Area- Hot Tub, Seating, Gas Grill, Awesome Mountain ViewsPool Resorts - 3 available pools located throughout Chalet Village!Guest accessEntire Cabin/Pool in SeasonOther things to noteMust be 21 or older to book this cabin.This cabin sleeps 6 guests maximum.We always recommend 4x4 drive for anywhere in The Great Smoky Mountains. Must be returned or subject to a charge! Pool available in season. Coffee maker is a regular and Keurig coffee maker. (bring own coffee)

description: Welcome to one of the most amazing cabins in Gatlinburg, TN!  This newly constructed cabin features gorgeous hardwoods throughout and tons of amenities!  This luxurious cabin sits right on the mighty Roaring Fork Stream that flows directly out of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park!  Downtown Gatlinburg is only 1 mile away, too!  Don't forget about the huge screened in porch that features a full size bed to sleep in and enjoy the rushing sound of water all night!  Hope to see you soon!The spaceThis cabin offers one of the best experiences in all of Gatlinburg, TN! It features a huge screened-in porch and hot tub with gorgeous waterside views of the mighty Roaring Fork Stream that flows right out of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park!Guest accessEntire CabinOther things to noteThe Roaring Fork Stream is stocked weekly by the City of Gatlinburg.  You can grab a fishing license locally.Must be 21 or older to book this cabin.This cabin sleeps 8 guests maximum.We always recommend 4x4 drive for anywhere in The Great Smoky Mountains.  The cabin features paved roads all the way and without any inclement weather any car should be fine but again, we recommend 4x4 wheel drive when visiting the area.Fireplace is wood burning. We do not provide firewood.They are rebuilding a condo complex behind the cabin.  They are nearing completion.  We just want to make you aware but there should be no noise issues inside the cabin nor on the porch other than the wonderful sound of rushing water.

additional_house_rules:
SMOKE-FREE HOME:
No tabacoo or marijuana smoking or smoking of any kind on premises. $500 fine for violation.

PET-FRIENDLY HOME:
Pets are welcomed at our cabin. Your pet must be potty trained and at least 1 year old. We allow one dog per stay with a maximum weight of 65 lbs, and no aggressive breeds. There is additional $45 per night pet fee. Please review the detail pet policy below before booking.

Maximum 9 adult guests. Reservation is valid for you and guest at time of booking. If number of adult/total guests exceeds maximum you will be asked to leave with no refund.

Failure to comply with the following rules may result in non-return of security deposit and possible additional charges. Booking through Airbnb assigns your consent to all listed under "House Rules". 

PET POLICY:
1) Dogs are not allowed on furniture, especially sofas and beds. For cats please bring your own blanket if they love to stay on furniture.  

2) The dog must be in a kennel if left alone inside the house. Also, the dog must be accustomed to being kenneled and not bark constantly when left alone.

3) The dog must be potty trained and at least 1 year old. We allow one dog in the house with a maximum weight of 65 lbs., and no aggressive breeds.

4) Guests must pick up after their pets and discard waste properly.

5) As a courtesy to others, guests will walk their dog to the road before allowing them to relieve themselves. 

6) Please keep your dog on leash all the time when outside of our property.

7) Pets are not allowed to be washed in the showers. Guests may use the garden hose and spigot for such purposes on the driveway only.

8) The bath towels and hand towels in the bathroom are for humans only. You should bring your own pet towels and wipes. Please discard the wipes in a trash can and do not flush down the toilet.

9) Please do not use any human crockery for your pet. You should bring your own pet bowls.

10) If your pet sheds hair, please brush the pet outside daily. There is a vacuum cleaner and lint roller that you can find in the laundry room, please try your best to clean it up before leaving.

11) Please report any incidents so I can ensure they are cleaned up properly and do not encourage future guest’s dogs to pee there.

12) Guests are required to pay for any damage their pet causes.

13) Guests must agree to follow the Pet Policy.

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

RENTAL AGREEMENT FOR B&P ONE LLC 

This agreement is entered into by and between the rental owner, B&P One LLC and the guest(s) who are defined as the person(s) renting the property located at 1004 Elm rd Gatlinburg TN 37738 and any of their guest(s) and invited. The premise is a vacation rental. The rights and obligations of the parties to this agreement include unique provisions permitting the disbursement of rent prior to tenancy and expediting eviction of tenants. Your signature to this agreement, or payment of money or taking possession of the property is evidence of your acceptance of the agreement and your intent to use this property for a vacation rental. 

ARRIVAL/DEPARTURES: Check in time is 4:00 PM Eastern Time or later. Early check in is NOT available during holidays, the summer or the month of October. During non-peak seasons, your cabin may be ready earlier than 4:00 PM. We cannot guarantee an early check-in, but if it's available sooner than 4:00 we'll let you know. Check out time is by 10:00 AM Eastern Time. If you stay past the agreed upon checkout time without the host's consent, you might be charged an additional $50 per hour late fee. NO REFUNDS OR PARTIAL REFUNDS will be given for early departure or any other reasons, including inclement weather, construction, road conditions, or malfunctions in equipment (i.e. hot tubs, jacuzzi, fireplace, DVD players etc.). If you are traveling to the area during the winter season, we advise that you keep a check on the local weather. In order to help keep the cabin maintained for the next renter we ask that you adhere to the following rules: On the day of your check-out, please refer to the checklist provided in the rental information. We ask that you leave the house in good condition, thermostats set to the requested settings and ALL doors are locked. If these procedures are not followed an excessive cleaning fee will be charged. WHAT WE PROVIDE: Your rental includes the set up of the house with towels and bed linens. There's a starter supply of coffee, toilet paper and paper towels. We provide hand soap, liquid dish detergent, dishwashing detergent and basic cleaning supplies. You might also find a complimentary welcome plate. 

NOTIFICATION OF OWNER: If you find that something is not operating correctly, appears damaged or needs housekeeping attention, you agree to contact us immediately. If warranted, we will make every attempt to repair or correct the situation as promptly as possible. If repairs are required, you agree to provide access to the property. 

SECURITY: There is an onsite automated security system with outside cameras to ensure a safe environment. 

PETS: If a pet is found on premises without notifying the host in advance, you will be charged with a $45 per night pet fee plus an additional $250 dollar cleaning fee. 

ELECTRICITY OUTAGES: If basic utilities such as electricity experience a lengthy outage of more than eight (8) hours, we will refund the portion of your stay that is impacted by the outage. These situations are rare but we want you to know that we will do everything possible to address the outage promptly with your comfort and safety in mind. 

WATER AND SEPTIC: The cabin is on city water and septic sewerage. The sewerage system is sensitive, it will clog up if improper material is flushed. DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products should be flushed at any time. If it is found that feminine products have been flushed and clog the septic system, you will be charged for damages. 

STORMS: No refunds will be given for storms and road conditions. Mountain roads can be curvy and steep so we highly recommend four wheel drive and/or chains during the winter months. 

INTERNET SERVICE: We offer high speed internet. However, if there is an outage beyond our control, no refunds or rate adjustments will be made. We will do our best to expedite any service calls, if necessary, and replace routers promptly if our equipment should fail. 

COMMUNITY RULES: Guests agree to abide by community rules and not to cause nuisance to any neighbors by their actions, noise or other. You risk being evicted if neighbors call the police to complain about nuisances. Remember that there are permanent residents living in the area and you must respect their rights. House parties are not permitted and will be cause for immediate eviction with no refund. 

ACCIDENTS, THEFT OR LOSS OF PROPERTY: Owner is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises and guest(s) agree to hold B&P One LLC, it owners, employees and agents harmless for any accident, injury or illness that occurs on the premise. You are solely responsible for all personal items brought to the property. Please secure valuables while you are gone by placing them out of view, closing window blinds, locking all entry doors. Our property insurance will not cover items brought into the cabin by outside parties. 

FORGOTTEN ITEMS: If you believe you have left an item behind, contact your host Phoebe Ngai, as soon as possible so we can have housekeeping search for you item. If they have to make a special trip, there will be a $25.00 service call fee plus the cost to ship the item back. 

PESTS AND ENVIRONMENT: To ensure the best guest experience, we perform regular pest control maintenance on the cabin. Because the cabin is located in wooded and mountainous areas we cannot guarantee that the cabin will be pest free. We do not offer refunds for pests. Unfortunately, ladybugs and other pests are a part of our environment and we are unable to prevent them from occasionally visiting the cabin. Please contact us if the need arises and we will do our best to resolve the issue. 

MINIMUM AGE: We require the responsible party who signs the lease to be at least 21 years of age at the time of booking. We do not accept rentals made by parents on behalf of their children under the age of 21. Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of lodging payment(s) and the party will not be permitted to check-in or evicted if already at the property. 

RENTAL TERMS: B&P One LLC unilaterally and at its sole discretion reserves the right to change or cancel the reservations for any reason with refunds made accordingly, in the event the property becomes unavailable to rent. Under no event will B&P One LLC, its owners, employees and agents be liable for any amount exceeding rental amount. PROPERTY: Renter(s)/guest(s) acknowledge that there have been no representations, warranties, promises and guarantees with respect to the building or property. Warranties as to the fitness for a particular purpose or merchantability are expressly disclaimed. INDEMNITY CLAUSE: The registered guest agrees to indemnify B&P One LLC, its owner, employees and agents of any damages to the building, contents property and ground which result from the renter’s occupancy including furnishings and household items and/or damages found upon arrival. The registered guest is the person responsible for any damages his/her group causes to the building, contents, property and ground. B&P One LLC, its owners, employees and agents will not be responsible for accidents or injury to guests or for loss of money or valuables of any kind. The registered guest assumes full responsibility for any and all damages that his/her party causes, such as, but not limited to, excessive cleaning charges for problems caused by his/her parties visit, including linens and towels. Your electronics signature on this document means you agree to be responsible for any damages, missing items and/or excessive cleaning that are made necessary by your stay. The person's name on the reservation will be billed. 

DISCLAIMER: Guests for themselves and their respective heir, personal representatives, successors, and assigns, hereby release B&P One LLC, its owners, employees and agents of all claims, demands or cause or thing whatsoever resulting for or in connection with the property of this rental contract, including without limitation any claim, demand or cause of action for personal injury or death and any and all loss, liability, cost and expense resulting from any claim, demand, suit or cause of action which may be asserted. JURISDICTION AND VENUE: Guest(s) agree that Sevier County, Tennessee has jurisdiction over any issue or claim arising under this agreement and venue is proper and exclusive to Sevier County, Tennessee. DEFAULT: If the guest defaults under the agreement then B&P One LLC shall be entitled to the remedial outlined herein and any remedial available to it at law or equity and it shall be entitled to recover all costs incurred in the enforcement of the agreement including but not limited to reasonable attorney fees. These Policies and Procedures above are meant to protect you, our guests, and the owners alike. All guests, as well as owners are required to conform to all Policies and Procedures. We want you to have an enjoyable rental experience from B&P One LLC!

description: Absolutely beautiful 2 bedroom log home with modern touches and creature comforts. After pulling up to the private driveway, you arrive in your very own log cabin paradise with wooded privacy and gorgeous views. Right outside is a bubbling hot tub, cozy fire ring, and a propane gas BBQ grill. Step inside to a beautiful living space with a warm gas fireplace, newly renovated kitchen + bathrooms, modern bedrooms, and a game corner in the loft.The spaceGorgeously furnished living room, dining area, and newly renovated kitchen and bathroom. - Beautifully furnished living room with a warm gas fireplace- 1 enclosed bedroom on the first floor with a queen-sized bed- 1 open loft bedroom upstairs with a king-sized bed w/ its very own private patio- Cozy loft game corner with board games and TV- 1 main-level bathroom and 1 loft-level bathroom- Outdoor fire ring w/ lounge chairs- Picnic table w/ propane grill for a beautiful al fresco meal- Jetted hot tub overlooking the mountains- Open concept living + kitchen space where the friends/family can gather- Grab a cup of coffee and wake up to breathtaking views on the patio!**Our outdoor BBQ grill uses a propane tank. Guests who would like to use the grill are responsible for refilling the tank if empty upon arrival.Guest accessGuests will have access to everything inside and outside of the cabin :)
interaction: We are always available via Airbnb messaging before, during and after your stay :)

description: Do you want to just see the Smokies from a distance of would you rather stay in the mountains with the majestic peaks surrounding you? Our chalet style, authentic Appalachian timber, log home sits on a .82 acre wooded lot, 2500 feet up on Cove Mountain and has no next door neighbors. All you see around you are beautiful views of the Great Smoky Mountains.The spaceSouthern Drawl Cabin offers over sixteen hundred square feet of living space, a great room with soaring cathedral ceilings,  a spacious kitchen with an island,  a main level bedroom with a queen size aspen log bed, and a loft bedroom with: a queen size bed, a queen size sofa sleeper, and an Arachnid dartboard console. There are two baths, one on the main level and one in the loft. All 3 TV's are supplied with Direct TV.As you arrive at the cabin, the first thing you will notice is its' expansive view of Cove Mountain. It still takes my breath away every time I walk out onto the deck! When you enter the cabin, you will be immediately greeted by the cathedral ceiling and 11 front windows that tower 2 stories in the Great Room. The windows provide an impressive and constant view of Cove Mountain and Wears Valley. When you seek a break from all of your Smoky Mountain adventures, you can sink into our new sofas (3/15/21) as you watch DIrect TV or a movie on our DVD player all while warming your toes in front of the toasty gas fireplace (available Oct-Mar). Our dining area has seating for four, and we have a fully equipped kitchen where you can prepare a home cooked meal. The rest of the main level has a bedroom and a bath. The bedroom has an aspen log queen bed, armoire and dresser. You can enjoy your favorite TV show from under the fluffy comforter as you settle in for the night. The main level bath has a full size washer and dryer, a shower with sliding glass doors, a pedestal sink and toilet. The stairs in the Great Room will lead you up to a spacious loft. A cabin isn't complete without a rustic chandelier and ours provides ambient lighting for the new sofa sleeper in the sitting area. Tucked away in the back corner is a queen size bed with another TV. The Loft also doubles as a game room. We have an Arachnid dartboard console along with storage cubes that are filled with crayons, coloring books, cards, DVD's and board games. The loft bathroom has a relaxing jetted tub where you can soak your cares away.Outside you will find ample parking in our driveway. Our new, 2 tier composite deck was just replaced in March 2021. Both decks offer beautiful views of Cove Mountain and the morning sunrise. The top deck, leads you around to our covered, outdoor, dining area and gas grill. There's nothing like flipping burgers out in the beauty of nature; it seems like less of a chore. The bottom deck offers a suspended porch swing, and will take you to the area of our enclosed hot tub. A perfect place for a relaxing soak! LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! Southern Drawl Cabin is located in the "quiet side of the Smokys" in Wears Valley. While we are away from the hustle and bustle of downtown; Cades Cove, Metcalf Bottoms, The Sinks, Meigs Falls, Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg, Townsend, Dollywood and the Great Smoky National Park are within a 5-25 minute scenic drive away.WE DO NOT ALLOW PETSI am frequently asked, "What is the drive up to the cabin like?" Once you turn off of 321, it's about a 3 mile drive. The first 2 miles are relatively flat; with a gradual incline. The last mile has more of an incline and 3 steep but short inclines; at this point you know you are going up. The road itself is 1-1/2 to 2 lanes wide, paved and in excellent shape compared to many others that I've been on. 4 wheel drive is not necessary to get up the mountain (in normal driving conditions); it is a scenic, woodsy drive. The majority of people who live on the mountain are very courteous and will stop and pull off in a driveway to make the side by side passing of 2 larger vehicles easier. If you've never had the experience of driving up a mountain, the first time up you may feel a bit intimidated but like anything else, once you've done it and know where you are going and what to expect...it's a breeze and the view from the cabin will be worth it. My daughter now laughs at herself and how scared she was the first time she drove up alone. Common sense and normal driving skills will get you to the cabin. I have yet to have received any complaints from Guests saying that the drive up was too much for them and they had to make other accommodation plans.***WINTER SEASON GUESTS, just some things to consider. Winter is a beautiful time to come to the Smokys, but when it comes to the weather, it can also be unpredictable.  If there is snow in the forecast, you might want to have a few local hotels on speed dial, and you will have to be willing to adapt to possible changes in your plans. Snow & ice can make the road to the cabin dangerous and impassable; snow plows do not service mountain roads. Your safety is our #1 concern. If you can't get up the mountain to the cabin, please try to find alternate accommodations in town, and we will refund your nights' stay price accordingly. If you are "stuck" up at the cabin, stay put until it's safe to drive down, even if it's your day to check out. We will always work with our Guests during weather related issues and adjust pricing or issue refunds if snow or ice keep you from staying with us. If you are up at the cabin and snow is in the future forecast, think about having a decent supply of food on hand, just in case. Local restaurants will not deliver you food during a snow storm.Guest accessEverythingOther things to noteTennessee charges 12.75% in renters tax. It will be added onto our Guests total fees.
additional_house_rules:
- Check in is after 4:00 pm
- Check out is before 10:00 am
- Must be 21 and older to rent
- Children are welcome to stay, however the cabin is not childproof. As the guardian, it is your responsibility to provide a safe area.
- No fireworks of any type are allowed
- Shoes are to be removed upon entry
- If snowy weather causes the guest to be unable to reach the cabin, I will refund that nights stay, but I will not also pay for your hotel room.
- Kitchen should be left the way it was found. No food in the refrigerator, dishes cleaned and put away
- Fireplace is available October 1 - April 1. It is unvented gas...DO NOT open the flue.
interaction: All renting is done directly with me, the homeowner. I am almost always available and can be reached via this website, business email, facebook page or phone.
transit: A car is needed

description: Retreat Back to Nature with this stunning Gatlinburg cabin. The peaceful natural setting can be viewed from the many windows of the spacious vaulted great room.  The pine walls give this cabin a light and airy feel that welcomes you immediately.  The great room’s gas fireplace will keep you cozy at night.  The warm interior décor was thoughtfully selected for a “beary” rustic yet comfortable feel.  Each bedroom is appointed with your comfort in mind and includes a 43” 4K Smart TV, an extra mirror and an adjoining spacious bathroom with a walk-in shower.  On the deck, soak in the hot tub, stay warm by the outdoor gas fireplace, watch the sunset or appreciate the winter mountain view from the rockers. Make sure you show off your skills at playing a game of pool in the loft. The winner can decide the next day’s activities.  With so many activities to choose from, your most difficult decision will be which one?  How about a scenic drive around Cades Cove or the nearby Roaring Forks Motor Nature Trail?  No matter the season, take the ski lift or drive up to Ober Gatlinburg Ski Area & Amusement Park or reach new heights at Anakeesta Theme Park.  Great Smoky Mountains National Park has over 900 miles of hiking trails, try at least one of them.  Laurel Falls and Rainbow Falls are two popular trails that have breathtaking views.  Visit downtown Gatlinburg and the attractions in Pigeon Forge. From Dollywood to music revues, there are lots of things to do.  Want to stay in and relax?  Back to Nature is the perfect place for that too.  Sit back and enjoy the state-of-the-art electronics in the great room: 55” 4K Smart TV, Alexa for on-demand music, weather and sports, stream with 100GB high-speed internet or watch movies using the DVD/Blu-Ray player.  With the grocery store nearby, it is easy to bring the groceries in, cook a meal and enjoy it in the dining room.  The spacious well-equipped kitchen has lots of counter space and additional seating at the counter.  We provide small kitchen appliances, cooking utensils, dishes, and flatware.  There's both a full-size washer and dryer for your convenience.  If you are planning for a larger group or a family gathering, consider renting the adjacent cabin, Lasting Impressions, along with Back to Nature!  There is a shared driveway with ample parking.  So, what are you waiting for?  For a truly restful getaway, book Back to Nature now and begin your Smoky Mountain vacation experience.  Back to Nature is pet-friendly.  So, bring your pet with you too.  Whether you stay in or venture out, create some great memories at Back to Nature!  New construction completed in 2019.Other things to noteRetreat Back to Nature with this stunning Gatlinburg cabin. description: Located at 3,000ft Gatlinburg Summit has unrivaled smoky mountain views. Our newly remodeled modern 2 bedroom condo includes a private balcony with mountain views, a real wood burning fireplace, new furnishings, newly remodeled kitchen w/ granite countertops, Expanded Cable, private High-Speed WiFi, & Free Netflix. New memory foam King & Queen Beds, and new couch with memory foam queen sleeper. On site outdoor & indoor pool, two hot tubs, clubhouse, playground, and picnic/grill area.The spaceNewly Remodeled Kitchen:Newly remodeled with new granite countertop custom stone backsplash and appliances. Full-size refrigerator/freezer, K-Cup Coffee Maker and regular coffee maker, stove/oven, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, plates, cups, pots, pans, and all basic cookware. NEW-Added a 4qt CrockPot and Brita filtered water pitcher. Living Room:Real wood burning fireplace. Couch with fold out queen sleeper with memory foam mattress. 55" Smart TV with Blu Ray Player. Corner shaped dining table perfect to enjoy dinner or games. Chairs on the balcony to enjoy the views while drinking a glass of wine or your favorite drink. Off the 2nd balcony many guests are lucky enough to see bears daily wandering the property. Bathroom 1:Private bathroom connected to King Master Bedroom. New vanity with granite countertop, and shower/tub. Towels, hand towels, wash cloths, as well as a basic starter set of Shampoo, Conditioner, Lotion, and soap supplied. Bathroom 2:Shared bathroom off main hall and by Bedroom 2, this bath features a custom tiled waterfall style shower, new floors, and vanity. Towels, hand towels, wash cloths, as well as a basic starter set of Shampoo, Conditioner, Lotion, and soap supplied. Bedroom 1: (King Master Bedroom)The King Master Bedroom has a new KING size Memory Foam mattress, 40" Smart TV with Free Netflix, nightstand, lamp, closet dresser, and makeup mirror/table. A hatch sound machine is provided for quality sleep. Bedroom 2:Queen sized bedroom with new memory foam mattress, nightstands, lamps, 40" Smart TV with Free Netflix, and closet. A hatch sound machine is provided for quality sleep. Location:Gatlinburg Summit is located in a wonderful area that is a very quiet and peaceful setting. While it is atop the mountain in order to have the great views, it is still close to all the action. You are just around the corner from Ober Gatlinburg. You can skip all the Gatlinburg traffic by taking the bypass and arrive quickly and stress free. Downtown Gatlinburg is quickly accessible by 4 different locations to give you plenty of options including Ski Mountain Rd (Light #10), Sugarlands Welcome Center in the National Park(via bypass), Light #3 at Ripley's Aquarium (via Campbell Lead Rd) and the entrance of Gatlinburg(via the bypass). All of these options are just a short 10-15 minute trip. In addition, Pigeon Forge is right down the road via the bypass in about 15-20 minutes. Don't feel like driving much? Take a very short drive to Ober Gatlinburg (less than 2 miles) and ride the scenic Aerial Tram into downtown Gatlinburg. The trams run every 20 minutes so you can return whenever you please.Guest accessGuests have full access to all facilities at Gatlinburg Summit including: Outdoor Pool, Indoor Pool, 2 indoor hot tubs, clubhouse, coin operated laundry room, picnic/grill area, basketball goal.Other things to noteWhile I don't have "Instant-Booking" turned on, I always respond very quickly. If you see in gaps in my calendar for 1 or 2 night stays that don't meet the 3 night minimum feel free to send me an inquiry. I generally will allow these as they form in the calendar. Wild bears do wander onto the property often. Please do NOT feed the bears or attempt to interact with them for your own safety.

description: The Art Loft is a historic property that was owned and built by the famous local artist Dale Gillespi. Situated less than a quarter mile off of the spur in the heart of the Smokies you will not find a more unique overnight experience in Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg.The spaceOriginally the Art Loft was a studio for Sevier County's most famous artist Dale Gillespi. Dale used the art loft to create works for many local businesses as well as the Eagle Memorial to our country's veteran's located in the square in downtown Sevierville. The loft has been completely renovated to allow for overnight rentals keeping with the historic tradition that Dale inspired. One bedroom with cathedral ceilings, one bathroom with cathedral ceilings and jacuzzi tub, one sitting room with a 50" flat screen tv and a Keurig, microwave and fridge.Guest accessThe guest has private access to the loft and shared access to the grounds on the lower level portions of the property and private access to the upper level courtyard and hot tub area. The driveway is shared with Carver's House guests.Other things to note*Note that this is a unique property situated in the Smoky Mountains with lots of tree cover...Some guests may experience power outages and weak wifi signals and or tv disruptions during weather events.
additional_house_rules:
• No smoking
• No pets
• No parties or events
• Check-in is anytime after 3:00 PM
interaction: Guests access the loft by door-code and we are available 24/7 if the need arises.
transit: The Art Loft is only 5 minutes to Downtown Gatlinburg and 5 minutes to Pigeon Forge. You will need a car to get around the Smokies for the most part, but if you so choose the Great Smoky Mountain Welcome Center and trolley stop is just under a mile away.FYI, the trolley rates have gone up to a whopping $2.50 a ride for Dollywood/Splash Country and a $1.00 anywhere else or you can buy a day pass $3.00.

description: Our Chalet is the perfect place for a romantic getaway and offers beautiful Smoky Mountain views! The spaceOur Chalet offers beautiful mountain views and and is located just minutes from Downtown Gatlinburg, Ober Gatlinburg Resort, and the National Park. The entire Chalet is yours during your stay. Custom designed and built, one level, comfortable and convenient, our Chalet has a King-size bed, jacuzzi, hot tub, fireplace, kitchen, wi-fi, 2 HD flat-screen TVs (with Roku streaming, we provide Netflix).The architecture, decor and layout is spacious, private and comfortable and convenient. Especially designed for couples to relax and renew. Magnificent mountain views! Close to Downtown Gatlinburg, The Great Smoky Mountains National Park, and Ober Gatlinburg Resort!We are located in the lovely neighborhood of Chalet Village with other cabins nearby.Guest accessGuests are provided with key-box access code prior to arrival. We do not use cleaning crews that go to multiple properties. The fact that ours is a one-bedroom Chalet with only 2 adult guests per stay and stringent cleaning between guests will help to bring you a sense of comfort.

interaction: We are local owners and will be happy to answer any questions that you may have. We will be happy to provide as much or as little interaction as you require.

description: Tucked away and private, yet close to local attractions that include the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, this wood cabin retreat can accommodate up to 4 guests with 1 bedroom, 2 beds, and one bathroom. Inspired by the surrounding landscape, Moonshine Romance Cabin was designed to make your visit a unique, comfortable and fun experience. Plenty of privacy and surrounding woods here. The neighborhood streets are well paved so walking the area is easy to do. Steep Drive: 4x4 is a must in snowThe spaceThe cabin provides an idyllic and private setting with pine walls and floors, cathedral ceilings and A-Frame windows with wooded views. The cabin's main floor offers a gas log fireplace, Roku TV, wifi & cable, living area, full kitchen with new appliances, and a master suite that includes a king bed and a jacuzzi tub.  Just outside the master suite, enjoy a full deck with wooded views while sitting in rocking chairs or enjoying the pre-heated hot tub. Clear night skies from the back deck give gorgeous views of the stars.The upstairs loft offers HD TV, pool table, pub table, card games, and board games. It's a great place to have a beer or glass of wine and have a bit of fun.* HD TV's * Cable/wifi* Gas log fireplace* Full kitchen & outdoor charcoal grill* Master suite with king size pine bed  * Jacuzzi tub in master bedroom* Washer/dryer* Pool table, pub table* Hot tub, rocking chairs, porch swing* Pull out sofa bedOther things to noteWww.moonshineromancecabin.com
additional_house_rules:
The minimum age to rent is 21 per the local HOA regulations.

Required Upon Check-Out: 
-Place any used dishes & silverware into the dishwasher and run it prior to departure. This is required to reduce the spread of Covid-19 for both staff and future guests.
-Remove all trash from the cabin,  securely close the garbage bags, place in the bear-resistant bin outside and ensure it latches closed. Please remove any grocery items you brought into the cabin. We can't forward them to future guests and you'll want them for your road trip!
-Please close and lock all windows and doors upon leaving the property
-Linens and towels can be left in a pile. There's no need to launder them.

The hot tub is available at your own risk. Please supervise children for a fun & safe experience. 

Keep all car doors locked and don't store food in any vehicles. The local bears and raccoons are wily and hungry. Please don't feed ANY of them and keep a safe distance if you're lucky enough to spot them.

-If you see anything amiss during your stay, please do not hesitate to contact us. We want your stay to be the best experience possible!
interaction: One of us is always available via messaging and additional contacts will be provided during your stay.
transit: Car. Steep driveway.If there's snow, you'll need four wheel drive and probably chains. Traction spikes for shoes are a good idea when cold/icy.

description: Incredible views from this renovated "lodgestyle" loft condo.  Approximately 12 min to Gatlinburg and the park. Enjoy days hiking and curl up in the evenings next to the wood burning fireplace. Perfect for couples or small families This one of a kind loft features queen bed up spiral stairs in loft, bunk beds off den and sofa bed in den. Complex has Indoor & outdoor pools and hot tubs,  playground, laundromat, outdoor grills. Internet. The Summit. Note condo is up 3 flights of stairs.The spaceBeddingComfortable Queen bed in rustic loft, privacy sheers, small closet, shelving storage, fan. Bunk beds in den for teens and children.  Note: upper bunk is restricted to children 8 years of age and older.New (June 2019) Full size sofa bed in den. KitchenFully stocked kitchen with compact oven, microwave, dishwasher, coffee pot, toaster, full size refrigerator, crock pot, pots, pans, dishes and all supplies to cook dinner.BathroomNewly renovated (May 2019) bathroom with custom tile rustic wood look shower, new vanity, toilet and fixtures. DenCompletely remodeled in May 2019 with stone fireplace, all new furnishings, rug, smart t.v.  Private wifi for unit. Unit features paintings, photograpy, pottery and custom crafted mantel from local area artists and craftsmen.Complex has indoor and outdoor pools, hot tub, playground,  outdoor grill, picnic table, laundromat.Housekeeping:Bath, hand towels, washcloths are provided for each registered guest.  A starter set of shampoo, conditioner and soap is provided.  Toilet tissue and paper towels are provided. Kitchen towel,  washcloth, dish soap and dishwasher soap is provided. For stays longer than 7 nights a complimentary midweek clean up can be arranged. Please contact me before your stay to schedule.NOTE: pool towels are not provided. Please bring your own.Firewood is available for sale in the office from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Change is provided in the office for washers and dryers along with detergent available for purchase.Before checking out, all you need to do is wipe up spills on kitchen counters,  load and run the dishwasher and empty garbage and take to dumpsters. Leave dirty towels on bathroom floor and dirty linens on bed. Housekeeping will take care of everything else.
additional_house_rules:
Check out time is 11 A.M.
No pets allowed on property.  The complex imposes a $100 fine. 
Complex quiet hours are 6 p.m. to 9 a.m.
Due to safety, the upper bunk is restricted to children over 7 years and persons weighing less than 186lbs.
This unit is nonsmoking.  There are smoking areas on the complex property.
Please read the bear advisory on the refrigerator and lock all complex garbage dumpsters after use.
interaction: You will be given the access code to access the unit 1 days before arrival. If you do not receive the access code or directions please message me or text me 404 579 7593. There is no onsite rental management company or check in procedure. I am available by phone and have a team in Gatlinburg to assist you with any housekeeping needs or maintenance issues.  Onsite office is available for immediate emergencies during office hours.  An immediate emergency is an issue such as plumbing leak, getting locked out of unit.If there is anything you need that was not provided or have any concerns with my unit after arrival, please text me 404 579 7593. My goal is to provide you with a 5 star experience.
transit: You will need a car to get to the Gatlinburg (less than 15 minutes). Once in Gatlinburg there is a trolley system for a small fee that will take you around the sights of Gatlinburg and over to Pigeon Forge and the Arts and Crafts Community.

Snuggle up on leather furnishings by the gas-log fireplace in the living room while you watch a movie on the flat screen television. Enjoy a candle-lit dinner for two in your kitchen or dine outside on the deck surrounded by the sights and sounds of nature. Upstairs in the loft is where the pool table is located for your enjoyment.  NO PETS AND NO SMOKING!  ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING ON ANY OF THE PROPERTY!!  NAUGHTY PINES IS A COUPLES ONLY CABIN NO CHILDREN! SLEEPS 2 ONLY!The spaceEnjoy a fun-filled stay with someone special when you book "Naughty Pines" in Sky Harbor Resort! For more privacy, your rental's king bedroom even features an in-room jacuzzi tub that's perfect for relaxing with your sweetheart. For a bit of playful fun, why not challenge your partner to a game of billiards in the upstairs game room?After a great night's rest in the master bedroom with a log frame king bed, a flat-screen television, and a jacuzzi tub, you can enjoy a quick breakfast made from your rental's kitchen and while you make plans for your first day in the Smokies! description: Dove’s Nest is a charming 1 bedroom 600 square foot log cabin tucked on a secluded ridge and enveloped by a tranquil hardwood forest. Enjoy the peaceful scenery from the comfort of your private deck, outfitted with a rejuvenating hot tub or enjoy your morning coffee from the front porch swing. You’ll also find a barbecue grill & a picnic table beside the home. This cabin like most Smoky Mountain cabins has satellite internet which may or may not work and when it does work it could be very slow.The spaceDove’s Nest is a charming 1 bedroom 600 square foot log cabin tucked on a secluded ridge and enveloped by a tranquil hardwood forest. Enjoy the peaceful scenery from the comfort of your private deck, outfitted with a rejuvenating hot tub. You’ll also find a barbecue grill & a picnic table beside the home.The stylish interior reflects the surrounding natural beauty, complete with hand-rubbed log walls, hardwood floors in the kitchen, antique furniture, and unique artwork by local wildlife artist, Grace Dyer.In the heart of the Gatlinburg Arts and Crafts Community, this rental combines a quiet locale with easy access to local attractions. Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, and the Great Smoky Mountains National Park are within easy reach.If traveling with a larger group, the adjacent cabin can also be rented to accommodate parties of up to 9.LIVING AREAThe open living area is furnished with a leather sofa that converts to a queen-size sleeper. Get cozy by the gas fireplace with stone surround and watch a movie on the 42” TV -- complete with a DVD player and a stereo system.KITCHEN & DININGWhip up tasty meals in the modern kitchen, equipped with a full suite of stainless steel appliances. Thoughtful touches include a blender, toaster, and a Keurig with provided coffee and cream.A two-person dining table creates a cozy spot to enjoy meals.BEDROOM and BATHBetween the sleeper sofa and a well-appointed bedroom, this home sleeps up to four guests.Echoing the Zen vibe of the cabin, a large stained-glass panel (known as “A Dove in Flight”) hangs above the entrance to the bedroom. Inside, a king bed promises a restful slumber, while a jetted tub ensures ultimate relaxation. The en-suite bathroom is configured with a walk-in shower.OUTDOOR AREASFire up the charcoal grill and host a cookout at the picnic table.Or make your way to the covered deck and take an indulgent soak in the private hot tub. This deck also has two rocking chairs. Kick back and enjoy the scenic views of the Smoky Mountains.A lower level deck also offers additional outdoor space.EXTRA AMENITIES & MORE DETAILSExtras include complimentary Wi-Fi, cable TV, a washer/dryer, and parking for up to two cars in the driveway.Other things to noteThe road to this cabin is a single lane road. When two vehicles are approaching at once, one must move over to the side so the other can pass. This is very typical for mountain roads in the Great Smoky Mountains. This cabin like most Smoky Mountain cabins has satellite internet which may or may not work and can be very slow.

description: Welcome to Blue Sky Summit, you have peace & privacy in the woods. Enjoy the fresh mountain air from perfectly located between Gatlinburg & Pigeon Forge, providing easy direct access to anywhere📍 Don't forget to click the ❤️ in the upper right hand corner so you can easily refer back to this listing while you search for the perfect stay. ✨HIGHLIGHTS✨ - Brand New Theather Room - Brand New Pool Table - Hot Tub - Weber grill - Full coffee bar - 3 bed and 2 FULL bath - SmartTV from all TVs - 2 decks (back) - Wifi - Laundry - 15 mins from main Pigeon Forge Pkwy   ✨SLEEPING ARRANGEMENT✨ 🛏 Loft Bedroom 1: King bed + full bathroom attached (sleeps 2) 🛏 Main Bedroom 2: King bed + full bathroom attached (sleeps 2) 🛏 Theater Room: Queen pull out 4" foam mattress sofa bed (sleeps 2) ✨AMENITIES✨ ▻ 65" TV with theater seats ▻ Popcorn machine when watching a movie ▻ Relax in the hot tub with a view ▻ Free Netflix on every Roku smart tv ▻ Start-up supplies including: paper towels, dish soap, dishwasher pods, kitchen trash can liners, toilet paper, hand soap, laundry pods and bathroom trash liners. If any problems arise, we will do our best to take action as soon as possible, but there is no one living on-site 24/7.

description: Smoky Mountain views! Newly built luxury cabin retreat. Private cabin with great views of the mountains located in Gatlinburg. Get away and relax with with great views from the massive windows or the deck, hot tub, pool table, pac man arcade game, full kitchen, fireplace, flat screen tv's, wifi & much more await you. Amazing views of Mt. Leconte and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Very private yet convenient to Downtown Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge and Dollywood.The spaceThe cozy cub cabin has three levels. The bottom level has a twin over full size mattress bunkbead with a bathroom, tv and  Pacman with Galaga arcade game. The second and mail level has the master bedroom with a king bed & a tv, elegant master bath. The den with a tv and kitchen. There is anothe bathroom off of the den area. The top level has a bedroom with a queen bed & tv and an attached bathroom. There is also a bar with a pool table on the top level. We have a hot tub with great views. The cabin will come stocked with a starter pack of amenities. This is a 2 day supply of paper towels, bathroom tissue, ect. We do not provide bath soap or shampo. We have a park style grill and you will need to supply charcoal if you want to grill. Instacart delivers to our cabin if you want more supplies and groceries delivered to your door.Guest accessGuests can access all of the property except the owners closet and mechanical spaceOther things to noteThe cabin is in the mountains and the drive up is steep and the driveway is steep. Stairs are necessary to access the main and top levels. Four wheel drive or chains are required in winter if snow or ice is present. description: WELCOME to Cherokee Sunset VERY PRIVATE 1/1 KING Studio cabin on TOP of the mountain in Wears Valley! Breathtaking VIEW. Just off the 321 Wear Valley Road. Our cabin is more than just PRIVATE there are no neighbors within view. Exciting 4x4 drive up. 4x4 is not required but the road is steep in spots. SPECTACULAR views from the wrap around deck! Big hot tub, The cabin offers guests a whirlpool tub as well as a separate shower, gas fireplace, washer & dryer, gas grill, WIFI,  Direct TV!The spaceWhen you arrive you will be greeted by the amazing view. The stairs lead up to the front door.  GPS directions bring most of the way BUT BE sure to follow signs because the road splits and you MUST go hard left up the mountain!  Be sure to follow the exact signs for the address. WE do have basic amenities but you will need to bring everything you require to have an amazing Mountain Cabin experience with you. NEW MODERN WASHER AND DRYER Strong WiFi Most days but when weather is bad no guarantee! Propane fireplace (pilot light should stay lit and not be blown out)Propane grill (each guest who uses it is required to clean it after use) Opportunity to enjoy a breathtaking QUIET view off the deck with a hot cup of coffee or tea! Peaceful. Not Modern but rustic cabin with King Bed in studio space with Bear Couch and chair with large big screen TV with Sports Package!  Full Kitchen with oven, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker! We do have Large Hot Tub that looks out over the Valley with complete privacy! (Well water that is high in iron so at certain times of the year there is a rust colored ring around everything from toilet to shower to hot tub!) WE do have it regularly scheduled to be scale bleached but Be aware! CABIN IS CLEANJust 10 Minutes to the Wears Valley entrance to the GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS NATIONAL Park. GSMNP. Other attractions up here in the Mountains are BEARS, BEES AND VARIOUS BUGSWELCOME TO THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS.  In addition to being the vacation capital of the United States. We are also home to the most varieties of bugs and pests.  Please see below a few of the most common ones.  Mosquitos are everywhere it is RECOMMEND to spray yourself every outing with repellent.  LADYBUG SEASON - Certain months out of the year ladybugs hatch in the thousands. They do not harm you and just don’t know what they are doing. They swarm around windows, doors, decks, and fly everywhere. They mate then die and you will overnight find bundles of them. Treatment is just to sweep them outside and off the decks. STINK BUG SEASON - Certain months out of the year ladybugs hatch in the thousands. They do not harm you and just don’t know what they are doing. They swarm around windows, doors, decks, and fly everywhere. They mate then die and you will overnight find bundles of them. Treatment is just to sweep them outside and off the decks. CARPENTER BEE SEASON - All summer long carpenter bees burrow into the wood all around decks, cabins, the endless trees around the area. They are harmless and buzz around not to harm you but to find the best place to have babies and leave their larvae. You may see at times huge piles of sawdust and that is evidence that the bees are burrowing. IF you see large gashes out of the side of a cabin that is from the woodpeckers who feed on the larvae and will tear up whole cabins to find all the bees. We do have the cabins treated to kill the bees and larvae to try and prevent the woodpeckers from damage. SCORPIONS - Small insects that are nocturnal hunters. They live off creepy crawlers so like spiders are our friends. Most TN residents have never seen a TN scorpion. They are drawn to wet locations like bathrooms or come out more when it has been raining. You do not want to be stung by an insect scorpion. It will hurt. Wear some type of whole while walking around inside the cabins especially at night. IF your not scared yet Remember their are RATTLESNAKES AND BEARS! Please see Cabin Manual for BEAR precautions Do's and Don'ts!Guest accessThe cabin is 100% accessible.DO NOT BOOK if you are 1. afraid of heights 2. afraid of being in the MTNs. 3. afraid of steep roads. 4. Looking for posh accommodations. Ready for the adventure! Please BOOK.Other things to noteThe adventure starts after you exit off the 321. Once you exit off and go toward the mtn remember to take in all the beautiful country. You will start the climb up the side of the mtn and be sure to follow the exact signs to Raven's Den. There are a quite few twists and turns. This cabin is accessible via a regular car as I have done it and my cleaners do it all the time. BUT I recommend  and guests may feel more comfortable with a 4x4 for your getaway. Driveway is new blacktop.ATTRACTIONS:10 miles to Pigeon Forge Parkway light #3. Where going either left or right gains access to dining & attractions.15 miles DOLLYWOOD18 miles to Gatlinburg.8 miles Alpine Slide & Goats on Roof 5 Miles to Townsend & RAFTING, AND HORSEBACK RIDING!!Just Minutes to waterfalls and trailheads. Secret BACK Entrance to Great Smoky Mtn National Park. Search Wears Valley.
additional_house_rules:
Guests are required to clean up after themselves.
No trash laying around!
If you bring a pet- Poop goes in trash. 
Wash dishes before leaving and empty dishwasher. Wet soiled towels go in bathroom. 

Guests are required to leave property in the same or better condition when leaving as when they arrived. 

Cleaning fee is to help cover expenses for Laundering sheets, preparing beds and sanitizing spaces.

We are a PET FRIENDLY cabin. YOU are responsible to clean all pet hair, poop, debris or smell. If you pet messes up the rug please replace it or help me purchase a new one. Please pick up POOP BOMBS from the FRONT PARKING area. There is an awesome hiking gravel road that circles around so plenty of exercise places. 

MY FAMILY lives locally and we visit our cabin often! We survive off our income from the cabins and we take very good care along with our cleaners. Please help us help you enjoy your stay! 
Thanks.
interaction: I am available via cell phone 24/7
transit: Zero Public transportation and Not accessible during freezing weather.Book with knowledge that if the weather turns dangerous or freezing.  Just message me.

description: Bearly Hangin' On is an open concept cabin nestled in the Smoky Mountains, yet centrally located only 20 minutes from BOTH Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg.  Only minutes from the main parkway, but secluded and quiet.‣ Flat parking area next to front door makes unloading a breeze.‣ The amazing wall of windows makes it feel like you’re sleeping outside!‣ Over 1300 ft²‣ Deck with hot tub, Jacuzzi tub, Game Room with ping pong!‣ Click the ♥ in the upper right hand corner to save Bearly Hangin' On!The space‣ Master Suite      ‣ Upstairs      ‣ Soak in the Jacuzzi Tub      ‣ Relish the Wall of Windows      ‣ Enjoy the private screened in balcony      ‣ Snuggle into the King bed with premium mattress      ‣ Master Bathroom attached      ‣ Flat screen Smart TV      ‣Twin Log Bunk Beds‣ Downstairs Bedroom      ‣ Queen Size bed      ‣ Flat screen Smart  TV‣ Game Room      ‣ New (2020) Ping-Pong Table!      ‣ Bluetooth Speakers      ‣ Dartboard      ‣ Some board games / booksGuest accessEntire cabin plus amenities (inlcuding washer and dryer) are included in the rental.  Please, make yourself at home!Other things to notePlease remember that you are staying in our personal cabin, not a hotel.  Please treat our treasured vacation spot with respect.During the winter months snow is likely and can make it difficult to travel on the mountain roads. Roads are plowed to allow for travel but due to unforeseen conditions, roads could be snowed in. Please plan accordingly.
additional_house_rules:
* At least 1 person making the reservation and staying in the cabin must be at least 25 years old at the time of the reservation.  

* No smoking inside, but you are welcome to smoke outside.  Smoking pots are provided outside.

* The roads leading to the cabin are paved, but are curvy and steep.  By making a reservation, you are acknowledging this and will be prepared.

-No Pets, No Exceptions.  If you sneak in a pet, you will be asked to leave without a refund and will be charged an extra $250 cleaning fee.

 Inclement Weather:
Owners can assume no responsibility for inclement weather.  No refund will be given in the event of a late arrival or early departure due to weather conditions.  We highly recommend four-wheel drive and/or chains during the snowy months.  We do not refund due to road conditions.

* Guest specifically accepts ALL liability for use of bunk beds and hot tub on the property and understands that the owner shall have no liability from any accidents, injuries, or death that may result from the proper or improper use of said bunk beds or hot tub.  Guest accepts said liability by voluntary use of said bunk beds and hot tub.  

* Absolutely no body oils, shampoos, body wash or soaps allowed inside the hot tub or indoor jetted bathtub.  In the event this occurs, an additional fee for extra cleaning will be charged.   

*Fireplace is turned off from April 30 to October 1 and is not available during that time.

-Renters are responsible for any damage to the cabin including and not limited to bedding, towels, furniture, hot tub, and appliances.

-Checkout time is 10:00am.  Failure to checkout on time may result in additional charges.

Shamefully copied this from another listing, sorry, but it's great:

If you open it, close it.  If you borrow it, return it.  If you turn it on, turn it off.  if you break it, fix it (or let us know). If you use it, take care of it.  If you make a mess, clean it up.  If you move it, put it back.

Above all, please enjoy your stay at 'Bearly Hangin' On'.
interaction: I strive to give you a 5 ★★★★★ experience.  I will be available for you during  your stay, but our level of interaction is up to you.  I am available via message, phone call, email, or text at all times.  Self check in is available upon arrival.
transit: Hey, you read this far down!  If you are leaning away from booking our cabin, it would be helpful if you dropped me a note and just let me know if there are any changes that would make our cabin more competitive, or if there is an amenity we could add to help future guests.  Thank you!If you are staying in our cabin, it is very likely you have your own transportation, which is the best way to get around the Smoky Mountains, Pigeon Forge, and Gatlinburg.

This cozy cabin has all new SS Kitchen appliances, new bedding, linens & decor throughout. Amenities include the most PRIVATE hot tub in whole community, jetted jacuzzi tub, flat screen TV's, pool table, fully stocked kitchen, two fireplaces (non-heat emitting for safety!). Resort has a pool, fitness center, wedding/conference center available to guests.The spaceEntire 1 level cabin with only 6 steps into the cabin & then no stairs inside at all inside. 1 bedroom with king bed and a queen size sleeper sofa, two fireplaces and TV's, pool table, cards & games, a hot tub and jacuzzi tub. A fully stocked kitchen with brand new appliances.Guest access2 designated parking spots for the cabin, easily accessible and no steep, windy roads.Other things to noteCommunity has a beautiful pool that is available seasonably, clubhouse, chapel & fitness room.
additional_house_rules:

*No smoking inside the cabin or on the decks. 
*Please smoke out front on the pavement and properly dispose of cigarette butts. 
*Do not use fireplaces May 1st - October 1st. 
*Be respectful of others staying in the Gatlinburg Falls Resort community and keep noise to a normal level. 
*Take proper care of all homes furnishings.

description: The Great Smoky Mountains are calling you. I’d like to personally welcome you to your 400 sq. ft. REMODELED studio with inspiring views perched at 3,000 feet at the popular Summit Gatlinburg! The space boasts a private balcony with a view, granite, high speed WiFi, smart TV, full kitchen, queen bed & memory foam sofa bed. Club house amenities = 2 hot tubs, indoor/outdoor pool. We’re 3.5 miles to bustling downtown Gatlinburg and only 1.4 miles from Ober Gatlinburg and the aerial tram to dwtn!The spacePLEASE READ: This is a 400 sq. ft. studio with ONE QUEEN bed  — and a QUEEN SOFA BED. The indoor pool and hot tubs are CLOSED until further notice due to repair. The outdoor pool is OPEN! TWO ADULTS and TWO KIDS under the age of 12 are the max allowed (unless authorized by me so feel free to ask) I do not allow 4 adults due to size.You will be driving up the mountain 3.5 miles to get to the unit. The road is curvy. All cars can easily drive up and down. You do not need an SUV. Details about space: There's a small closet in the kitchen for luggage and clothes and 3 large drawers under the bed for additional storage. Your full bathroom consists of a standard tub shower with a new vanity, toilet and towels. EASY Checkin with keyless door pad upon arrival. Free parking with plenty of spots available year round. Check out some details!Kitchen: - New granite countertops- Coffee maker (filters provided, coffee & instant coffee provided)- Stove/Oven, Fridge, Dishwasher, Toaster- Pots, pans, dishes, glasses, wine opener, can opener, utensils - Blender - Starter dish soap, 1 paper towel roll and 2 trash bags provided- Standard condiments included; salt/pepper, sugar, powdered cream) Living Room:- Wood burning fireplace (firewood sold in office during winter months - ends March 1) - 50 inch smart TV - New sofa sleeper with fold out queen memory foam mattressBed: - QUEEN memory foam bed with mattress pad & gel cooling pillowsFull Bathroom: - Standing shower tub- New vanity, toilet & fixtures- Hand towels, wash cloths, bath towels, etc- Starter set of soap. 2 toilet paper rolls also provided.- Hair Dryer provided.Other things to noteThis is a condo complex and much like a hotel there’s a possibility for noise. Trip insurance is always advisable should you be worried about any thing impeding your travel. Bears during the spring, summer and fall months are common to see. Please never feed them and keep a safe distance. Firewood and kindling is sold in main office 9-5pm daily. Cash only. Enjoy!
interaction: I’m available and respond quickly to all questions. Always message me if needed. Thanks.
transit: Downtown Gatlinburg is 3.5 miles down the mountain. Ober Gatlinburg is 1.5 miles away and offers an aerial tram to downtown. Trollies do not come up the mountain.

description: Escape to Mountain Splendor, a cozy cabin for two tucked away in the Great Smoky Mountains. This authentic log home is crafted of hand-hewn pine logs and gleams inside with the beauty of wood floors, a stone fireplace, and large windows that bring nature’s beauty indoors for your enjoyment.    You’ll feel like you can see forever from the Mountain Splendor deck. The truth is, from the cabin you can see almost the full Tennessee side of the Smoky Mountains. The cabin is a wonderful getaway for two, but if friends want to join you, the Kear’s Mountain Magic home is close by and available to rent.    When you walk in the Mountain Splendor front door, you can’t help but smile. Vaulted ceiling and a welcoming open floor plan encourage you to come in and make yourself at home. Start up a fire in the stone fireplace and settle in for a relaxing retreat away from the press of the crowd.   For entertainment, you have a satellite TV with a VCR. Dual screens on the deck give you all the privacy you need. Two rocking chairs are a great place to enjoy your morning coffee as you watch the misty mountains awaken to a new day.    Even though Mountain Splendor is in a peaceful setting, you can quickly reach a world of fun activities in Gatlinburg and beyond. Museums, gondola ride, zip lines, mini-golf, go-carts, skiing, and all the pleasures of Dollywood are within reach.    You can dine out in Gatlinburg any night, or if you prefer to cook in your Mountain Splendor kitchen, you have everything you need to prepare and serve your group of two within your cabin. Make a quick trip down to the local grocery and you’ll be all set.  Close by the kitchen at the rear of the cabin is your table for two.    Another convenience you have at Mountain Splendor is a stacked washer and dryer. It’s so handy to be able to run a load of wash at any time and avoid having to locate a Laundromat and wait around for your clothes to dry.    Make the most of your romantic getaway by enjoying the heart-shaped Jacuzzi in the corner of your large, open room. It’s so much fun to sip a glass of champagne while looking out on your spectacular Smoky Mountain view.    When you’re ready to call it a day, you have a comfortable king-sized bed to slip into that has a great view of the TV, the mountains, and the fireplace. Is it any wonder that guests rave about their stay at Mountain Splendor?   Your bathroom includes a shower and good-sized vanity with a large mirror. Hop in the shower and before you know it, you’ll be ready for some eggs and bacon to start your day.  Mountain Splendor is the Great Smoky Mountains getaway you’ve been hoping to find. Take a moment today to reserve your preferred dates in this adorable, well-maintained cabin. Please Note: Mountain Splendor does not have internet.Other things to noteEscape to Mountain Splendor, a cozy cabin for two tucked away in the Great Smoky Mountains. description: Located in popular Gatlinburg Falls Resort less than 3 miles from Gatlinburg is our 1600 square foot cabin aptly named Heaven's Dew, has sleeping for 8 and all the amenities needed for a Great Smoky Mountain vacation. Well maintained with private hot tub, rocking chairs, pool table, arcade. With easy access to the Great Smoky Mountain National Park as well as all the attractions of Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge this is the perfect home base for a unforgettable vacation.The spaceAs you enter Heaven's Dew you’ll find a well stocked kitchen complete with a Keurig K-duo coffee maker so you can make enough for the whole family using traditional grounds or single serve K cups. Pots and pans, glassware, plenty of utensils are provided to make great meals with your family! As you continue you’ll pass the dining table seating six which leads to the living room with a 55” TV, couch with pull out sleeper and an electric fireplace. The master bedroom has a king bed, TV, dresser and tables with an attached master bath. Outside on the upper deck you’ll find rocking chairs and a picnic table for enjoying the wooded views.Downstairs you’ll enter into the open floor that has a pool table, multi arcade video game, 55” TV, a pullout queen sofa, twin over twin bunk bed. Also downstairs is a closet full of blankets and pillows. Near the bunks you will find an additional closet with the washer and dryer. Relax in the heart shaped jacuzzi tub downstairs after a long day exploring the Smokies! Outside on the lower deck is your private hot tub and cozy outdoor sitting area.We provide dish/laundry detergents, garbage bags, toilet paper and paper towels for getting started. After these are gone you’ll need to source more for your stay.Guest accessTwo parking spots just to the right of the front porch and access to the entire cabin.Other things to noteThis is in a resort with a seasonal community pool.
additional_house_rules:
By booking this cabin, you are agreeing to all house rules in this listing:
We take great pride in our cabin so please treat it as you would your own home. We are not a cabin management firm, or a corporation. This cabin is owned by our family. Rule #1, Have fun and enjoy!!

In the event of an emergency please dial 911

Absolutely no parties and no smoking on the property. If we become aware that there has been an irresponsibly thrown party or smoking on the premises, we will charge you an additional $500, and you will be asked to leave without a refund. We will also report this to AirBnB.

Guests must be 22+ except for children of guests. Younger guests may book at owner's discretion. Message owner if you are younger than 22 and wish to book. 

The cabin is in the mountains. There are steep roads, cliff edges and wildlife in the area. Children must be supervised at all times while on our property.

Use the hot tub at your own risk. No unsupervised children in the hot tub at any time. Do not Eat or drink in the hot tub. Do not consume alcoholic beverages in or before entering the hot tub. No soap/bubble bath, food, or glass in or around the hot tub. 

No animals allowed on the property. This is for the safety of guests who are trusting that the property will be animal-free due to potential allergic reactions. If we become aware that an animal has been brought onto the property, you will be charged an additional $200 fee, and be asked to leave with no refund for the remainder of your stay. This also will be reported to AirBnB.

The fireplace is electric but don't leave it on while unattended.  No burning of candles or incense allowed at any time. 

Charcoal BBQ grill is available for your use. We do not supply charcoal so please bring some on your way up. All BBQ utensils are provided for your convenience. Do not leave BBQ grill unattended when in use, fire shall be completely extinguished before storage.

Toilets are for toilet paper only. No flushing of feminine products or baby wipes etc. at any time. Any service charge as a result of misusing the above items will lead to additional fees to you.

Welcome to the mountains! You will likely see and hear critters/bugs such as raccoons, squirrels, bees, deer, bears and other wildlife! We ask that you respect the animals and enjoy from a distance, especially the bears. During the spring and fall seasons there can be an abundance of millipedes. It is not uncommon to see them around. Our cabin is treated every 3 months for pest but sometimes they still find their way in. 

Please follow the check-out instructions before leaving.

description: Escape to Tennessee for your next adventure!  Nestled in the Smoky Mountains between Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge, this delightful, private cabin features a secluded space to get away from it all yet is still close to everything this renowned area has to offer. Accommodating up to 4 guests with 1 bedroom, a fun sleeping loft, and 2 baths, the cabin’s beautiful design, scenic views, and proximity to popular attractions provide the perfect backdrop for creating special vacation memories.The spaceCozy, warm and inviting, this cabin is ideal for a honeymoon, romantic getaway, or small family vacation. Guests will enjoy the open layout the main floor offers with room to gather for activities and meals. The full kitchen is nicely stocked with all prep ware needed for delicious home cooking and has sight lines to the dining and living spaces for ease of entertaining.  One bedroom offers privacy for adults and kids will love sleeping in the loft that also has a TV and air hockey table. Both bathrooms are modern yet styled with rustic finishes providing guests with an authentic mountain aesthetic. There’s no question the outdoor areas are special here with additional living space found on a large deck that not only has amazing views every season of the year, but also boasts a hot tub and charcoal Park style grill.Bedroom Configuration:Main bedroom: 1 King bed with en-suite bathroomLoft: 1 sleeper sofaAmenity extras  include: •	Complimentary Wi-Fi•	Flat screen TVs•	Central A/C and heat•	Fresh linens, towels, and bath essentials for every guest•	Washer and dryer•	Level parking for 2 vehicles/motorcycles
additional_house_rules: Quiet hours from 10:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.
interaction: While we are not based at the property, we are just a quick phone call or text away. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or problems during your stay.
transit: The cabin is in the Cove Mountain Resort neighborhood, just a 2-minute drive to the main road known as the "Spur" located between Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge. **SPECIAL NOTE** Please use the "COVE MOUNTAIN ROAD" exit off the parkway to access the neighborhood; otherwise, GPS will route you through an unpaved, rough road.The Gatlinburg Welcome Center is only 1 mile south from the turn onto the Spur.  You can park at the Center for free and purchase a wristband to ride the North Parkway trolley that stops in all the popular spots in the two-city area, including the 8-mile craft community. You are also only a short 7-mile drive to the Great Smoky Mountains Park entrance.

description: Black Bear Falls Resort is conveniently located, Hugs N' Kisses is just minutes from downtown Gatlinburg. Take a hike and explore the Great Smoky Mountains, National Park. Shop ‘til you drop at the Tanger Outlets which is just a short drive away. Eat, shop and play at the Island in Pigeon Forge! The Island features unique shops, popular restaurants, as well as amusement rides.NOTE: Fireplace/s are not accessible from April 1st - October 1st. Feel free to reach out to our Guest Services Team for further clarification.The spaceHugs N Kisses is absolutely wonderful and charming little gem and from start to finish, you'll be in for a real treat.  From the first step Inside this cabin you'll want to relax and spend your time savoring every thing that you can garner from your loved one. Enjoy the lovely, comfortable cabin and spend your time rekindling the romance. Use your time washing away the worries of every day to spend it now in the company of those you adore. This cabin is equipped with a Jacuzzi tub pool table and hot tub on the deck.As you enter Hugs N' Kisses, you will immediately find peace and comfort. Relax on the couch and watch TV or shoot a game of pool in the loft area. Even better, how about relaxing and spending some quality time with your loved one in the private hot tub while you enjoy a drink. This cozy getaway that is 896 sq ft is ideal for two but large enough that it can sleep up to four with a sleeper sofa in the living room.AMENITIES:The cabin is located in Black Bear Falls Resort and sits beside a pond. description: Plan your perfect private getaway and enjoy a true Smoky Mountain sunset at Skyline Ridge, a unique modern styled A-frame cabin with a secluded view that underwent a complete renovation in 2021! Nestled high up in the Smoky Mountain region right between Pigeon Forge and downtown Gatlinburg, this charming retreat is the place to enjoy some well-earned rest and recovery after a long day out enjoying all that the Great Smoky Mountains region has to offer.  Location: 15mins to Dollywood, 15 mins to Gatlinburg. Within 10 mins of the National Park. Easy access to lots of restaurants nearby. A rental agreement and a $250 REFUNDABLE security deposit hold, via OwnerRez, is required for each stayThe spaceInternet:Fast wifi with Spectrum - 150 MBPsKitchen / amenities:Large, fully-equipped kitchen space, with brand new appliances: Keurig coffee maker, kettle, pans, pots etc. Charcoal grill and outdoor fire pit available Hot Tub:Brand New Viking Hot Tub 35 Jets !Parking: A lot of free parking space, can fit up to 6 cars. 4-wheel drive is recommended in general for smoky mountain area but not required. Step-free guest entrance Environment:Secluded !!!  Surrounded with trees and plants. There is a deer track under the house. We have 2 deers coming to visit often, and they are cute and friendly ! If you enjoy the star gazing, this is the place to stay. On a clear night, you will see a lot of stars !!!  Very peaceful and quiet, no visible neighbors around and yet close to all attractions and shopping/restaurant areaFireplace:On During Winter Months: October 1st - March 31stOff During Summer Months: April 1st - September 30thTV Entertainment:All TVs are connected to a smart device with access to streaming apps such as Netflix, Hulu, Spotify, etc (guests have to sign in using their own accounts). All bedrooms have a TV. AC:The min temperature is set to 70F as temperature below could potentially cause overload to the house's circuit breaker. Essentials:Linens, shampoo, body wash, toilet paper, face towels, bath towels, dishwasher pods, trash bag are provided. Check-in : 4:00 PMCheckout: 10:00 AMGuest accessFull access to the entire cabin. Charcoal grill and outdoor fire pit available on site.

A refundable security deposit of $200 is required at this property.
interaction: No smoking indoors. No party. Absolutely no drugs. No petsWe advise you to keep food safely in the fridge or at least covered as you will be living in the mountains and surrounded by woods and wild animals.

description: Welcome to "Tranquility Skies" where mountainside luxury, relaxation AND convenience unite! Our newly remodeled 2 BDRM/2 BATH luxury home (sleeps 8) is located only a short drive from downtown Gatlinburg!  Enjoy your evenings relaxing on the multi-level decks, sipping a glass of wine, and taking in the gorgeous mountain views.  With 2 separate living spaces to lounge in, two fireplaces, a large soaking tub, steamy sauna and scenic views, our lodge is designed for the perfect vacation!The space★INDOOR LIVING AND ENTERTAINMENT★Newly remodeled lodge with high-end furnishings! Wood burning fireplace in the main living room, with a smart TV and access to decks on multi levels to take in the serene views!★Upstairs Bedroom: King-sized bed with attached living space, electric fireplace, queen sleeper sofa and smart TV. Enjoy the newly remodeled soaking tub with attached bathroom AND sauna! It's like your very own personal spa-experience!★Lower-Level Bedroom: Queen-sized bed with attached bathroom★Living Room: Additional Queen-sized sleeper sofa ★OUTDOOR LIVING★Beautifully furnished multi-level decks with lounge chairs, large sectional couch and additional seating, large dining table, outdoor grill and mountain views!★KITCHEN★Fully equipped, modern kitchen with granite countertops and new stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, full size refrigerator, coffee maker, blender, Crockpot, toaster, grilling utensils + 4-person dining room table★ GENERAL AMENITIES★Complimentary starter toiletries, linens/towels, free WiFi, air conditioning, central heat, washer and dryer★PARKING★Parking available for two vehicles.★COUPONS AND DISCOUNTS★Shortly before you arrive I'll send you a coupon book with dozens and dozens of discounts for all of the top attractions in the area.  This includes the best dinner shows, pancake restaurants, adventure parks, museums and even an exotic animal park.  If you want inspiration for your vacation activities, this will definitely give you enough for your visit!★COOL THINGS TO DO IN THE AREA★Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg and Sevierville are the three main cities that comprise the area.  Everything is spread out a bit and there are amazing things to keep you busy...- World class hiking trails of all types and skill levels- Dollywood theme park (of course!)- Putt putt, go karts and pancake restaurants on every corner- Amazing dinner shows to entertain kids of all ages- Museums of all types:  classic cars, Alcatraz, Titanic and several childrens' museums- Restaurants of all types... Always come hungry because serving sizes are HUGE!
additional_house_rules:
Adults renters must be over the age of 25. Guests under the age of 21 must be accompanied by parents and/or adults over the age of 25. For security purposes, please provide a copy of your photo ID within 48 hours of booking or we reserve the right to cancel.

Any pets or extra people brought to the cabin are a rules violation and will result in an extra charge of $500 and immediate removal with no refund.  

WAIVER OF LIABILITY: You understand use of hot tub is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved in using the hot tub. You accept full responsibility for any bodily injury arising from use of the hot tub and hold owner harmless. You understand there are potential dangers that the hot tub may present to children who are not carefully supervised, as well as the danger to any person using the hot tub, or if a person has health risks, or if a person uses the hot tub while intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or uses the hot tub if pregnant.
interaction: We provide support generally via the app/this web site and phone support is there for emergencies. Expect a prompt response.Contact us now so we can begin arranging your perfect vacation!
transit: We strongly recommend you come with your car as that will give you the freedom to explore and enjoy the beautiful Smoky Mountains area. As you already know, we offer two parking spots.The mountain roads to all the cabins are windy (but paved), and you'll want to take it slow.  If there is hard ice on the roads (very rare as the sun burns it off) you'd want 4wd.  But I'd give that advice for any mountain cabin and not just this one. Let me know if you have any further questions and I'll be happy to help.
